actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: Actualite; Radio Okapi; Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo; 7 Sur 7
notes: Four events. On both 16 and 17 November 2019, clashes between FARDC and Ugandan ADF rebels were reported in the ADF strongholds of Chochota, 12 km northeast of Oicha, and of Mapubu in Bumbuba-Kisiki, Nord-Kivu. FARDC claimed to have taken control of Mapubu quarry on 16 November and Mapubu 3 on 17 November, and of Chochota valley and surrounding areas on 17 November, two days after claiming the control of 'Chute de Chochota' (a total of 7 strategic locations were reportedly taken over). Two ADF leaders and other rebels were reported killed (unknown reported fatalities coded as 10), along with 4 FARDC soldiers; 14 fatalities spread across four events. *Note that FARDC launched operations in the area on 30 October.

notes: On 4 November 2019, as an act of reprisal for an earlier attack, Mayi Mayi militiamen reportedly attacked the Banyamulenge community side of Kirumba village in Sud-Kivu, burning a number of houses but with no report of casualties.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 4 November 2019, hundreds of students from Trinity Institute in Bukavu, Sud-Kivu, reportedly held a protest and blocked traffic using barricades on the road going from Independence Square, in Kabumbu, to the Industrielle neighbourhood, to ask for classes to resume amidst a teachers' strike. [size=100]

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 4 November 2019, motorbike taxi drivers reportedly set a bus on fire after an altercation by the Terre Jaune bus stop in the east of Kinshasa, located near the Mikonga neighbourhood. [size=no report]

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Jean-Marie Faction
notes: On the evening of 3 November 2019, three citizens were reportedly shot and killed by Nyatura (Jean-Marie) Mayi Mayi gunmen in Katanda area of Lukweti locality in Bashali-Mukoto, Nord-Kivu.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
assoc_actor_2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: On 3 November 2019, clashes between NDC-R fighters on one side and fighters from CMC and Nyatura-FDLR on the other took place in Katsiru locality of Rutshuru territory, Nord-Kivu. NDC-R claimed to have taken over the locality and killed 11 fighters, while CMC claimed to have killed 8 fighters, denying the NDC-R takeover. Some sources reported clashes in the area since 3 November, while CMC claimed to have killed 20 NDC-R fighters, including those on 5 November, during clashes that took place over a week (12 additional fatalities coded over 2-4 November)

actor1: Islamic State (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 3 November 2019, the Islamic State in Central Africa claimed to have thwarted FARDC attacks in the area of Mayangose in Beni, Nord-Kivu, over the past two days, capturing a Congolese soldier and killing and injuring a number of others. Unknown reported fatalities coded as 10 and spread over 2 and 3 November.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the evening of 3 November 2019, artist and local activist Ishara Munyangura from Mushebere in Mbinga, Kalahe territory in Sud-Kivu, was reportedly kidnapped by unidentified armed men as he was walking with friends in Ndindi. He was found in Nyamukubi on 4 November, alive but tied up with signs of torture.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Ebola Response Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 3 November, unidentified assailants stabbed and killed a Ebola health-care volunteer in front of his home in Lwemba in Mambasa Teritory, Ituri Province. The attack comes as a new Ebola vaccine was set to be released in the area. One other injury reported.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 3 November 2019, the ADF pillaged and attacked a hospital in Vuhira village, situated 20km west of Mayimoya (Beni, Nord-Kivu), also abducting a few people that they later released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the evening of 3 November 2019, a citizen was reported killed by unidentified gunmen in Kabizo locality in Bwito chieftaincy, Nord-Kivu. The nature of the event - criminal or not - is unclear. This may be one of the 8 deaths by the ADF reported in Bwito, but this could not be confirmed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 2 November 2019, unidentified gunmen reportedly killed a man in his house in Chegera village, a few kilometers away from Katana, Sud-Kivu, also injuring a woman and a boy. The nature of the event - criminal or not - is unclear.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On the night between 2 and 3 November 2019, Mayi Mayi combatants reportedly took 12 fishermen and their four pirogues hostage in Birwa locality of Rutshuru by Lake Edouard, Nord-Kivu. They are asking for a ransom against their release.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 2 November 2019, clashes were reported in Mikenge, Kawera in Itombwe (coded to Magunda at GP2), Bijombo, Muravya, Mutara, Shenge, Magera, Lusuku and Mashura villages of Sud-Kivu, after some of these villages were set on fire by Ngumino militiamen. Although the protagonists of these events were not specified in the sources, clashes between Ngumino militiamen from the Banyamulenge community and Mayi Mayi fighters were simultaneously reported in Mikenge and Tulambo villages after attacks by Ngumino militiamen (DRC15916 and DRC15917).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 2 November 2019, the FARDC clashed with a Mayi Mayi militia at dawn in Maleki town (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They had formed in response to the recent ADF attack on Tenambo, which is nearby. No fatalities or injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 2 November 2019, FARDC reportedly attacked Mayi Mayi militiamen in Baiti village of Beni territory, Nord-Kivu, and killed two of them. They also burnt their encampment.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On the morning of 2 November 2019, local residents of Kitutu in Mwenga territory, Sud-Kivu, reportedly injured a policeman after police forces arrived in Regeza neighbourhood, too late according to residents, to investigate a robbery that led to the injury of a woman the night before. [size=no report]

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Ebola Response Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: RFI; BBC News; Actualite; 7 Sur 7; Bunia Actualite
notes: On the evening of 2 November 2019, attackers believed to be Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen raided the house of journalist and Ebola response worker Papy Mumbere Mahamba in Lwemba city in Babila-Babombi chieftaincy, Ituri, and stabbed him to death with machetes and seriously injured his wife, also an Ebola response worker, before setting fire to their house. Two suspects were later arrested. Mahamba was coming back from a talk show on Lwemba's community radio in which he raised awareness on Ebola.

notes: On the night between 1 and 2 November 2019, two Kalunas reportedly assassinated a policeman in Dingi-Dingi neighbourhood of Kisenso in Kinshaa for unknown reasons. Two suspects were later arrested. It is unclear if the policeman was on duty or not.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 1 November 2019, taxi drivers reportedly staged demonstrations in several areas of Kinshasa to denounce the recent killings of 2 of their colleagues by policemen earlier in the week. In Lingwala commune, demonstrators stopped other taxi drivers who were working and forced their clients out of their cars. [size=no report]

notes: On 1 November 2019, a 75-year-old Banyamulenge woman was raped and then killed by Mayi-Mayi combatants in Rugezi village, in Uvira territory (Sud-Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 1 November 2019, FARDC reportedly thwarted an attack of unidentified gunmen in Maleki village of Nord-Kivu, with no report of fatalities nor injuries.

actor1: APSC: Alliance of Patriots for the Salvation of Congo
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 1 November 2019, two APSC Mayi Mayi leaders and a number of their combatants reportedly handed themselves over to the national police in the locality of Mangina in Beni, Nord-Kivu.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 1 November 2019, LUCHA and Filimbi movements protested against the appointments of local mayors by the government. Between 22-24 militants from the LUCHA and Filimbi movements were reportedly arrested in Kananga, Kasai-Central, by Congolose police. They were released 3 hours later. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On both 31 October and 1 November 2019, FARDC reportedly shelled positions of the Ugandan ADF in Mayangose locality, 10 km north of Beni in Nord-Kivu, with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported. Note that FARDC announced the launch of large-scale operations against domestic and local armed groups in Beni region on 31 October.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: On 1 November 2019, two unidentified gunmen reportedly carried out a drive-by shooting targeting a Congolese soldier and killed him while he was off-duty in his house in Kalinda neighbourhood of Mulekera commune in Beni city.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia

A number of houses were reportedly set on fire by Mayi Mayi militiamen before FARDC intervened and captured some of them. Local residents fled towards the high plateau of Uvira.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 31 October 2019, in Beni city of Nord-Kivu, starting in the Bel Air roundabout, militants of the LUCHA social movement protested against the pending assistance from foreign militaries in DRC in the fight against ADF rebels. [size=no report]

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On 31 October 2019, the second of the two hostages kidnapped by FDLR-RUD rebels in Rubare locality of Rutshuru territory, Nord-Kivu, on 20 October was reportedly killed as he was detained in Changwi village of Rutshuru territory. *Note that the first hostage was killed on 30 October.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 31 October 2019, unidentified gunmen reportedly killed two men on a motorcycle near the village of Mukohwa in Masisi territory, Nord-Kivu, as they were travelling from Masisi to Nyabiondo. The reasons behind this killing are not reported.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: Unidentified Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 31 October 2019, MONUSCO blue helmets claimed to have carried out warning shots around their temporary base of Mikenge in Mwenga territory, Sud-Kivu, after they heard gun shots and witnessed smoke some 5 km from the base. They reported that these warning shots were aimed at protecting the 800 IDPs who have settled near the base and specified that there was no direct contact with the militias that fired the shots. Although blue helmets could not confirm the origin of the shots, Banyamulenge, Bafulero, Babembe and Banyindu ethnic militias are known to operate in the area.

notes: On 31 October 2019, FARDC announced the launch of large-scale operations targeting domestic and foreign armed groups that operate in the Great Lake region, in the east of the country, in Beni, Butembo, Lubero, Nord-Kivu and Sud-Kivu. The offensive primarily targets the Ugandan ADF, but also Congolese Mayi Mayi groups and the Rwandan FDLR and the Burundese FNL. FARDC announced that operations will be supported by the MONUSCO.

notes: On 31 October 2019, citizens of Bukavu reportedly followed president of political movement Together for Change Moise Katumbi after a public meeting to denounce his alleged role in the stealing of USD 15 millions. [size=no report]

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On 30 October 2019, NDC-R Mayi Mayi fighters reportedly killed a man in the locality of Mushigha, 10 km from Bunyatenge, Nord-Kivu, after he refused to pay his monthly fee.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On the night between 30 and 31 October 2019, FARDC reportedly shelled 'rebel' positions in Nyaleke locality of Beni region, Nord-Kivu, with artillery. No casualties were reported. While there was no information on the 'rebel' positions, FARDC were reported to target positions of the Ugandan ADF on both 31 October and 1 November in the region. ADF coded as Actor2.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
source: Radio Okapi; Twitter; Kivu Security Tracker
notes: On 30 October 2019, one of the two hostages kidnapped by FDLR-RUD rebels in Rubare locality of Rutshuru territory, Nord-Kivu, on 20 October was reportedly killed. His body was found in Shinda area of Busanza.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Since 30 October 2019, military forces killed 80 elements of the ADF including 4 of their commanders in the area of Beni. The military got back the locations of Mayangose, Tsotsota, Mwalika and Kididiwe.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 30 October 2019, a 20-year old woman was reportedly raped by a member of the FARDC in Bishusha area of Nord-Kivu, Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 30 October 2019, the dead body of an FARDC soldier was reportedly found in Nyabanira area of Binza in Nord-Kivu, Rutshuru territory. His weapon had been taken.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 30 October 2019, following the killing of Vijana Hospital director, on Bukama Avenue of Kinshasa, commune of Lingwala, by a Congolose policeman, citizens reportedly set fire to a police Jeep that was in the area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 30 October 2019, the director of a civil society organisation in Isale locality of Bashu chieftaincy, Nord-Kivu, Jean-Marc Kinzagu, was reportedly killed by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 30 October 2019, an unspecified number of people reportedly took to the streets of Goma to commemorate the victims of a march on 30 October 2018 in the context of the presidential elections, asking for justice to be done. [size=no report]

actor1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
notes: On 30 October 2019, suspected CODECO assailants reportedly killed a young man in Dhedro area of Bahema-Nord chieftaincy (coded at Blukwa, chief-city of Bahema-Nord), in Djugu territory.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: Top Congo FM Kinshasa; AFP; Le Potentiel
notes: On 30 October 2019, a Congolose policeman (part of the guard of provincial minister of Interior of Kinshasa, Dolly Makambo) shot and killed the Administrative Director of Vijana Hospital on Bukama Avenue of Kinshasa, commune of Lingwala, after the latter allegedly refused the spoliation of a piece of land on which the hospital is built.

notes: On 29 October 2019, several hundreds of Mayi Mayi fighters (between 500 and more than 820 depending on sources), most of them from the UPLC, reportedly handed over their weapons to FARDC in Kalunguta locality of Nord-Kivu, in a ceremony presided by Congolese Chief of Staff Mbala Musese, as part of the pacification process in the east of the country.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Biloze Bishambuke)
assoc_actor_2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 28 October 2019, Biloze Bishambuke Mayi Mayi combatants reportedly intercepted IDPs who were coming from Itombwe with their cattle to settle in Bijombo region, robbed them of everything and torched their Banyamulenge host villages, including Kyanzovu, Mashur, and Rusuku (coded to Uvira at GP2). The attacks spread across both 28 and 29 October, leading some residents to flee into the bush and others to make their way towards Uvira and Minenbwe. Mayi Mayi fighters were reportedly supported by Burundese RED-TABARA rebels at least in Bijombo-centre on 29 October.

They were allegedly released on 31 October, after the payment of a USD 1,200 ransom.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: La Prunelle; Twitter; Actualite; Sauti Ya Congo; 7 Sur 7; Radio Okapi; CRDH; La Libre Afrique; HRW; La Prosperite; Politico (DRC); AFP
notes: On 30 June, in Goma, unspecified amount of Lamuka members and others demonstrated against decision of the constitutional court on invalidation of dozens of opposition candidates. Police dispersed the demonstration using tear gas and live ammunition. Demonstrators reportedly resisted their dispersal, with some sources reporting demonstrators using rocks. One demonstrator was shot and killed by police, 1 injured and 3 arrested. The police, claimed some of the demonstrators were armed with firearms (although no reports of an armed clash). This marked first violent dispersion of a rally and first death of a demonstrator under Tshisekedi presidency. [size=no report]

actor1: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyindu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mtetezi Militia
notes: 10 May 2019. Communal clashes continued between the Ngumino and the Banyindu and Bafuliru, in alliance with or under the leadership of Mtetezi, in the Tanganyika region of Fizi and Minembwe region. During the clashes, the villages of Kigazura, Marunde, Kivogera, and Turambo were burned (no coordinates available). Many locals have been displaced by the communal violence following the murder of a Banyindu chief on 04/05.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 09 May 2019. The NDC-Renove attacked APCLS in the Shoa, Osso-Banyungu (no coordinates available). The APCLS repelled the NDC-Renove.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 09 May 2019. After the NDC-Renove attacked their forces in Shoa,  the APCLS attacked the NDC-Renove in Loashi. The village was looted by the fighters and civilians fled the area. Local sources accused the FARDC of supporting the NDC-Renove during the clash, which the military and other community leaders denied. The NDC-Renove remained in Loashi, while the APCLS combatants maintained control of Shoa and Buabo.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 May 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi militia launched an attack in Butembo, reportedly in an attempt to free a captured combatant at a local hospital. The attackers killed one police officer who was guarding the facility. The FARDC responded and clashed with the attackers. The military reported seven fatalities on the attackers side, while city officials reported a dozen.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 May 2019. An unidentified armed group, consisting of approximately 100 fighters, attacked Blukwa, Djugu (some sources report the attack occurred in the Lea village). The FARDC contingent in the town was outnumbered and did not engage the attackers. The assailants killed at least two children (some sources report three). They also burned five homes, killed livestock, and pillaged the village. MONUSCO forces intervened and repelled the attackers.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

A motor-taxi driver broke through the barricaded road, and other motorcyclist followed. The students and motorcyclists began throwing rocks at each other. The motorcyclists also damaged property at the ISP Gombe institute. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

One of the Eco-Guards was killed but the FARDC and other Eco-Guards responded and intervened to save the other.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 22 April 2019. The FNL ambushed a bus in Kahwizi (aka Muhungu), as it was traveling from Bukavu to Uvira. The assailants assaulted the driver and looted the passengers. They also set the bus, as well as a civilian's motorcycle on fire.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: 22 April - 06 May 2019. Prisoners took control of the central prison of Kananga and refused access to guards and administrators into the facility. During the night of 06/05, an unknown number escaped the prison, including Kamonia Nsapu elements. The suspects on trial for the murder of the UN experts were also among the escapees. Those who remained continued to prevent prison officials from entering the facility. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 21 April 2019 (on or before). A soldier raped a pregnant woman in Katwa, Nyiragongo (no coordinates available). The perpetrator was arrested.

actor1: Bosonalongo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bosozaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 April 2019. Following the ruling on a land dispute between the Bosonalongo and Bosozaya villages in the Kungu territory, a group of Bosonalongo residents armed with traditional weapons attacked Bosozaya, Kungu (no coordinates available) and clashed with local residents. Three Bosozaya were seriously injured and one Bosonalongo attacker was slightly injured. The attackers burned 43 homes, two schools, and destroyed agricultural fields.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. Soldiers began firing their weapons in Demba around the territorial administration building, following the death of one of their colleagues due to overconsumption of alcohol (the soldiers suspected he was poisoned).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Cameroon); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Cameroon); WHO: World Health Organization
notes: 19 April 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi group attacked the Catholic University of Graben's Clinic in Butembo, which operates as part of the WHO's Ebola response. The assailants killed a Cameroonian doctor and burned a vehicle. According to a witness, the assailants claimed Ebola was not real and the doctors were killing people by claiming it was.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 19 April 2019. Intelligence officers arrested a woman carrying 23 magazines of ammunition and 690 cartridges in Mulongwe, Uvira. The woman was detained while boarding a bus to Fizi, with the ammunition hidden in her luggage.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Militia (Ditunga)
notes: 18 April 2019 (on or before). Kabue Ditunga (aka 'General'), who had voluntarily disarmed after the 2018 presidential elections, recruited five male youth in Kananga. Ditunga (who is armed), along with the youth, extort the civilian population of Kananga.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Mayi Mayi militiamen killed a doctor in the University's clinic the next day (coded in separate event).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: Between 6 February and 11 March [coded as 5 events between the period], in Uvira area, Sukola II operation led by FARDC against local and foreign-armed groups, including RED Tabara resulted in 37 enemy combatant casualties and the capture or surrender of 52 combatants and the recovery of their weapons and ammunition.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 February. The FARDC launched an attack on Mayi Mayi forces along the Karuruma-Kyavinyonge road in Virunga National Park. Three Mayi Mayi were killed and two were captured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a man from Kambake, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 19 February 2019. The LRA looted food and other items from Aaru, Haut-Uele.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 19 February 2019. The LRA looted seven civilians along the road 3 km west of Kpaika, Dungu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February 2019. Two armed men ambushed a motorbike near Digba, Ango. The assailants tied the driver to a tree and raped the two female passengers. They also looted the victims.

actor1: Bana Mura
assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February 2019. Bana Mura combatants attacked and killed 15 Luba civilians, including six women, in Tshiniota, Kasai (no coordinates available). The attack followed broadcasts by Chokwe journalists on radio stations calling for violence.

actor1: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
notes: On 19 February 2019, the NDC militia killed a man in Kabasha village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February. Residents of the Gyamba neighborhood in Bukavu barricaded Road 2, which leads from Bukavu through the Ruzizi border crossing, for a second day. The residents protested the cut off of their water supply four months prior. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February. Unidentified gunmen killed a man in Kagunga, Uvira. Local sources believe the attack may have stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. Approximately 300 police officers demonstrated in Gbadolite over three months of back payments owed to them.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. The FARDC captured an ADF fighter in Gawa, Beni. They also seized a machine gun.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. The NDC-Renove attacked the FARDC, as they were attempting to establish a base in Kyuto, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The NDC-R forced the FARDC to retreat from the town. Five soldiers were killed and one militia member was wounded.

actor1: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
assoc_actor_2: Loashi Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February. The APCLS-Mapenzi tortured the Loashi village chief, who died from his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a nurse from his home in Ishango. His body was later discovered in Graben - inside the Virunga National Park, which many armed groups operate out of. The murder prompted a strike of health workers in the Vuhovi zone over insecurity.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
notes: 18 February. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa ambushed two passenger vehicles in Rushima (no coordinates available, located between Kiliba and Uvira). The assailants looted the property of the passengers.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 February. Residents of the Gyamba neighborhood in Bukavu barricaded Road 2, which leads from Bukavu through the Ruzizi border crossing. The residents protested the cut off of their water supply four months prior. No indication of the number of demonstrators.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 18 February, in Ngite, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2, injuring 1 and abducting 1.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. Approximately 350 police deployed to Uvira in December protested and barricaded highway 5 in Rugenge. The police demonstrated over 3-4 months of backpay which they have not received. The demonstrators reportedly charged civilians to cross through the barricade. Military forces intervened to restore order.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa attempted to steal cattle in Kahanda but the FARDC repelled the group.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. ADF forces attacked Mavivi. The FARDC responded and the groups clashed for two hours. Two civilians were killed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 18 February 2019, two people were attacked and injured by presumed ADF fighters in Ngite village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Kidjangala in Kanga, Uvira. Two militia members were killed during the operations in Kabere, Kanga, and Kahungu (the fatalities were disaggregated between locations).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Kidjangala in Kabere, Uvira. Two militia members were killed during the operations in Kabere, Kanga, and Kahungu (the fatalities were disaggregated between locations).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Kidjangala in Kahungu, Uvira. Two militia members were killed during the operations in Kabere, Kanga, and Kahungu (the fatalities were disaggregated between locations).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. The FARDC killed two Mayi Mayi combatants and destroyed Mayi Mayi camps in the Beni territory. Four militia members were captured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 17 February. Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a CENI warehouse and a residence owned by Kabila in Beni (unclear if in Beni town or territory). Police, military, and MONUSCO forces repelled the attackers.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Lukoba)
notes: 17 February. The Raia Mutomboki Lukoba and Ndarumanga ambushed three motorcyclist outside of Nyombe, Shabunda. The assailants looted goods and forced six civilians to carry the goods.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. A soldier shot and killed another soldier in Ramba. The soldier had reportedly called the perpetrator a Rwandan.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. The FARDC forced civilians to carry their belongings as they relocated to Kitindi, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the Mugunga and Majengo neighborhoods of Goma. The attackers killed six civilians. A military uniform was later discovered near Virunga National Park where the assailants fled after the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group (believed to be the same group which attacked Goma town) killed two civilians in the Nyiragongo territory. After the attacks the group reportedly fled into Virunga National Park.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Mayi Mayi Kavumbi in Lwama, Masisi in an effort to gain control of the town.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Nyatura Jean Marie, between Lukweti and Nyange Bibwe, in Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: 16 February. The FARDC attacked the FNL Nzabampema in Busisi, Uvira (no coordinates available). Six militia members were killed. The FARDC also burned down their homes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 16 February, in Masilikwede (near Kamango), the ADF clashed with FARDC. 5 soldiers were killed and 3 were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Artisanal miners protested in Rubaya and Gakombe (no coordinates available) against a reduction in their salaries.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 15 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with APCLS and Nyatura-Jean Marie forces in Hembe, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). Five combatants were killed and six people were wounded, including three civilians.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: February (month of), an unidentified armed group abducted four girls between 4 and 7 years old from Kajuchu, Kabare (no coordinates available). Three days after their abduction their bodies were found, with their genitals removed.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: In February [coded to 15 February], near Rutare, a group of approximately 4000 CNRD elements established new base.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Residents of Masisi and Nyabiondo protested calling for the restoration of security in the region and the resumption of medical services by MSF - who suspended activities in the region after staff members were temporarily abducted.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. FARDC forces, on the Congo River bank outside of Lowa, Tsopo fired at Mayi Mayi Mesandu forces, who took control of Lowa a few days prior.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. Angry residents attacked a hand washing station - a part of the Ebola response - in Mambasa, Ituri. The residents opposed the Ebola vaccination campaign and were angry that locals were not hired as part of the response. Soldiers and police responded by firing into the air to disperse the group. A woman was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. The FARDC killed two ADF leaders - Kibuye Kajuju (aka Kadjadju and Canada) and Richard Mugisa (aka MTM)- in Mamove, Oicha.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Reunion)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. 25 Mayi Mayi Reunion members voluntarily disarmed at the FARDC base in Mboko. Another 14 Mayi Mayi combatants surrendered to the FARDC on the 17th in Lusambo, Fizi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
notes: 15 February. Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru attacked Rumondo, Kalehe and abducted four boys.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 14 February. FNL rebels ambushed two buses in Kagunga, Uvira. Two people were killed and 14 were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 February. Residents of Rwangoma and LUCHA members protested, calling for increased security and the release of those abducted during the 07/02 attacks on the town.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. Police officers in Beni shot into the air in protest of their salary payments, which was less than they had expected. Those responsible were arrested.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 14 February, in Oicha, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC. 1 soldier has been injured and 1 civilian killed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Mbulu near Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The military killed three militia members and freed a hostage (who was abducted by the group on 11/02).

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 13 February. ADF combatants killed three civilians traveling to Mamove, on the Oicha-Mamove road.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 February, in Mulolya, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: Between 6 February and 11 March [coded as 5 events between the period], in Uvira area, Sukola II operation led by FARDC against local and foreign-armed groups, including RED Tabara resulted in 37 enemy combatant casualties and the capture or surrender of 52 combatants and the recovery of their weapons and ammunition.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 February. At least 200 nurses and health care workers from the Uvira territory gathered in Bukavu to demand over-due benefits.

actor1: Civilians (South Sudan)
notes: 12 February (on or before). Over the course of a few days, approximately 5,000 refugees fleeing violence in South Sudan crossed into Congolese villages along the border, near Ingbokolo.

actor1: CCU: United Congolese Convention
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo; CCU: United Congolese Convention
notes: 12 February. Justin Omookala, of the CCU, held a governorship campaign march in Lusambo, Sankuru. Youth from the FCC opposition threw rocks at the CCU members. Some sources indicate that the groups began street fighting and the police intervened with live ammunition, killing one and injuring others. However, other sources reported that Justin Omookala's bodyguard shot at the opposition, resulting in the death and injuries.

actor1: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A clash occurred in Mituku-Bamoya (no coordinates available, located in the Ubundu territory) between supporters of the new Bakeka groupment leader and supporters of the old leader. The clash resulted in several wounded from machetes.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. An unidentified armed group attacked national park guards in Museya, Beni. The guards, along with the FARDC, repelled the attackers, killing two.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mesandu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. Mayi Mayi Mesandu forces seized control of Lowa, Tshopo forcing the FARDC to withdraw from the city. Most of the civilian population also fled.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. A soldier killed a civilian in Kibongo (no coordinates available), near Nyamilima, after the civilian refused to transport the soldier's belongings.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A Batwa militia attacked Amiko (no coordinates available; in the Bendera region). The group looted the village and abducted women, who they took into the bush to rape. The abductees were later released.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. Local residents in Mavono, Butembo set fire to the Ebola health center in the town. Reasons unclear.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 11 February 2019, two people were killed during an incursion by presumed ADF fighters into Mamove village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 11 February. The ADF attacked an FARDC position in Mamove, Beni. The rebels also looted the town and attempted to abduct civilians. Local civil society organizations report four rebels killed and four abductees freed. The military reported a dozen rebel fatalities (coded at lowest estimate).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mbulu abducted a man from Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

notes: 11 February. FDLR-RUD combatants abducted a man from Mirumba, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the FARDC in Ndombi, Oicha.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two people from Nyamugali, Uvira. The assailants demanded a ransom of $2,500.

notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. notes: 10 February. Nyatura combatants clashed with the NDC-Renove in Nyampanika and Kashanje (no coordinates available for either village, coded as one event at Mokoto prec2), in the Bashali region.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 10 February (on or around). An unidentified armed group ambushed MONUSCO and FARDC forces along the Beni-Butembo road.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 09 February. LRA attacked civilians near Bulumasi, Bas Uele. They killed a man from CAR and abducted 12 civilians, including three women and two children. The abductees, with the exception of one of the boys were released on 11/02.

actor1: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
notes: On 9 February 2019, elements of the Mayi Mayi Nduma militia killed a man in Mambale village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 9 Feb 2019, an FARDC soldier killed a woman with a machete in Lyakobo neighborhood of Beni town. The FARDC soldier attempted to rape the victim who resisted.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 February (on or around). During the weekend, FARDC forces destroyed a rebel training center in the Wango forest, near Largu. The attack was part of an operation against the group operating in the Djugu territory. Six rebels were killed during the three hours of clashes.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 08 February. MONUSCO launched an offensive against the ADF in the Mayangose Forest (no coordinates available) in Beni.

notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group abducted two MSF employees from Bitoy (no coordinates available near Masisi town). The assailants released the abductees later that evening.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group attacked Mundiba. The group killed one elderly man and injured his wife. The perpetrators also set four houses on fire.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 February. Approximately 140 Kamwina Nsapu combatants voluntarily disarmed in Kamako. Female youth were among the group participating in disarmament.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Nyolo (no coordinates available), in the Djugu territory. The armed group has been utilizing the town as a base for launching attacks in the territory.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. Prisoners escaped from the Tshikapa prison. The prisoners injured a guard and stole his gun as they escaped through a hole in a wall. Nine prisoners were killed as guards attempted to capture them, two police and two former militia members were also killed. Eight other escapees were injured.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 February. The FDLR-FOCA attacked a FARDC site at Itabi (no coordinate available, located in Masisi). The attackers beheaded two soldiers.

actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: 08 February. FDLR FOCA forces attacked the FARDC in Tabi (no coordinates available, in the Burungu region) Masisi territory, killing three soldiers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 8 February, at PK 9 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 2 and injuring 3 soldiers (no further details available).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. A woman was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators in Urii, Mahagi (no coordinates available, 19 km from Mahagi town). The assailants also removed the woman's genitals. Her body was discovered the following day. Local residents believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08 February 2019. Raia Mutomboki- Kokodikoko attacked Kabikokole, Mwenga (coordinates are approximate). The assailants reportedly raped 100 women. They also looted the town and burned a health center.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 8 February, in Kudukudu, ADF attacked civilians, killing 4, including a child and injuring 2.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February (on or around). The corpse of a woman was found in Ariwara, Ituri. The victim's genitals had been removed. Some locals believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February. Students at the University of Kisangani, who rioted over the arrest of two students the day prior, continued to destroy property. The students attacked professor's homes and property. One woman was reportedly assaulted by the rioters.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Around 7 February 2019 (as reported), the body of a handcuffed man was found lifeless in the Loulo river in Mabalako (Beni, Nord-Kivu) after being detained by the PNC. The military reported that their death came after they were liberated by a Mayi-Mayi militia.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 7 February 2019, presumed ADF fighters attacked four people, three of whom were Batwa, in Mavivi (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 7 February 2019, presumed ADF fighters attacked Rwangoma quarter in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), raping a woman and killing seven people. 7 people were also kidnapped.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 07 February (on or before). An armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked Rwangoma. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers (clash coded separately) but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children - the body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. LUCHA members demonstrated in Goma against a barrier at the port. Police intervened and arrested seven demonstrators.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. ADF combatants attacked the FARDC in the Mbua Kamango region.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: Radio Okapi; Kivu Security Tracker; UN (unspecified); Radio Moto
notes: On 7 February, in Rwangoma, an unidentified armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked civilians, killing 6, injuring 2, abducting 8, including 6 children. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. The body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. A group of Mayi Mayi set fire to a FARDC site in Buzumba (no coordinates available), Masisi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: Between 6 February and 11 March [coded as 5 events between the period], in Uvira area, Sukola II operation led by FARDC against local and foreign-armed groups, including RED Tabara resulted in 37 enemy combatant casualties and the capture or surrender of 52 combatants and the recovery of their weapons and ammunition. Twelve related-fatalities separately recoded, remaining 25 spread between 5 events during the time frame.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 February. University of Kisangani students demonstrated calling for the release of two students arrested in a murder case. The demonstrators burned school and teacher vehicles.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February (on or before). A soldier was attacked with machetes by an unidentified group in Rwangoma.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. Residents of Goma demonstrated after a police officer killed a teenager the prior night. The demonstrators set fire to the police station in Keshero, where the incident had occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 05 February. The FARDC was deployed to the Kigoma region of Uvira in response to the presence of Red TABARA. Upon learning of the deployment, the armed group fled the area and the FARDC has reestablished government control of the region.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. FARDC forces attacked three Mayi Mayi Charles combatants in Buramba, Rutshuru. One Mayi Mayi member was killed and weapons were seized.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 05 February. The UPLC attacked the Kasitu (no coordinates available) health center in the Vuhovi area. The attackers burned the mattresses in the center.

assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: 04 February. The UPLC attacked a prison in Mabalako, releasing two members who had been captured during clashes on 31/01.

The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 February. Residents of the Keshero neighborhood of Goma caught a robber and police intervened to prevent the mob from attacking the robber. One police officer opened fire on the crowd of locals trying to disperse the mob, killing a teenage girl and injuring two male youths.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. Firefighters protested in Kinshasa over the government's failure to pay their salaries for 38 months.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February. Following the murder of a civilian by a soldier in Yamokolo, the victims family brought the body to the territorial administrative office. Upon learning of the incident, Basoko residents gathered to protest the killing. Military forces opened fire to disperse the demonstrators, but ran out of ammunition. At which point, the mob attacked a soldier and burned him alive. The group also ransacked the police station and freed nine detainees.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February. A soldier shot and killed a civilian in Yamokolo, Basoko.

notes: 03 February. A female prisoner was whipped 100 times after refusing advances from the prison director. The prisoner was transferred to a hospital for medical treatment.

notes: 01 January. Residents of Kindu demonstrated against increased insecurity in the city, following the murder of a merchant the day prior. The demonstrators suspect police forces are behind the insecurity and attacked the Kindu police station. Police forces responded with tear gas and live ammunition. Two students were shot, according to Radio Okapi they were killed while Actualite reported they were injured. The demonstrators also attacked a radio station, where a police officer was hiding. Military forces were deployed to restore order.
