actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 24 January. Red TABARA combatants clashed with Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kishagala, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) at a bar. One Kihebe combatant and one civilian were killed, while one other civilian was wounded.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 24 January. The ADF ambushed an Okapi Logistics, NGO convoy near Kisiki. The assailants killed three and injured three during the robbery.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 January (on or before). The body of a murdered two-year old child was found in the Cikonyi neighborhood of Bukavu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 24 January, in Mayimoya, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, injuring 1 soldier. Additionally 3 civilians were killed and 3 injured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 24 January (on or before). ADF forces ambushed drivers on RN 4, in Kisiki-Mayimoya. Three people were killed, two were injured. Three Okapi vehicles were also intercepted but the drivers were not harmed.

actor1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_1: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 24 January. Felix Tshisekedi was inaugurated as president of the DRC.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 24 January. A Mayi Mayi group attacked soldiers based outside of Uvira city. Three soldiers were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 26 January, in Malolu, unidentified armed group attacked civilians, injuring 1.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 24 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with the Nyatura Nzayi in Nyabura (no coordinates available; located in the Bahali-Mokoto district).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. Three armed men tortured a woman in Rutare, Kalehe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker). The woman died of her injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. An unidentified armed group raided home and abducted a man in Mbuhi-Pilote.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ngandu)
notes: 23 January. The Raia Mutomboki Mungoro clashed with the Raia Mutomboki Ngandu after the Ngandu group looted a cow and goats from Nguku, Walikale (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The Mungoro combatants recovered the stolen livestock.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The UPLC abducted three members of MONUSCO in Kisalala. Shortly after the abduction, the FARDC freed the abductees.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The military arrested Kamate Mungumwa and Muhindo Mbiriki, two leaders of the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kirumba. The leaders were unarmed at the time of arrest.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
notes: 23 January. Prisoners in the Mbuji Mayi escaped through a tunnel. Guards opened fire on the inmates to prevent their escape. Some sources report five fatalities, while others indicate nine, including a prison guard.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 23 January, in Kididiwe, unidentified armed group attacked civilians, injuring 1. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
notes: 23 January. Charles Kakule's militia abducted 30 fishermen on Lake Edward. Some of the abductees managed to escape, while the others were released following ransom payments.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Mwenga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. An armed group attacked the Ruvungi market in Burhini, killing five and seriously injuring two others. The perpetrators targeted gold buyers. Other sources indicated that the attacked occurred in the Kakwende village in Mwenga, and resulted in the death of five assailants, one soldier, and one civilian. This source also noted that the civilian population defended itself against the attackers.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 22 Jan 2019, a policeman shot and killed a woman in Butare village of Masisi territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
notes: 22 January. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa abducted a man from Narunanga, Uvira. The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 22 January. The Nyatura Bohoza faction clashed with the APCLS in Nyabyara and Luala (no coordinates available), near Kahira in Masisi. Four civilians and seven fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
notes: 22 January. Imbonerakure clashed with Red TABARA, FNL and Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kifuni (no coordinates available), in the Kigoma area. The Imbonerakure pushed the armed groups into the Kitavuka Mbegere forest. Movements of Burundi military forces and Imbonerakure were reported across the border into the Kigoma area of DRC the same day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Chuyi)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January 2019. The Mayi Mayi Chuyi ambushed an FARDC convoy along the road from Kabambare to Pene-Mende (35 km south of Kilembwe). One militia member was killed and three soldiers were injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Largu. The military reported three soldiers and five rebel fatalities. However, civil society has reported four military fatalities. Civil society reported the group looted arms from a military depot in town but the FARDC denied the report.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with the Simba militia in Dembele (coordinates are approximate based on reports that the village is 15-17 km from Nia Nia, along the Kisangani road). The groups leaders, Manu and Abley, were killed along with five other members of the militia.

actor1: Militia (Moise Tshiombe)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. Moise Tshiombe's militia crossed paths with the FARDC in Demba, as the armed group was traveling to Kananga to disarm. The soldiers attempted to disarm the militia on the spot, sparking a clash between the groups. One soldier was killed. Much of the local population fled, fearing retaliation by the military.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
notes: 22 January. Kakule's militia abducted 39 fishermen (other sources indicated 20) on Lake Edward.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On 21 Jan 2019, the NDC Guidon attacked a Nyatura Nzayi position in Munongo village of Masisi territory. NDC Guidon militants chased Nyatura Nzayi fighters from their position. A man drowned during their escape.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An unidentified group abducted two men from the Benengule neighborhood of Beni. The assailants tortured one of the abductees before releasing him. The man died of his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. Two unidentified armed men killed an elderly woman in the Rukangaga area of Kiliba, Uvira.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group (suspected to be the same that carried out attacks in Rutobogo earlier on the same day), attacked Kimoka during the night. The perpetrators raped two women, killed another, and wounded three men.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 21 January, in Mapobu, the  ADF attacked and killed 25 FARDC soldiers and injured 22 other. Additionally 5 soldiers were reported missing. The UN Group of Experts collected evidence that corroborated this information. During the same period, several sources witnessed a high number of injured ADF combatants brought back to ADF camps, indicating their involvement in attacks and clashes. FARDC seized a type 80 general purpose machine gun from an ADF combatant.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. Police dispersed Lamuka supporters who gathered at the MLC headquarters in Kinshasa to listen to Martin Fayulu.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 21 January. The LRA barricaded the Dungu-Doruma road at Kana village. They then abducted 15 people and looted property, food, and money.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group shot at an Oxfam vehicle in Rutobogo (coordinates are approximate, based on location 2 km west of Sake) and raped two women. The driver escaped. The armed group then ambushed a motorbike, killing two riders, while one managed to escape. Locals indicated that this group is also responsible for abductions in the area but provided no further details.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January. Unidentified armed men killed two men and robbed a home in Kitchanga.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January. An unidentified armed group attacked a minibus near Kayna, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), abducting five passengers and robbing them. They demanded a ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shabani)
notes: 20 January. Raia Mutomboki Shabani combatants attacked a group of Nyatura Nduhuye in the mining area of Kimoto, Kalehe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Three Nduhuye fighters and one Shabani combatant were killed.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with Nyatura-Nzayi in Kinyana, Masisi (no coordinates available). Five Nzayi combatants, one NDC-R fighter, and four civilians were killed.

actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 20 January. Red TABARA forces attacked military forces of Burundi and their allies, Mayi Mayi Kijangala, in Mulenge, Uvira. Eighteen died during the clash.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January. An unidentified armed group shot and wounded a motorcyclist near Kulugbangu, Haut Uele. The group may have links to LRA as the event was reported by source tracking LRA activity.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: 20 January (on or around). The FARDC and Eco Guards clashed with the Kakule militia, securing the release of 39 hostages being held by the group.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. Clashes between the NDC-Renove and Nyatura-Nzayi continued in Munongo Kakonse (no coordinates available, in the Mokoto district). Six people were killed including two civilians.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 20 January. The LRA ambushed three people on bikes along the Nambia-Bagandi road in Mabadabada village (no coordinates available, located in the Niangara territory). The perpetrators seriously injured one and looted their belongings.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
notes: 20 January. Imbonerakure attacked Red TABARA, FNL and Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kihinga. The Imbonerakure forced the other armed groups out of the area. Five fatalities were reported in clashes in Kihinga and Nabahuri (coded as three fatalities in Kihinga and two in Nabahuri).

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
notes: 20 January. Imbonerakure attacked Red TABARA, FNL and Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Nabahuri (no coordinates available; located in the Mulenge region). The Imbonerakure took control of the area. Five fatalities were reported in clashes in Kihinga and Nabahuri (coded as three fatalities in Kihinga and two in Nabahuri).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 January. LRA forces ambushed and looted 10 motorist along the road 10 km north of Kapili, Haut Uele. The group also abducted the Mbiangu chief, who they released the following day.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 19 January. The NDC-Renove clashed with Nzayi's Nyatura faction in the Muzimo area of Mokoto, as both groups seek control of the area. Three Nyatura fighters and one NDC fighter were killed.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 January. Police fired tear gas to disperse crowds that gathered in Lubumbashi to welcome the return of Jean Muyambo, president of SCODE following his four year imprisonment in Kinshasa.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 January 2019. A Batwa militia, along with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba, raided the Majengo mine, in the northeastern area of the Bendera territory.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 18 January. The FARDC clashed with the CNRD in Buguri (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map), in Masisi. Five soldiers and two rebels were killed.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On 18 January, in Kivuye, around 4000 CNRD members including 400 combatants left the group's stronghold and moved south towards South Kivu Province. The movement has been caused by growing number of attacks directed at the group.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change; FDR: Forces of Renewal; ECCHA: Citizen Engagement for Change
notes: 18 January. Members of LUCHA, FDR, and ECCHA protested in front of the AU's office in Kinshasa against the organization's call for an electoral recount.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 January (on or around). CACH coalition supporters demonstrated in Bukavu, against the AU's call for an electoral recount. The group burned tires.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 18 January (on or before). FDLR forces in Masisi, Nord Kivu moved out of the territory and into Sud Kivu. The movement comes as Rwandan rebel General Kyumba has created a coalition, seeking to carry out attacks on Rwanda from Sud Kivu, according to military sources.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January. An unidentified armed group looted homes and killed a woman in Buloli, Kabare (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January. An unidentified armed group ambushed a microbus near Mujangala, Walungu (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators killed one man and injured another. The assailants also stole the passengers' belongings.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 17 January. The LRA robbed a woman near Nabakpa, Haut Uele.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 January, in Semuliki (no coordinates available, along the Mbau-Kamango road), an unidentified armed group attacked civilians (no further details available).

actor1: Walendu Pitsi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January (on or around). 20 villages in the Ngakpa and Uketa (no coordinates available) areas of Djugu were looted and burned by a neighboring group from the Walendu Pitsi community. Over 1,500 homes in the area were destroyed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 16 January. The CNRD were forced out of Mokoto by other armed groups seeking control of the area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 16 January. Supporters of a local female candidate protested against poll results - believing their candidate had actually won. Police intervened and arrested 45 protesters.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kijangala)
assoc_actor_2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi; FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Mayi Mayi Militia (Kihebe)
notes: 16 January. Military forces from Burundi, along with Imbonerakure and Mayi Mayi Kijangala attacked Burundi rebels groups FOREBU, Red TABARA, and the FNL in Kabere, who were assisted by Mayi Mayi Kihebe. The fighting spread to Mubere and Mulenge. 17 rebels were killed (fatalities spread over three locations).

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kijangala)

The fighting spread to Mubere and Mulenge. 17 rebels were killed (fatalities spread over three locations).

The fighting spread to Mubere and Mulenge. 17 rebels were killed (fatalities spread over three locations).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
notes: 15 January. The Raia Mutomboki Shukuru abducted three men from Kashewe, Kalehe. The assailants also looted live stock.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 January. Veranda Mutsanga members protested in Butembo, calling for the release of their leader and actual election results. Police and military forces dispersed the demonstration.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 January. The FARDC clashed with Nyatura Kigingi forces in Kaniro, Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 15 January 2019 (between 15 - 16 January), the chauffeur for the old vice-president of the provincial assembly was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group along the Beni-Butembo highway in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kijangala)
notes: 15 January. Residents of the Kabere area reported the movement of Burundi soldiers and Imbonerakure into the region with the assistance of the Mayi Mayi Kijangala.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 January. 50 militia leaders associated with Kamwina Nsapu surrendered themselves to local authorities in Kananga. The ex-combatants stated that due to the outcome of the presidential elections they no longer needed to take up arms.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 January. An unidentified armed group attacked Terali (coordinates are approximate based on reported location 68 km south of Mahagi), looting the village. Soldiers from Kpandroma were deployed and repelled the group. Three perpetrators were arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 January. FARDC forces attacked the base of an armed group operating in the Irumu territory. The base was located in the Songolo or Batalolo area. Following 30 minutes of clashes, the military captured the armed men.

actor1: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
notes: 14 January. Mapenzi (aka Lola Hale) combatants abducted 10 men from Nyabiondo. They accused the abductees of supporting the APCLS.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 January. An unidentified armed group killed a man in Kausa, Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction

The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 January. The military in Haut Uele reported killing five members of an armed group (they did not specify the group, but the LRA is active in the state).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 14 January. Either the NDC-Renove or the APCLS attacked an unspecified village in Masisi, accusing the residents of voting for the wrong candidates. At least 10 people were killed during this attack and a subsequent attack on 14/01. At least two women were raped during the attacks. The fatalities are split between the incidents.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 13 January. The FARDC attacked the Raia Mutomboki Mabala in Lwamba, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Two militia members were captured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 January. An unidentified armed group abducted a man in Kimbulu, near the Biena bridge.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 January. An unidentified armed group abducted 10 people on their way to their fields near Kibende (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators demanded a $5,000 ransom.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 January. An unidentified armed group abducted two men from Kingarabe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 January. The FARDC intercepted an attack on Nyakakoma, by Charles Kakule's Mayi Mayi forces. One attacker was killed and one civilian was injured.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 January. Protesters demonstrated against the election results in Buhene (no coordinates available) in Nyiragongo. The demonstrators clashed with police, who responded with live ammunition, killing a taxi driver who was passing through the demonstration and injuring another.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 January. Police used tear gas to disperse Lamuka protesters in Beni.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 14 January. Either the NDC-Renove or the APCLS attacked an unspecified village in Masisi, accusing the residents of voting for the wrong candidates. At least 10 people were killed during this attack and a subsequent attack on 14/01. At least two women were raped during the attacks. The fatalities are split between the incidents.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 January. Soldiers forced 16 civilians to carry military belongings to Swima, Fizi. No indication if/when the civilians were released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 January (on or before). A murdered body was discovered in the Nkadu neighborhood of Bukavu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 January (on or before). An unidentified armed group killed three men in their fields in Butaro, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 January. Unidentified armed men shot and killed an elderly man in Kikumba, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 11 January. LRA forces ambushed civilians 5 km south of Bambangana, Haut Uele. The assailants looted goods and held 36 civilians hostage (including six children), and released them at the end of the day.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 January. Police used tear gas to disperse a Lamuka rally held by Fayulu in Kinshasa.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 January. Demonstrators, including students, angry over the election results barricaded roads in Mbandaka. Police opened fire to disperse the demonstrators, wounding several.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 January. Police forces arbitrarily arrested 32 people, including 27 children, who were celebrating an election announcement in Lubumbashi.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 January. Taxi drivers and other residents, opposed to the construction of an Ebola isolation center in Marabo, threw rocks at NGO health workers.

actor1: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Phende Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 January 2019. A group of Luba attacked a Phende group in the Kasai province.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. A militia group (unclear if they were armed) joined election celebrations in Tshikapa, but military forces thought they were going to attack and opened fire on the crowd, killing five people.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. Soldiers shot at civilians who were celebrating election results in Mutshima, Kamonia. One person was killed.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. Police opened fire to disperse a crowd celebrating the election results, injuring three people.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. Youth, angry over the declaration of Tshisekedi as the winner of the presidential election, barricaded several roads in Kikwit, destroyed local government buildings, and looted property. Police responded by opening fire on the group, killing three according to some sources. The police reported two civilian deaths and the death of a police officer's wife in their home. Other sources indicated as many as six fatalities.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. Demonstrators protested the election of Tshisekedi in Kisangani, by barricading roads and vandalizing the home of the local CENI representative. Arrests were made.

actor1: LC: Lamuka Coalition

assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 January (on or around). Tshokwe Lamuka supporters clashed with Luba FCC supporters in Kamonia. Two Luba were wounded by machetes.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 January. Demonstrators angry over the election of Tshisekedi barricaded roads in Kabondo, a suburb of Kisangani.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 January. Demonstrators angry over the election of Tshisekedi barricaded roads in Mangobo, a suburb of Kisangani.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 09 January. The ADF attacked Mayi Safi and Kanake (coordinates for Kanake are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Seven people were killed (coded as four fatalities in Mayi Safi and three in Kanake).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 09 January. LRA forces abducted 11 civilians, including four children, 5 km west of Pangu, Bas Uele. The combatants also looted civilians traveling along the road in the same location. The adult abductees were later released, but the assailants did not release the children.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 09 January. ADF attacked the villages of Kenake and Maisafi (no coordinates available), near Eringeti. Seven people were killed and nine other people were injured. The group also abducted civilians, 14 of which were released days later while others are still held by the group.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 09-10 January. The Nsabanga militia (a faction of Kamwina Nsapu) looted Bukondo village in Kasai Central.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 9 January, in Mayi Safi, ADF clashed with FARDC, killing 4 and injuring 4 soldiers. Additionally 8 civilians were killed, 11 injured and 21 were reported missing. Later reports indicate 12 out of 21 missing civilians were released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: Around 7 January 2019 (between 7 - 8 January), presumed ADF fighters killed 10 people in Nzuma-Mavivi (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 January. During the night, a girl was tortured and raped in the Bankoko neighborhood of Bunia. She died the following day. Some locals attribute this crime to the release of militant prisoners at the end of December.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 07 January. The FARDC overtook the Nyatura camp in Ngugo (coordinates are appoximate based on OCHA map), in the Rutshuru territory. The militia fled into Virunga park.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 07 January (on or before). Additional police forces were deployed throughout Goma after the announcement of the presidential election winner was postponed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On 7 January, in Mavivi, ADF, killed 11 civilians, including 6 children and injuring 1. MONUSCO intervened. The ADF also abducted civilians during the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 January. Two armed men abducted a Ugandan man from Munyaga, while he was tending to his field located in the DRC (Location coded as Nyamilima with precision of 3 as it is the DRC town closest to Munyaga).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 6 January, at PK 20 road near Mbau, unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, injuring 1.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)
notes: 05 January 2019. Mayi Mayi Fimbo na Fimbo harassed civilians and looted Kasebu, Tanganyika (coordinates are approximate based on location 65 km south of Kalemie).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 05 January. An armed group, wearing hoods, broke into a radio station in Mbuji Mayi and destroyed equipment. Later in the night, an armed group opened fire on the building of the radio station. Despite it's proximity to a police station, security forces did not respond to the gunfire.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 05 January. During the night, two people were killed in their house in the Kabwela area of Kalemie by unknown perpetrators.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 May 2019. An FARDC patrol clashed with the ADF near Bovata, Oicha. According to local civil society, the military repelled the group into Virunga Forest. The FARDC recovered AK-47s and PKMs. Military sources reported that on 03/05 , an FARDC patrol found the bodies of two men who are suspected of being captured by the ADF during the attack on Bovata, and later killed.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 05 January. The police issued a ban on any public gathering of two people or more in Kananga. The ban comes in anticipation of the election results.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC and FDLR clashed near Kakomero, Rutshuru (no coordinates available; in the Rugari area). Two soldiers were killed during the clashes.

notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC carried out a sweep on the Vangu military camp in Lubumbashi. 'A large number' of arrests were made of soldiers, police, deserters, and West African nationals in connection to criminal attacks which have plagued the city.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 05 January. Police arbitrarily arrested 79 people in Goma, who were celebrating the rumored victory of Martin Fayulu.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 May 2019. After being ambushed by the FDLR earlier in the day, FARDC forces attacked the civilian population in Rugari. Six civilians, including three women, were killed in the retaliatory attack. The military denied the attacked but accused the local population of cooperating with the FDLR.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC and FDLR clashed in the Shoko valley, located in the Tongo groupment of Rutshuru.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 May 2019. An angry mob attacked illegal road barriers erected by police along the Kisangani-Banalia road and Kisangani-Opala road. The mob also destroyed 21 houses and offices of the traffic police. [size=no report]

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 04 January. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)
notes: 02 January. Mayi Mayi Fimbo na Fimbo Bitonto ambushed a company convoy near Mulange village. One person was killed and others were injured, including a Chinese employee of the company.

actor1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 31 December. The government cut internet and SMS access across the country. They also cut the radio signal of RFI and revoked the press credentials of one of the outlets journalist after the station reported on preliminary election results. The restrictions were implemented to prevent the spread of rumors as the presidential election tallies are completed.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 31 December. The Nsabanga militia (a faction of Kamwina Nsapu) looted Kalulu village in Kasai Central (no coordinates available, in the Tshikula area).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 December. An unknown group set fire to three voting machines which were located at a CENI employee's home in Katanda.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Armed groups were observed interfering with polling in the Kasai territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests over problems with voting machines were 'violently dispersed' in Inongo. Other sources indicate that voters ransacked a polling station. No indication if they were dispersed by police or military forces.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. A mob of voters attacked a CENI employee who was trying to fix a machine in Mbandaka. The voters suspected the man of tampering with votes and injured him before the police intervened.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Voters in Kananga assaulted a CENI employee who wanted to take one of the voting machines out of a polling station. Police intervened to disperse the crowd, which led to the voters and police throwing objects at each other. Voting was suspended at the Sola Gratia school.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Voters at Tshiteku in Kinshasa clashed with police who would not allow them to vote after the polling station had closed. The voters were angry as they were late after receiving the incorrect polling station information from CENI.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Military forces clashed with a militia in Kakulu in Kasai (no coordinates available). One militia member was killed.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Voters at the Lurhala school in Walungu became angry when a man in the polling center was urging others to vote for Shadary. A police opened fire to disperse the group, killing one man. The CENI president reported that a CENI technician was lynched by an angry mob because they thought he was tampering with a voting machine.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. After a police officer shot and killed a man, an angry mob in Walungu beat the officer to death. However, CENI stated the police officer was killed when voters suspected a CENI employee of tampering with voting machines.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 30 December 2018, at PK 25 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 7 (no further details available).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 30 December. Voter intimidation during the voting for the presidential elections reported in various areas of Nord-Kivu. Security forces interfered with voting at some polling locations in Mulimbi and Butare (Rutshuru) and Mutongo (Walikale). Armed groups also interfered: the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua for Shadary in Walikale territory; NDC and Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kasiki, Bunyatenge, Kinyatsi, and Mbwavinywa (Lubero); NDC-Guidon and APCLS Mapenzi for Shadary at polls in Mwendabandu ((Bukombo, Lwibo, Lushebere, Ngesha, Bugoye, Bushore, Bonde villages)) (Masisi territory). Meanwhile, Nyatura-FDLR coalition and Nyatura-Domi for Fayulu in polling sites in the Bwito region (Rutshuru).

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 30 December. Police and armed groups in Maniema prevented opposition supporters from going to polling stations during the voting for the presidential elections. Raia Mutomboki also interfered in Walowa Yu.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests occurred in Bulungu, Kwilu over corruption allegations against a politician. A soldier guarding the politician shot and killed a man. [size=no report]

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. A CENI employee was assaulted by a group of voters after he allowed candidate Bitika Pascal to enter a polling station in Kindu. Police intervened to stop the assault.

actor1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 30 December. UDPS gunmen assaulted FCC supporters to prevent them from voting at some polling stations in Kasai Oriental.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. Armed groups reportedly interfered with voting at some polling locations in the Shabunda territory.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Protests over problems with voting machines were 'violently dispersed' in Inongo. No indication if they were dispersed by police or military forces.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. A CENI employee in Boma was attacked by a mob of voters when he went to replace a malfunctioning machine. The mob suspected him of bringing a fraudulent machine. Police intervened.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 29 December 2018, in Boikene, unidentified armed group abducted 1 civilian (no further details available).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 29 December. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted three men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 29 December. The NDC Renove attacked Kashuga and nearby settlements. They attacked areas known for their support of political opposition figures, displacing many locals, which prevented them from voting the next day.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 28 December. APCLS looted motorbikes, money, and property in Kanyaminsindo (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Tracker map). They also abducted six men to carry the stolen goods.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 December. FARDC foiled an attempted kidnapping in the Kinanira neighborhood of Sange, killing one of the perpetrators.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)
notes: 28 December (on or around). Mayi Mayi Fimbo an Fimbo reportedly attacked eight villages in the Koki (no coordinates available) area, located in the Kalemie territory. actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The demonstrators burned tires and ransacked a Ebola facility, causing the patients to flee. The home of a police officer was also set on fire. Security forces fired to disperse the rioters. One demonstrator was killed, three police were injured, four LUCHA members were injured and 17 rioters were arrested.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Naval Forces
source: UN HRC; AFP; Radio Okapi; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Suspected Batende militia members attacked Nkolo 2, a Banunu community. Two naval officers attempted to repel the attackers, but one of the soldiers was killed and the other is missing. Much of the Nkolo 2 population had fled following the Yumbi city attack on 16/12. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed at least 10 fatalities in Nkolo 2. Homes, churches and schools were destroyed. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Banunu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Radio Okapi; AFP; UN HRC; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Following the attack on Yumbi city on 16/12, suspected Batende militia members attacked Bongende, Yumbi. The assailants mutilated the victims, removing limbs and sexual organs of men, women and children. Fetuses were cut out of pregnant women. At least one woman was raped and two children were reportedly abducted. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 348 fatalities in Bongende, however, they suspected the actual number to be higher. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance and soldiers participated in the attacks on Bongende.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: AFP; UN HRC; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi
notes: 16 December. A group of 3,000 armed Batende attacked Yumbi city - particularly the neighborhoods of Noyi, Bolu, Likolo, and Ntsentseke. Local police members participated along the Batende (the head of the police had disarmed Banunu officers prior to the attack). Armed Banunu members retliated in some areas with support from a member of the naval forces. Civilians were shot, stabbed, mutilated, and burned to death; over 900 properties were damaged including homes, schools and churches. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 170 fatalities, primarily from the Banunu community (the number may be higher due to uncounted bodies dumped into the river). The attack came after a communal dispute over the burial of the Banunu's customary chief on land belonging to Batende on 14/12. Local CSOs indicate that the group's political allegiances of the Batende with the FCC and Banunu with the Lamuka Coalition exacerbated the dispute.

notes: 11 December. Lamuka coalition supporters and police clashed in Lubumbashi amidst Fayulu's arrival for a campaign rally. Police fired tear gas and water cannons at supporters who had gathered around the city, including at Fayulu's motorcade. Fayulu's supporters burned vehicles. Police said they dispersed the Lamuka supporters for burning vehicles, while Fayulu's speakers report the police initiated it to prevent the Lamuka rally. Civil society organizations report at least one death by shooting (possibly two) and 43 injuries , while the police reported 13 injuries and denied any fatalities. The UN HRC reported three fatalities and several injuries.

The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

notes: On 14 September 2018, unknown armed bandits raided a house in Mangina (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killing the resident.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 14 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a woman and her teenage son in Kibirizi locality of Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 14 Sept 2018, the Mai-Mai Mazembe ambushed an FARDC convoy near Kabuhendo village in Rutshuru territory. One FARDC soldier as well as two civilians were killed and four other civilians were wounded.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 September. Five unidentified gunmen raided a house in the Mangodomu neighborhood of Mangina rural district. The attackers shot and killed a 32-year-old man.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 12 September, near Bangadi, 6 armed LRA combatants looted 2 cyclists and 1 doctor of their money, vaccines, and other goods along the Nambia Ngbangala-Bangadi road. They also kidnapped 3 men and 1 young boy, releasing the 3 men the following day, keeping the boy captive.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: 12 September. DR Congo's navy on Wednesday accused Ugandan troops of killing four Congolese fishermen after their bodies surfaced on Lake Edward.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 September. A police officer was killed Wednesday (September 12th) in Maboya in Beni territory in an attack attributed to the Mai-Mai.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 12 Sept 2018, the FDLR-FOCA ambushed an FARDC convoy at Virunga Park near Bugomba village in Rutshuru territory. Four FARDC soldiers and two civilians were killed.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 12 September. An alleged FRPI militiamen shot and killed a student in the village called 'Supreme', located 93 kilometers south of Bunia in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in Irumu territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 12 September 2018, a bomb fell next to the TMB Bank in Bungulu commune in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Some reports suggest that it was an ADF attack, but this could not be corroborated. No fatalities or injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Matembo. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Mavivi, Oicha. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

The FARDC engaged in a firefight with them, incentivizing the locals to seek refuge in Oicha and other neighbourhoods in the city. No fatalities or injuries reported.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08-09 September. Masudi Alimasi Kokodikoko's Raia Mutomboki forces abducted seventeen women and girls (age 15-70) in the Shabunda territory. The group then held the women in a cave for four days, where they subjected them to rape and other forms of sexual violence. Kokodikoko raped at least nine of the women.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 8 September 2018, unknown armed men abducted a woman in Mangina commune (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 07 September 2018. The FRPI looted Banikonza, Bandikama and Batine, Ituri (no coordinates available, located next to Nyakunde town).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Binakwa)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 7 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a man in Kakomero village of Rutshuru territory. The FARDC suspected the victim from being a Nyatura fighter.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 September 2018. A suspected robber was caught and lynched by a mob in Matadi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

Among the wounded, there are two soldiers. Later reports indicate four fatalities. The military indicated that the assailants were FDLR fighters, not Nyatura combatants.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kilalo)
notes: On 4 September 2018, a woman was kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Kilalo militia from Mabata (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to the east of the location.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Loyalist forces repelled them after violent clashes. Civil society claims that several assets of the population were looted by the alleged ADF during this attack.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 2 September, an LRA group of 5 men and 3 boys in military and civilian attire, ambushed civilians in a field 4 km northeast of Kpegu. They looted the victims and abducted 2 men and 1 girl.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 2 September, near Dikumba, 20 LRA members looted houses and abducted 1 man and 2 girls. They released the man 12 km northwest of Dikuma later that day. The 2 girls remain unaccounted for and presumed in captivity.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Love)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 01 September. Militants of the Mouvement de liberation du Congo and those of the Common Front for Congo (FCC) threw stones at each other and clashed as they gathered to greet their respective delegations at the Gemena airport (South Ubangi). The MLC militants began throwing stones at the FCC ones after learning that their delegation would not land in Gemena.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

notes: On June 14, a coalition of Mayi Mayi Kifuafua of Shario Ngendo, Kirikicho and Shukuru attacked the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin after the death of Shario. The clashes took place in Busurungi, Biriko, Kifuruka, Bunyamwerimba and Kilamba villages in Walikale territory.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 14 June 2018, three FARDC soldiers intimidated a farmer on his plot in Tenambo village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and robbed him of 60,000 Francs, a television set and a battery. The FARDC also took 300,00 Francs from two taximen.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 14 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked locals living near a FARDC position on the Mabatili river along the Bilimani-Tenambo route (Beni, Nord-Kivu). A woman was shot dead, while another woman and her daughter were abducted.

actor1: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
notes: Around 14 June 2018 (between 14 - 15 June), the NDC arrived at Kalunguta village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and abducted 8 people, 4 of whom were subsequently liberated, and headed towards Pabuka.

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On June 13, 13 people were kidnapped by the FDLR-Rude in Kibingu and Kibirizi. In Kibingu, 8 people were kidnapped.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 13, in response to the killing of a civilian the day before by men in military uniform, youth barricaded routes in Uvira, denouncing the insecurity in the locality. The riot was interrupted by security forces and 2 people were injured (one civilian injured by tear gas, one policeman by pelted stones).

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 13, an argument between a police officer and a civilian over the candidacy of Vital Kamerhe in Walungu led the police officer to shoot the civilian, who died. After the incident, residents gathered and killed the policeman.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 13, an argument between a police officer and a civilian over the candidacy of Vital Kamerhe in Walungu led the police officer to shoot the civilian, who died. After the incident, residents gathered and killed the policeman.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 13, unidentified men shot a civilian through a window in Kangalamuka village, Lubero. The civilian died.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
notes: On June 13, the Mayi Mayi Kirikicho attached the Kifuafua Delphin in Biriku village, Walikale, following the killing of the commander Shario. 2 Kifuafua and 3 Kirikicho were killed, and 3 Kifuafua were injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 13, unidentified armen men kidnapped a child from Virunga neighbourhood in Goma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 13, unidentified armed men killed a civilian in Malolu village, Beni.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 June 2018, a Tanzanian man who had been forcibly nlisted by the ADF was detained by the villagers in Ngite (Beni, Nord-Kivu), who then took him to the relevant authorities. [size=no report]

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On June 13, 13 people were kidnapped by the FDLR-Rude in Kibingu and Kibirizi. In Kibingu, 8 people were kidnapped.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: The MSF team was once more ambushed and robbed along the Masisi-Nyabiondo axis. This is the second such attack in a month and the seventh in Masisi since the beginning of the year. MSF suspended its hygiene assistance in the area as a result.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 12, a policeman got into a fight with a civilian in a bar in Kalehe. He pushed the civilian against a tree and the victim died from the injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 12, a 23 year old man was killed by men in military uniform in Rugenge, leading to clashes between protesters and police the following day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 12 June, near Digba, 3 unidentified armed men in military attire ambushed 4 fishermen. One of the fishermen was injured but escaped to Digba. Two others were abducted.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 12 June 2018, a Mayi Mayi militia attacked and set on fire FARDC barracks located in Maboya village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The barracks was unoccupied at the time.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On June 12, the NDC Guidon and the CNRD clashed in Kinyabwitsi, Walikale territory. 2 CNRD and 1 NDC Guidon died.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, unidentified armed men shot and killed a man, a woman and their two children in Kajembe village, Uvira territory

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, unidentified gunmen killed a man in Kilungu village, Walikale territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, unidentified armed men broke into Lukorwe village, in Nyiarongo, injured three people and kidnapped a man.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, the FARDC clashed with a group who was trying to steal cows in Ngandjo, Kalehe. One soldier was injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, an unidentified armed group looted goods and kidnapped 3 people from Kanyabayonga.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Around June 11, the FARDC recovered three territories from the Mayi Mayi in Rutshuru, south of Lake Edward: Kafuzo, Kamuhororo, and Kibahari and freed 7 hostages (including 4 of the 20 Ugandan fishermen kidnapped on May 20).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Around June 11, the FARDC recovered three territories from the Mayi Mayi in Rutshuru, south of Lake Edward: Kafuzo, Kamuhororo, and Kibahari and freed 7 hostages (including 4 of the 20 Ugandan fishermen kidnapped on May 20).
