actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Beni Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 10, an unidentified group tried to break into a house in Malepe neighbourhood, Beni. The police intervened and repelled them.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On June 10, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) in Busurungi. Clashes spread to other areas the following day. 8 people killed in total including 7 on the second day. The Ngendo faction leader, Shalio was among the casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 June. Military forces set fire to a home and killed a civilian election worker with LUCHA, in Goma, Nord-Kivu. The military claimed accidental causes for the death.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 10 June 2018, a group of unknown armed men kidnapped a man in his home in Mataba village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and took him to an unknown destination.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: Recruitment: report of growing influence of the NDC-Renewal militia in and around Walikale and Lubero in areas where the FARDC are absent. The group counts 1.200-1.250 active combatants in several locations (large parts of Walikale, a non-negligeable part of the Lubero and less extensive parts of Rutshuru and Masisi). Certain testimonies mention an alleged strategy between the FARDC and the NDC-R, coordinated through talks.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 June. LUCHA leader's, Luc Nkulula, home caught fire in Goma, DRC. Officials said the fire was accidental, while activist contend it was intentionally set on fire.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Makabe)
notes: On the night of June 9-10, local militiamen headed by warlord Makabe attacked the villagers of Mpela, grouping of Kisula, in Malemba Nkulu. 2 people reportedly killed and 48 houses burned.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
source: Radio Okapi; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 9, presumed ADF militants launched an incursion in Ngite. They first burned 5 houses and some stalls, before clashing with the FARDC. 2 soldiers killed. 5 people were injured and reportedly one person died from the side effects of the violence (from hypertension due to the loud noises caused by the first explosions of the attack).

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 8, inhabitants of the chiefdom of Bukumu, in Nyiarongo protested, as they had already done during the week, to get the local authorities to put their customary chief in command. Clashes ensued between the police and protesters, who were carrying live bullets but did not allegedly intend to use them during the protest. The police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 8, 6 people were killed by an armed group in the grouping of Bijombo.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 7 June 2018, ADF shot and killed a nurse, set his motorcycle on fire and stole the stock of medications he was transporting between Bunake to Kainama in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 7 June 2018 (between 7 - 8 June), unknown armed men threatened the life of a man and then abducted his wife in Mangina village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), they are now demanding a ransom.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 7 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels kidnapped palm oil merchants traveling from Oicha to Kainama just before they reached Eringeti (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: On June 6, 3 LRA rebels surrendered in the forest in Banda.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 6, taxi men continued to protest the presence of policemen in Kisangani by chating songs, honking horns and dragging tree leaves down the street.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 5, a Hutu communal chief was killed by an unidentified armed group when he was leaving from Nyanzale to Goma.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 5, taxi men rioted and chased policemen on the avenue of Kisangani.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the week of June 4-8, inhabitants of the chiefdom of Bukumu, in Nyiarongo protested to get the local authorities to put their customary chief in command.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 4, civil servants protested in front of the MONUSCO office in Mbandaka to reclaim their salaries. This happened because the bank that usually pays their salaries did not deploy people to make those payments due to fear of their employees being at risk of getting Ebola.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On 4 June 2018, armed men affiliated with a Mayi Mayi militia erected a camp between Kalunguta and Kasitu villages in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu) northeast of Butembo. Farmers in the area were now only allowed to work on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays and were charged a payment of almonds, a sack of cassava flour, a goat and 20L of local beer.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On June 4, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked the FARDC position in Mighobwe village, Lubero, forcing the FARDC to abandon it. Two FARDC were shot and wounded; the Mazembe burned down 6 houses and the Kyaghanda Yira (an ethnic community organization) meeting place.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On June 4, the ADF attacked in the Beni-Kasindi axis and killed a civilian. Ambushes like this have been perpetrated by a Mayi Mayi-ADF coalition.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 4 June 2018, ADF clashed with the FARDC in Kitchanga village, between Semuliki bridge and Nyaleke (Beni, Nord-Kivu). A FUSO car carrying beans coming from Kasindi was set on fire and a taximan was shot and died. The driver of the car was also hospitalized in a critical condition.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 4 June 2018, a bomb fell on the roof of a post office next to the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The damage was enormous on the side of the roads and surrounding houses. No fatalities or injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 2, the FARDC attacked an unidentified armed group who had raided Bushumba village. During the clash, 4 civilians were wounded and two assailants captured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On June 2, the Mayi Mayi Kilalo attacked the Lyakobo neighbourhood in Beni. The FARDC managed to repel the rebels, but the clash led to 5 rebels dead as well as a 5 year old boy and a woman.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: On June 2, 50 people were arrested under operation Tujikinge in Uvira. 9 firearms were also seized.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 2 June 2018, a PNC office was targeted by two FARDC soldiers in Ngongo district of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They were arrested.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 2 June 2018, Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked the FONER office and FARDC position in Mukulia village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), burning the office down. Two soldiers were wounded and one militiaman was captured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 2, the radio Grand Tam-Tam from Lodja was pillaged. The emission is currently down. The assailants destroyed material, stole some, and beat up a human rights activist that was finishing an emission.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On June 2, the Mayi Mayi attacked Mukulya, in the Beni-Butembo axis, and killed 3 people, injuring another two. The assailants also burned the FONER office. A later report by the same source mentions 6 dead and 2 soldiers wounded, as well as 10 cows stolen which were later recovered.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: On June 1, the Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted a 40 year old woman from Mugerero village, Uvira. The FARDC intervened after being alerted by the population but did not manage to stop them.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 1 June, near Banda, an unidentified armed group entered a camp of Peuhl pastoralists and kidnapped children. Peuhl families were displaced towards Banda to alert authorities.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 1 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Kokola (Beni, Nord-Kivu), an area with a primary school in full session with gunshots ringing. One ADF fighter is reported killed and an ADF minor (12 years old) was captured after being badly injured by a gunshot to the knees. On the FARDC side, 1 soldier died and two others were injured. ADF raided supplies of trading houses in the area. An Actros branded vehicle was burned down.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On June 1, the APCLS attacked the village of Buhambi, in Kitshanga. They killed 3 people, of which two minors aged 13 and 14. 3 assailants were later arrested in Kitshanga.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Arrests: On May 31, 3 Ugandan soldiers crossed into DRC through Tako village, in Beni. They were chased by civilians, who captured 1 of them and handed him to the Kasindi rural commune.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 31, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man in Ilange village, Beni. They demanded a ransom for his release.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 31, unidentified gunmen attacked the police station in Bulengera.3 policemen were killed and 8 AK47 weapons stolen.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On May 31, FDLR-RUD tried to rape a girl in Rusaka I village, Rutshuru. They shot the brother and injured the mom of the girl with a machete. The boy died due to injuries and the girl was abducted and taken to the woods.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 31, a peaceful protest by people demonstrating against insecurity in the area ended with 16 militants arrested in Rutshuru.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 31, armed men attacked the police station in Butembo, killing 3 policemen and a civilian. On the same day, unidentified men burned the nearby road toll office in Kunguta village on the Butembo-Bulambo road.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: PND: National Party for Democracy and Development
notes: Looting: On May 31, the headquarter of the National Party for Democracy and Development (PND) was pillaged.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On May 30, the NDC-Guidon attacked the Mazembe in Pitakongo village, Lubero. Three NDC-G rebels died and one was injured; one Mazembe was injured. The NDC-Guidon burned down the Mayi Mayi Mazembe camp.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 30, unidentified armed men shot and killed a woman through the window of her house in Bwinyole neighbourhood of Butembo.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 29, unidentified men stopped and kidnapped two motorcycle riders in Kibingu village. A ransom was demanded but the civilians managed to escape.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 29, unidentified armed men broke into a house in Chabingili village, Rutshuru, and kidnapped 2 men and one boy, demanding a ransom for their release.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 29, unidentified gunmen abducted 3 people in Kabasha village, Beni.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On May 29, the APCLS clashed with the NDC in Lukweti and Kalungu, in Masisi, due to the dispute of territorial control of the villages between Masisi and Walikale. There was 1 death and some wounded people on the ACPLS side, and some more wounded on the NDC side.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Around 29 May 2018 (as reported), two bodies of FARDC soldiers were found at Mankungwe village in Kyangolo commune, Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC reported that they were killed during combat with a Mayi Mayi militia.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On May 29, the APCLS clashed with the NDC in Lukweti and Kalungu, in Masisi, due to the dispute of territorial control of the villages between Masisi and Walikale. There was 1 death and some wounded people on the ACPLS side, and some more wounded on the NDC side.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: Between 28 May-24 June, suspected Batwa militiamen armed with arrows ambushed vehicles on 3 occasions along the Kalemie-Kabwela axis. The ambushes were meant to steal goods. Two NGO vehicles were targeted while on one occasion, one person was abducted for a few hours. Coded as three separate events.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 28, the FARDC arrested and killed two men on the spot whom they accused of belonging to the Mayi Mayi, in Kyangolo village, Beni.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 28, unidentified armed men killed a woman in Kitchanga, Masisi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 28, the FARDC were attacked by the Mayi Mayi in Isale, Lubero. 2 rebels were neutralised.

actor1: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Security Measures: with support from the government of Japan and MONUSCO, the UNMAS installed weapon safes in many police commissariats and sub-commissariats across DRC. A total of 227 safes were installed, including 93 in Goma (North Kivu), 31 in Bukavu and Uvira (South Kivu), 73 in Bunia (Ituri), 24 in Kananga (Kasai Central) and 56 in Kinshasa.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
assoc_actor_1: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 28, the APCLS (with Hunde allegiance) killed a woman in Kitshanga. This attack comes after 4 people were kidnapped by the Nyatura (with Hutu allegiance) on May 26. The woman in question was the mother of a Nyatura combatant, and her abduction was a reprisal to the previous attack. Many people left the region due to fear of retaliation.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On May 27, NDC-Guidon assailants kidnapped civilians from Karambi village.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On May 27, the NDC Guidon attacked the Mazembe in Lubero village. 3 NDC rebels were killed and another 4 injured. One Mazembe was injured and the NDC looted several goods, burning down part of the Mazembe camp.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 27, unidentified armed men killed a shepherd in Burungu.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On May 27, the NDC Guidon attacked the APCLS in Buboa village, Masisi. 2 APCLS combatants were killed and 2 NDC combatants injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On May 27, the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin shot two traders in Lukaraba village, Walikale. One person was killed on the spot and the other remained injured because they refused to carry the assailants' belongings.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 27, a policeman shot another policeman during a security check in Kiondo. The policeman died.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

assoc_actor_1: CCU: United Congolese Convention; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 27, a radio close to the Party of the People for Reconstruction and Democracy (Parti du Peuple pour la Reconstruction et la Democratie) was set on fire by alleged CCU members (Convention of the United Congolese). Two CCU arrested.

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On May 26, more than 20 people were kidnapped from several locations in Rutshuru, including Kasenyi and Kibututu. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rude.

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On May 26, more than 20 people were kidnapped from several locations in Rutshuru, including Kasenyi and Kibututu. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rude.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 26 May. MONUSCO deployed troops to Saramabila area two days after the attack on the Banro mining site

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On May 26, 9 people were abducted not far from Kiwanja. One of them was killed when he resisted the kidnapping. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 26, unidentified gunmen abducted three people from Katobo. They were found dead days later in a ravine.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: On May 26, the FARDC clashed with the FRPI in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, and two rebels were killed. 2 AK47 weapons were also retrieved.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 26, a clash broke out between miners and security forces in Banalia. The artisanal miners were informed that they had to pay an institutional tax in order to exploit the resources and were obliged by the forces to do so, which they refused. What ensued was a coleric mob trying to break through the police barrier that prevented the access to the mines. One miner was injured.

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On May 26, 3 people - one motard and two clients - were kidnapped in the chiefdom of Bwito, in Mutanda. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 26, 4 people were kidnapped in Kitobo, 6km south of Kitshanga. The suspected abductors are the Nyatura.

actor1: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
notes: On May 26, a student was kidnapped from Busanza, when he was going to school in Nyarukwangara. His kidnappers demanded a ransom. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On May 25, an ambush by NDC-Rassailants in the Bingi-Bunyatenge axis led to 20 motards and their passengers to be kidnapped.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On 25 May 2018, presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen abducted a man in Maboya village in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu), after allegedly confusing him for the head of the intelligence service. A ransom was posted for his release.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 24 May, in Mangbungulu, a group of 3 armed LRA forces, including one woman, ambushed two cyclists traveling to Banda. The LRA forces looted the victims and held them captive for three hours before releasing them.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On the night of 23-24 May, a FARDC soldier was ambushed by the FNL between Kiliba and the grouping of Runingu. The soldier was killed while on patrol. The FARDC arrived after and the clash allegedly led to 3 rebel deaths.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika)
assoc_actor_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 24 May 2018, in Namoya, a coalition of Mai-Mai Malaika of Sheikh Assani, Mai-Mai Yakutumba and Mai-Mai Apa na Pale attacked an FARDC position. The aim of the attack was reportedly to loot military materiel. At least 30 dead (18 soldiers, 8 rebels).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 24, the FARDC clashed with the ADF in the Mbau-Kamango axis. This group is the same that had attacked Beni on May 20. According to UN sources 12 FARDC soldiers and 16 ADF rebels killed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 24, clashes took place between students and taxi moto drivers in Malemba. The clashes started because a student who was on a taxi moto started an argument with the driver. The argument quickly turned violent, with students and other drivers joining the conflict, both sides pelting stones, and leading to injuries on both sides. During the clash, 4 houses were ransacked. Police intervened to disperse the parties.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 24, the vice-president of the Confederation of Currency Dealers (COCAM) was killed in Kinshasa by a group of armed men.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 23, unidentified gunmen attacked in Makako, Djugu, killing 4 people with machetes (2 men, a woman and a baby). Four others are reported missing.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 23, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a vehicle carrying FARDC soldiers and civilians close to Butindiri, Rutshuru. 2 soldiers and 4 civilians were shot and wounded.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22-23 May: youth of Kisangani protested for two days against the police for having brutalised a taxi-moto driver the day before, pelting stones. Police dispersed the protest with tear gas.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Idjwi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 22, the Congolese naval force clashed with an armed group in Lake Kivu, Idjwi. The attackers envisaged to steal from fishermen when these called the naval force. Upon their arrival, the clash took place. A sergeant and two fishermen were hurt by bullets and later died from their injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 'Armed assailants ambushed an INGO vehicle that was transporting cash from an airfield to the city center in Irumu territory. When the vehicle came under fire, the four aid workers onboard abandoned the vehicle and ran to hide in the bush. Although two aid workers were able to escape, the other two were found by the gunmen. They were assaulted and stabbed.'

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: May 22, report that NDC-R elements have occupied Karambi 11km south of Bingi. Three days later, they ambushed a vehicle and kidnapped passengers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 22, a 32 year old man was abducted in Kyanguwe village, Lubero. He had witnessed the killing of Mwami Kambere Mbalulinda on October 8-9. The victim was found dead in Talihya river days later.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On May 22, the APCLS whipped a man in Bunyere village, Rutshuru. The man died from the wounds.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 22 May, in Madi, 3 Ugandan and 3 Congolese LRA combatants abducted 6 men and 1 young woman and looted 61 civilians. The assailants wore uniforms similar to the FARDC's and spoke Acholi and Lingala.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 22 May - 25 May. FARDC launched 'operation hero' against FRPI in Ituri area. 7 FRPI elements killed. Exact date of combat not known.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22-23 May: youth of Kisangani protested for two days against the police for having brutalised a taxi-moto driver the day before, pelting stones. Police dispersed the protest with tear gas.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 22, a group of 5 FARDC soldiers attacked a vehicle belonging to Agro Action Allemande (AAA). The attack was meant to steal money. One civilian was injured. The 5 soldiers and the organiser of the attack were arrested and condemned the week after.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in Misisi, Fizi, and killed the head of the household before looting goods and money.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, a 41 year old man was killed in Lwango village, Kalehe, with a crude weapon.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, unidentified gunmen broke into the Kibondwe neighbourhood in Uvira territory and killed a head of household.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, unidentified gunmen attacked the FARDC in Ishenge, Uvira territory. They injured 3 soldiers and stole their belongings.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 21, the Mazembe ambushed a motor cycle transporting 2 FARDC soldies in Butindiri, Rutshuru. The soldiers and the driver were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, a man was killed by unidentified gunmen in the Keyshero neighbourhood of Goma.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 21, a police member of the traffic control brutalised a taxi-moto driver in Kisangani. The driver is alive but hospitalised.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 21, a convoy composed of 2 vehicles and 21 motorbikes was attacked in the Virunga National Park. 2 soldiers and 1 civilian were killed. The attack comes 10 days after another attack took place in Virunga National Park. The Mayi Mayi are accused of being the perpetrators.

actor1: Kete Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Mpiang Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the night of May 20-21, an armed group attacked the village of Matopolo, in the grouping Kalamba Dilondo, in Mweka, and killed 8 people all belonging to the Mpiang group. 13 others were injured during the attack (MSF mentions 12 dead according to official sources). The attackers are presumably from the Kete community.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 20 May, various women's groups and women parliamentarians marched in Lubumbashi, the provincial capital of Katanga, to protest violence against women.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 20, the Raia Mutomboki Hamakombo attacked the FARDC in Kambale, but the attack was repelled.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 20, a FARDC soldier shot two civilians in Kisunga, Beni. A man died and another woman was shot to the stomach. On the same day, a soldier shot another man in Lyakobo neighbourhood; the victim died on the spot.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 20 May. ADF attacked FARDC in Mayimoya and killed 10 civilians

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On May 20, military forces clashed with presumed ADF rebels who had just attacked Mbau northeast of Beni and killed 10 civilians (coded in a separate VAC event). The clash lasted 3h and the FARDC managed in the end to repel the assailants. The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On May 20, presumed ADF rebels attacked Mbau northeast of Beni. 9 civilians were killed during the attack and 2 injured. Radio Okapi and AFP mention that casualties were 10, later confirmed by the army and civil society. The attack started at 18h30, with rebels burning a vehicle, pillaging stores and businesses, and killing civilians who inhabited the location. The military eventually intervened and the clash lasted for 3h, with the FARDC managing in the end to repel them (coded in a separate battle event). The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Non-violent activity: On May 20, the national coordinator of the 'Ensemble' platform, Jean Claude Kibala, survived a kidnapping attempt. The kidnappers approached his chauffer and put a gun to this head. When Jean left the car, they tried to make him get inside a car without a plate. He refused and some civilians passed by at that point. The kidnappers were disuaded and the kidnapping was avoided.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: On May 19, the police prevented a meeting from the 'Ensemble pour le changement' electoral coalition led by opposition candidate Moise Katumbi in Bunia. The police deployed to several locations in Bunia, in order to prevent even journalists from accessing the hotel where the meeting was due to take place.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 19 May, in Badolo, an LRA group abducted 12 civilians, including 3 young boys, 2 young girls, and 7 adult men. They spoke Lingala and Acholi, and wore UPDF-like uniforms.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 19 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: On 19 May, the Congolese police forces interrupted the burrial of activist Rossy Mukendi by using tear gas to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On May 19, 6 Ugandan fishermen were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi rebels close to Lake Edward, in the region of Kagezi. They are being held hostage in Kyondo.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On May 19, people took to the streets and barricaded the routes between DRC and Burundi to protest the killing of the local chief the night before. Several tires were burned; there were many youth protesting. Some barricades were set in front of MONUSCO, but after the latter engaged in conversation, they were removed.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 18, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in the Mabanga-Nord neighbourhood of Goma, abducted 2 girls and looted goods.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 18, unidentified gunmen killed a civilian close to Mugeri.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 18, two unidentified groups clashed in Kamatare, Masisi, and one person died.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 18, unidentified armed men killed the local chief - Mandra Mazibo - of the Kanvinvira area in Uvira.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On May 18, the NDC Guidon and Cheka clashed in Robe, Walikale. 2 NDC Guidon were killed and 2 were injured; on the Cheka side, 1 was killed, 1 was injured and 1 was captured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 17 May 2018, a farmer and his wife failed to return from their fields just outside Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an assumed abduction by ADF rebels.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 May 2018, unknown gunmen abducted a husband and raped his wife who were in their fields in Polopondo, 2km away from Kyatsaba in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The woman was left in the field.

actor1: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 17, more than 20 Kuluna rebels attacked the commune of Mvuzi, in Matadi. They destroyed property and looted goods from civilians, having injured also many people.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 17, unidentified gunmen raided Bigizi, in Kalehe, and raped a woman. They took her to the forest with her 5-year old child and also looted goods.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 17, a crowd was carrying a man's body to the mortuary in Beni when the police intervened to disperse it. The crowd was also protesting against the FARDC.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: On 17 May 2018, presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen took goats from civilians in Bungulu district in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: On May 16, a clash between presumed Mayi Mayi Mazembe and Nyatura led to the killing of 5 civilians, with 5 others injured, in Mirangi, Rutshuru.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 16 May 2018, youths of Talyata district took to the streets in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to demonstrate against the killing of a farmer by a soldier after he refused to give the soldier his goats. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 16, unidentified gunmen abducted the chief of Kasitu locality, Kunguta village, in Beni.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 16, a FARDC soldier killed a man and his son in the Paida neighbourhood of Beni, while he was trying to steal their goat.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 16, the police dispersed a peaceful demonstration in Kamituga. The students demanded the rehabilitation of the national road. 3 students and 2 more protesters were arrested; 2 students were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 16, the FARDC attacked an unidentified armed group in Mianzi village, Shabunda. 2 rebels were killed and 2 AK47s retrieved.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 16, the general of the CAR militia Anti-Balaka was arrested in Kanzau, Bondo, along with around 30 of his men. The general had sought refuge there after a clash with the FARDC.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 16, students belonging to the National Pedagogical University protested in Kinshasa over the payment of extra 50 USD demanded by the university authorities, aside from 150 USD for their diplomas. The police dispersed the protesters using tear gas.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Agreement: Around 60 children left the FRPI group in Ituri between April-June 2018.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 15, unidentified armed men attacked Mirangi, in Rutshuru, to steal cows. The Nyatura Domi were alerted by the population and intervened to prevent the looting. During the clash, 4 shepherds were killed and 5 injured. 30 cows were stolen.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 15, unidentified gunmen in Mayangose village, Beni, kidnapped a couple.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: On May 15, the FARDC launched a search and rescue operation and captured 18 RED-TABARA rebels in Matarule. Some military items were also seized.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Lubumbashi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 15, the Congolese police clashed with inhabitants of Lubumbashi commune who protested against the return of insecurity to the city. The protest, which turned into a clash, pertained to an attempted robbery the night before. 12 people were injured during the protest, while stalls were burned.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On May 14, the FARDC attacked the CNRD position in Busumba. The attack resulted in one soldier and one rebel dead.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Kabare Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 14, unidentified men close to Mugererebo, in Kabare, stole sixteen fishermen's nets. The FARDC intervened and captured one of the assailants.

actor1: Rutshuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 14, unidentified armen men tried to hold up a vehicle in Vitshumbi. The driver accelerated, and the rebels shot, killig the man.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 14, student protesters protesting against the rising costs of public transports clashed with police in Kinshasa. 8 students were injured, 2 of them seriously. 2 medical employees were also hurt. MONUSCO is accused of playing a role through inciting students to protest. This protest comes the week after another protest led to the arrest of 14 students who were protesting the same cause.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 13, ANR agents arrested a man in Bulambo, Beni, for suspicion of him belonging to the Mayi Mayi Mazembe. The detainee was taken to the FARDC camp, where he was tortured and died. The FARDC buried the body without informing the family.

actor1: Rutshuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 13, unidentified armed men raided Rutsiro village, in Rutshuru, during the night. A 35-year old man was kidnapped and a ransom was demanded for his release.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After the clashes between rioters who clashed because of the game, the police intervened and had to use tear gas to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 'One INGO staff member was abducted near Penemede, near the administrative border between South Kivu and Maniema, when armed men ambushed an INGO motorcycle convey composed of five workers. Two motorcycles were also taken in the attack. The whereabouts of the worker and the motive for the attack are unknown at this time.'

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 May 2018, a farmer was ambushed in his field by an unknown armed group in Ndomu village in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu). He was rushed to a hospital to attend to his wounds.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 12 May. Rioters stoned a MONUSCO patrol in Boikene.

actor1: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 12 May, a merchant was kidnapped by unidentified armed men in the Mongwalu-Lopa axis and has since then been missing. Authorities accused incident to be part of renewed clashes between the Hema and Lendu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 12 May, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], unidentified men armed with knives killed 1 boy and 1 young man from the same family. Neighbors reported that the assailants, dressed in robes, killed the boys when they refused to give the cassava, groundnuts, rice, and corn they were transporting.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 12, 'youth for peace' protested in Bunia. The protest was dispersed by police who resorted to tear gas, and the mayor claimed that the protest was not authorised. Some of the protesters were arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 May. Suspected police forces, apprehended four males in Kalamu. The body of one of the detainees was found, while the other three remain missing. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 11 May 2018, 35 people who attended a funeral were ambushed and fired on by presumed ADF rebels in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). One of them died in the attack.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
source: Xinhua; RFI; Daily Monitor (Uganda); AFP; AP
notes: On May 11, a MONUSCO convoy was attacked by presumed Mayi Mayi Hapa na pale in Tanganyka province. Two UN members went missing, while the remaining 11 were safe. Another report by Xinhua mentions that 13 UN soldiers were abducted, but that 11 were released. The 2 missing UN soldiers were found on May 16. The Hapa na pale are supported by, or in a coalition with, the Yakutumba and Malaika, and the three groups are part of the CNPSC.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
source: Xinhua; Radio Okapi; Deutsche Welle; AFP; RFI; Reuters
notes: On May 11, an ICCN ranger was killed by unidentified armen men at Virunga National Park (precisely, between Kilimanyoka and Kibumba), and 3 people were kidnapped, of which 2 British tourists. All three hostages were release on May 13.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 11 May 2018, at least 34 people carried the dead man's body in protest to the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), after his death in an ambush by ADF rebels. [size=at least 34]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Uganda)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Around 11 May 2018 (between 11 - 12 May), armed bandits from Uganda crossed the border to attack Kasindi village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). FARDC and PNC patrollers intercepted them on their way and killed one of them, and arrested two. 3 others fled to an unknown location.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 10 May 2018, a FARDC colonel inflicted violence on civilians of Kamango village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), giving each worker 40 lashes after forcing them to work illegally for him on his cacao farm.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 10 May, near Lindimbia, approximately at 17:00, 3 civilians were reportedly abducted by a suspected LRA group as they were collecting water at a water source 22 km northwest of Bangadi, DRC.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: On May 10, the Kamwina Nsapu killed 8 people in the locality of Mulombela, in Dibaya. They attacked around 13h, killing a couple and their 6 kids. Another report mentions that at least there were 4 deaths, but with a mention that a military source stated 8. On May 12, 8 deaths were confirmed. The head of the assassinated family is the brother of the current village chief. The militia was headed by David Ndaye Kalonga, a.k.a. Nsabanga.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 10, unidentified gunmen attacked the FNL/Nbizi in Kahololo village, Uvira. 2 FNL soldiers were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 10, armed men kidnapped a priest from Rugarama, Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 10, unidenified gunmen broke into the house of the local chief in Nyakibamba, Idjwi, and killed him. A man and a boy were also killed during their runaway.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 10, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man from Sovere, Walikale, and asked for a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: On May 10, the FARDC shot two policemen, obeying the orders of their intelligence officer commander, in Nyange, Fizi. The policemen were refusing to release from custody the cousin of the commander. Four policemen were injured, but the prisoner was not released.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On May 10, students protested in Kinshasa in three different campuses against the rising price of transportation. The police arrested 14 of them after trying to disperse them with tear gas.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia

During the night, suspected police officers (most in civilian clothing, one wearing part of a police uniform) apprehended four suspected Kuluna members from their homes in Kalamu and killed them. They forced one victim to strip and ordered him to 'have sex with a tree' and shot him in the back as he was undressing. The victims were unarmed at the time. The attacks are believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

One of the clans was opposing the other clan's rapprochement with the government. It is unclear to what extent the Kamwina Nsapu militia was involved in the feud.

These attacks come as a way of discrediting the FARDC owing to the recent recaptures of territory in the 'triangle of death' in between Mbau-Kamango and Eringeti, in Beni. The ADF is moving in small satellite groups around the region, launching attacks were possible, in order to counter the FARDC.

Karakara had been a FARDC chief before joining the revolution in 2013.

The minister and some others in his delegation were taken hostages, and when the police intervened, they used tear gas and shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The head of the police was nonetheless hit by a stone in the head, falling dead just after.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

At that point, the FARDC was alerted and tried to repel the militiamen. One of the soldiers was killed as well as a civilian.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

In Djugu territory, Lendu youths reportedly killed four Hema civilians (two men and two girls) and one FARDC soldier and destroyed some 300 houses in the Tche area (16 km south of Blukwa). The violence has prompted significant population displacements within the province and towards neighbouring Uganda.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The conflict apparently began when a man was heading to work in the fields and was killed by presumed Hutu Nyatura. Then, youth took up arms and attacked the Hutu families accused of collaborating with the combatants.The Hutu population was forced to flee to Nyanzale.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The police were forced to break the protest. One young student was arrested. Another person died from the injuries sustained by the confrontation with police and another is severely injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Later the same day, when the hostages were being taken to an unknown location, they were attacked by another Nyatura faction in Ishola, near Nyanzala, where 2 of them were killed. The third hostage managed to escape while the fourth is still captured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: On February 17th, 7 people were killed in an attack by unidentified armed men on a vehicle belonging to the Congolese Institute for Nature Conservation. The vehicle was ambushed when it returned from an official mission between Oicha and Eringeti. It is suspected that the perpetrators were ADF, but that was not confirmed.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On February 16, the LRA attacked the localities of Mobili and Wepa, pillaging houses and kidnapping 7 civilians (2 others are disappeared).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army

Since the LRA had attacked the cities of Mobili and Wepa the day before, and they are 15 and 25 km from the centre of Ango, it is likely that it was them.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On February 16, the LRA attacked the localities of Mobili and Wepa, pillaging houses and kidnapping 7 civilians (2 others are disappeared).

actor1: Aru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Aru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The situation was described as untenable. Youth related to the M23 movement was also part of the riot. The youth torched cars and set up barricades along major roads, and some of them were brutally beaten by police forces who were trying to prevent an uprising.

actor1: Aru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Aru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

An hour later around 20h, another armed group tried to pillage some boutiques in the Nguba side of the Ibanda commune. 2 other civilians died while trying to save themselves during this attack.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

There were deaths on both sides, with 6 on the FARDC side (death toll later increased to 10; and another 4 injured) and others in the Rwandan side (although no numbers were confirmed).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: Demonstrations relating to the interethnic violence experienced 2 days prior in Blukwa also occurred in Bunia on February 5th and 6th. On the 6th, stores remained closed and streets deserted.

actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On February 3rd, inter-ethnic fighting broke out in Blukwa, around 100km from Bunia, between the Hema and Lendu militias. The attack lasted two days and at least 23 members of the Hema community were killed by Lendu (although reports differ, ranging from 23-32), 12 people were severely injured and several houses were burned during the attack on the Hema village. Police and soldiers were dispatched to the spot to prevent the spread of violence, which followed days of tension between the two ethnic communities in the region.

notes: On 29 January 2018, four FNL Nzabampema Faction rebels were killed by the Congolese army on their way back to the Rukoko reserve (in Burundi along the BDI-COD border near Kiliba/Uvira).

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 29 January. Two days of unrest took over Kasai between January 29-30. Clashes between the FARDC and Kamwina Nsapu militia led to 9 deaths. A later reported indicated 20 dead, plus 350 displaced. On Monday, 4 people were killed in the village of Bata Ishama, 12km from Kakenge.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 29th, the Congolese police clashed with civilians who became violent in the locality of Basoko, causing 5 deaths (4 civilians and one police officer). A vehicle belonging to the PHC/Feronia society hit a woman, who died along with her baby, and another person along the route.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Protesters held a demonstration in Kisoro on January 29th against the arrest of their LC3 Chairman Didas Muntuki. Over 500 locals gathered with their local MP at Kaku Bridge, at which point police dispersed them with tear gas and live bullets.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: Two factions of the Nduma NDC group - Renewal and Mandaima - clashed with one another in the villages of Mukaka and Kailinge, in the grouping of Ihana in Walikale. One person was killed and others were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Katenga village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Manga village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC recovered the location of Nemba.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Dine village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC clashed with the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Mizimu village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 28th, the FARDC recovered the location of Kazimia.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: On January 28, an exchange of shots between police and an unidentified armed group in Kinshase led to two people killed in the comune of Bandalungwa, in Kinshasa. The armed group, who was on the run while being pursued by police, started the exchange. Their driver was killed, as well as a police officer. At least 2 civilians were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 27th, civil society organised a sit-in in Bukavu to protest against the insecurity seen in the region.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 January. Suspected Mai-Mai elements clashed with FARDC in Kahoho (50 km south-west of Lulimba) and reportedly burned houses before retreating. Causalities not known.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On Saturday, January 27th, a Pakistani member of MONUSCO was killed during an operation in Lulimba against an armed group. At least another peacekeeper was injured during the attack. Later reports indicate the attackers were Mai Mai.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 27 January 2018. The LRA looted travelers 15 km from Nambia. The assailants also abducted two men to carry the looted items. The abductees were later released.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On Thursday, January 25th, one civilian was killed and three others injured during an attack by ADF in Eringiti.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
notes: Looting: on January 25th, while escaping from Ubwari, the Yakutumba looted the village of Mahembe (situated between Lulimba and Salamabila.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 25th, the protests by students at the University of Kinshasa continued. Police shot real bullets and used tear gas to disperse the crowds, with reports mentioning that officers stole computers, money and phones, and tracked students down in their residences. At least one student was brought to the hospital after being hit by a bullet. Three policemen were reportedly injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 25th, the FARDC launched an offensive against the UPLC in Kasindi-Lubiriha, 90km east of Beni. During the operation, one of the rebels was killed. A subsequent report mentions two deaths.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 January. FARDC launched operations against Mai-Mai Yakutumba on 21 January and took control on 25 January of Kazimia, a stronghold of the armed group. Causalities not known in both instances.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 January. On 25 January, a large group of Mai-Mai elements attacked an FARDC position in Mahembe (25 km west of Lulimba), forcing FARDC to retreat. Causalities not known. It is not known if the Mai Mai attacks gained control of the area.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 25 January 2018. An LRA combatant looted a family and abducted the wife near Kulugbangu, Dungu as they were traveling from Nambia to Bambangana.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: End-January 2018. LRA attacked villages in the Ango, Bangadi, Bondo, Dungu and Faradje territories. Exact locations and dates not known.

Mayi-Mayi ransacked the local commerce and intimidated the population upon overtaking the location. After being called for reinforcement, the FARDC repelled the APRDC and retook control of the area.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 24th, students from the University of Kinshasa protested against the academic fees they were demanded to pay. The police intervened, using tear gas to disperse the crowd and arresting some of the students. During the process, some students were injured, while four police officers were also reportedly injured due to pelting.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 January. On 24 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC in Mapobu (10 km east of Oicha), killing 5 FARDC soldiers and wounding 36 others. MONUSCO provided support in evacuating the wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On January 23rd, the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba launched an offensive against the FARDC in Baraka. They came from the direction of Lake Tanganyka and attacked the forces, killing one person and injuring another 4.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. A Banyamulenge landowner was killed by unknown assailants near Mutarule.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 22nd, young people in Mbandaka burned a civilian alive - mob justice. The victim had tried to dismantle a solar panel at the Basoko market when he was suprised by a group of young people. They then took him to the front of the Basoko police station, where they burned him alive.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 22 January 2018. An unidentified armed man, who wore military fatigues and spoke broken Lingala, looted three people along a road near Nambia, Haut Uele.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Nyamabo-Songolo, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Tulabo, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 21st, the protest organised by the CLC took place in Kisangani. Several people organised and started marches, accompanied by their priests. The marchers demanded the full application of the Saint Sylvester agreement. Some marched for 500m, others for 1km, but the marches were then stopped by police officers who dispersed protesters with tear gas and real bullets. Some people were injured.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On January 21st, protests organised by the CLC in Kinshasa were choked by police, who used excessive force. Live bullets were shot near the St. Gabriel de Yolo Sud parish (commune of Kalamu), and one protester was injured. Protesters at Saint Jean-Baptiste parish were also dispersed with tear gas and live bullets; one protester was beaten up. MONUSCO reports that 6 protesters were killed, including a 16 year old girl, along with 57 people injured and more than 100 people arrested nationwide.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 21st, the protest organised by the CLC took place in Bukavu. The police deployed their forces in several parts of the city to stop the protest.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); LUCHA: Fight for Change
notes: Arrests: On January 21st, Christians and other protesters such as LUCHA militants were arrested nationwide in Kinshasa, Goma and Beni. MONUSCO reports more than 100 arrests. ACAJ reports 247 arrests.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: National Congolese police intervened on Sunday 21st in Lubumbashi, stopping the protests organised by the CLC in order 'to protect public order'. The police claimed the protesters wanted to burn tyres and block roads.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC intervened after the attack in Kokola, on January 21st, and repelled the ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. ADF launched an attack against an FARDC camp near Mayi Moya on 21 January. Causalities not known.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Mbisa, the rebels ransacked the population.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: Suspected Islamist Ugandan rebels (ADF) killed three civilians in Kokola on January 21st. The victims were a taxi driver and his two customers.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Christians in the village of Mbuji Mayi on January 21st were injured while participating in the protest called by the CLC. Several protesters were arrested. 4 tear gas grenades were thrown into the Saint Jean Baptiste Bonzola cathedral, where Christians were locked up.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: Two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua faced each other in the locality of Makungulano, in Walikale. They clashed due to the sharing of goods collected at the market, causing the population to flee and the activity in the locality to stop. There are two severely injured people.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On January 20th, the LRA kidnapped citizens and refugees from Ndamana.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Sasa, the rebels raped a woman and ransacked the village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Saturday 20th, 3 FARDC soldiers were killed in a clash with ADF that took place in Nyakele, Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Movement of forces: the police and the FARDC were deployed to almost all of the parishes in Mbuji Mayi in order to surround and prevent the protests called by the CLC from happening the next morning. Barriers guarded by the state forces were placed on the main arteries of the city and all the circulation was cut. Forces were also deployed to Kisebwe, in Kalemie, to prevent protests. MONUSCO observers were on the field. The SMS services, social media and internet were blocked ahead of the protests at 23:00 GMT, Saturday night.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An FRPI incursion in the south of Irumu targeted 6 villages during the course of January 20-21. In Sukwa (report mentions Supka), the FRPI ransacked the village but was then repelled by the FARDC. In Songokoi, the army intervened in order to prevent FRPI from ransacking the population.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January 2018. An unidentified armed group abducted five Central African IDP children near Digba, Bas Uele.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 January. ADF launched attacks on FARDC in Oicha region resulting in 12 killed FARDC soldiers and 4 ADF rebels

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: ADF attacked 2 locations near the Uganda border on Friday 19th - the villages of Parikingi and Abialos, resulting in the death of 4 rebels and 20 FARDC soldiers. 4 AK-47s were recovered, as well as a Motorola radio and a mortar. The attack was repelled by the FARDC, but the clash was described as being of an extremely violent nature. Fatalities split between events.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: ADF attacked 2 locations near the Uganda border on Friday 19th - the villages of Parikingi and Abialos -, resulting in the death of 4 rebels and 20 FARDC soldiers. 4 AK-47s were recovered, as well as a Motorola radio and a mortar. The attack was repelled by the FARDC, but the clash was described as being of an extremely violent nature. Fatalities split between events.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC resumed its bombing in Beni on Friday 19th January, in a continued attempt to target ADF.

assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 18th, 2 MSF agents were kidnapped by armed men in Kalembe, in the territory of Masisi. The convoy was returning from Walikale when they stopped to provide medical assistance and fell into an ambush. The FDLR/CNRD are accused of being the actors, among others.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A military convoy, headed by general Philemon Yav, the commander of military operations, came under fire by the Yakutumba on January 19th in Fizi. Four soldiers killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The headquarters of the Mayi Mayi APCLS in Matende, Lwibo, were attacked by a coalition of NDC-R rebels and APCLS dissidents on January 17th. According to local sources, at least 6 people died (2 on the NDC-R side and 4 on the APCLS) and 7 were injured (NDC-R side).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On January 17th, the LRA kidnapped citizens and refugees from Sukadi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 January. From 17 to 19 January, in the Uvira area, FARDC repeatedly clashed with the Burundian Forces nationales de liberation and associated Congolese Mai-Mai groups. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 January. Clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and FARDC in Kambamba, about 65 km north of Tshikapa, resulting in the killing of at least four Kamuina Nsapu militia members

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 January. DRC forces and Kamwina Nsapu militia clashed at Kananga airport. An estimated three dead.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Security Measures: the FARDC announces the launch of a sensitisation towards disarmament campaign in Lubero, in order to promote defection from the Mayi Mayi militias. The FARDC confirms the defection of commander Nzilamba Katika of the Mayi Mayi Leopard, known by Yesu.

actor1: Government of Angola (1975-)
actor2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: after two days of discussion, the provincial governors of Kasai Central and Kwango and the provincial minister of energy of Lualaba decided to reopen the DRC-Angola border which had been closed since 2017.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Burundi)
notes: On January 16th, a civilian was killed by the Batwa militia in the village of Kalubembe, 41km from Pweto. The militiamen attacked with arrows, killing one man and injuring another woman.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On January 16th, the LRA kidnapped citizens and refugees from Gwane.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 2 National Intelligence Agency officers were abducted by armed men in the province of South-Kivu on January 16th. Two days later, there was an attack on a military position in Fizi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Yakutumba attacked villages in the Mutambala sector on January 15-16, trying to besiege them, but were repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Gunshots were heard on the morning of January 16th in the hill 'Tujenge', 12 km to the south of Baraka. Some passerby women were told by the FARDC to turn back when they were heading there. One of the women says she saw the dead body of a combatant on the ground. The Yakutumba claim 5 FARDC soldiers were killed, though this is unverified.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the night of January 14th to 15th, a trader was killed in Kamanyola by an unidentified armed group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Between January-April, report of over 10 targeted killings as well as kidnappings and looting by unknown gunmen stationed at Virunga National Park. 10 fatalities spread over four events between January and April.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: Civil society in Mongala is accusing the stationed military personnel in the villages of Lisala and Bumba of ransoming passing civilians and merchants. In order to recover the money paid, merchants raise prices, creating scarcity of products.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Yakutumba attacked villages in the Mutambala sector on January 15-16, trying to besiege them, but were repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Youth gathered on the morning of January 15th to protest the death of a trader, during the night, at the hands of an armed group. The national route was blocked and all economic activity was paralysed. By midday Monday, police fired warning shots to disperse demonstrators who were trying to set fire to a police station.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
