notes: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Sesele, expelling the ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Monday, January 15th, the ADF attacked the FARDC in Munzambayi, commune of Rwenzori, where they were repelled. According to the FARDC, 5 people were injured (3 of which seriously) and 2 weapons were seized. A later testimony reports 3 FARDC deaths.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 January. There were reported clashes between Twa militias and the Elements at Kabulembe (45 km south-east of Pweto), causing a deterioration of the humanitarian situation in Katama groupement (40 km north-east of Pweto), including displacements of the local population. Causalities not known.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Sunday 14th January, 2 IRC agents were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Mazonde. The two were released 3 days after on Wednesday, thanks to the interveniton of a major who had deserted the army and who is now in command of a Twa militia.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the night of January 13th to 14th, an armed group with killed a pregnant woman in Gemena. The group sought to rob her house and broke down her front door. When the woman approached the window, she was shot and died. The group has reportedly been active in Gemena for some time.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 14th, a group of armed men attacked the FARDC near Kananga airport. The assailants attacked the soldiers during their sleep and proceeded to set their tent on fire. 4 soldiers were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC launched, on January 13th, an offensive against the ADF in Beni and Lubero, in response to the recents attacks by the group. Gunfires and explosions were heard in Beni all throughout Saturday (13th).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Presumed FARDC attacked the ADF in the periphery of Oicha on January 13th. Shots were heard in the locality and it is suspected that the FARDC are attacking the 'death triangle' situated in between Mbau, Kamango and Eringeti. The reports are not confirmed by the military. Military forces overtook two ADF camps.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Around 13 January 2018, the FARDC launched an offensive in Eastern DRC. The offensive took place in the territories of Beni, Oicha and Lubero, and targeted all the armed group involved in conflict in the region, in particular the ADF.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police fired tear gas at churchgoers on Friday, January 12th, who gathered to mourn the seven people killed in protests against President Joseph Kabila two weeks ago. The police claims it fired the tear gas outside the church in order to avoid another polical demonstration.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: DRC police dispersed a march led by Vital Kamerhe in Kinshasa, on January 12th. According to the officers, Vital gathered a crowd of supporters in the high way after a mass organised in order to remember the victims of the December 31st protest. The police claims it was forced to use tear gas to disperse the crowd since the protest was not authorised in advance. During the march, protesters pelted stones at the police.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Economic activities and traffic are paralysed in Ituri since January 12th due to the arrest of the president of the taxi association, which took place on January 11th. The protesters are composed mainly of taxi drivers and students, who have blocked streets and demand the release of the taxi association president.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi-Mayi Malaika attacked the FARDC position in Kalole-Mapepo village in Shabunda territory on January 11th. The assailants stole 38 goats and other goods. They forced seven men to carry the stolen goods.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: A dozen civilians, including a Congolese journalist, were kidnapped by the ADF in Beni, on January 11th. The rebels blocked the vehicles coming from Kasindi before taking the civilians hostage.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: An ambush from the FPRI against 8 women in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Ituri, on January 11th, was prevented due to the intervention of the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The 8 women who had been ambushed the FRPI were then undressed by the same FARDC military men that prevented their ambush, with one of the women being raped by one of the militaries. Earlier that day, women fish vendors going to Bavi were also taken hostage by FARDC men to transport their goods and forced to go into the forest before they were released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified gunmen held up a motorcycle close to Katsiru in Rutshuru territory on January 10th. The assailants abducted the man and woman and stole the motorcycle.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: On January 10th, the Mai-Mai Kilalo attacked the FARDC position in Lubero rural commune in the territory of the same name.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: After reinforcements arrived on January 10th, the FARDC managed to expel the UPLC from Kipese, recovering control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Unidentified armed men broke into a house in Mapendo, in Rutshuru territory, on January 10th, where they shot and killed a woman. In a nearby property, the assailants came across a policeman who shot at them. During the clash the policeman, a man and two women were killed; an infant was shot and wounded.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On January 10th, armed men identified as Mayi-Mayi Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda killed a woman in Mandje village in Walikale territory, accusing her of being a witch. The assailants looted the victim's house.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the month of October, Batwa militias raped and gang raped 17 women along the Kalemie-Kabulo-Kioko road in Tanganyika. The attacks often occurred as the group attacked villages. Coded as four incidents each week in October.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: Looting: A suspected LRA member attacked and looted 3 cyclists and a motorcyclist in Bambangana, on January 10th. The report has nevertheless a low verification rating. No injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Early January 2018. FARDC arrested Romaric Madango an anti-balaka leader and two fellows after they crossed into DRC. They were later extradicted to CAR

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ALPC: Alliance for the Liberation of Congolese People
notes: On January 10th, the FARDC repelled an attack by the ALPC in Brimu, periphery of Ingbokolo in Aru (Ituri). The attack was launched against the positions of the military in retaliation for the killing of their leader last November during a FARDC operation in the area. The clash lasted for an hour, after which the rebels fled, leaving behind an AK-47. The positions of the military in Brimu were reinforced to ensure the population's safety.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 10 January. An hour-long exchange of fire occurred at Ndrimu (location not found) between FARDC and suspected armed elements of the Armee de liberation du peuple congolais, a residual armed group associated with the Kakwa community. The group has been largely dormant, and its strength is assessed to be fewer than 50 elements.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: Briefly after the UPLC occupied the locality of Kipese, the FARDC repelled their attacked and reclaimed control of the location. The UPLC reportedly took refuge in a location nearby and are waiting for reinforcements to arrive in order to launch another offensive in Kipese.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 January. On 8 and 10 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC positions on the MbauKamango axis. Causalities not known.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 10 January 2018, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC positions on the Mbau Kamango axis (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Causalities not known.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR-FOCA combatants abducted eleven people who were returning from their fields close to Kahumiro village in Rutshuru territory, on January 9th. The assailants killed five men.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC attacked the Mayi-Mayi Mazembe position near the village of Domaine in Rutshuru territory, on January 9th. The FARDC chased the armed group out of the village.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC repelled, on January 9th, an attack by the Mayi Mayi in the rural comune of Lubero. The Mayi Mayi attacked the area where the FARDC are established, clashing with the forces. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 07 January 2018. A suspected LRA combatant abducted a girl north of Bamangana, Dungu.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: 4 Mayi Mayi combatants surrendered to the FARDC in Kalau, Kalingati and Kalunguta, in the territory of Beni, on January 7th. These surrenders are expected to be due to the pression exerted by the military on the militia.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 5th, unidentified armed men raided the village of Mununze, in Beni. Apart from looting the village, they kidnapped two men, for which they demanded ransoms.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 5th, a group of armed men raided a house in Kitumba-Bisagara and killed a 62 year old man and his 14 year old son.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 5th, a 34 year old woman was killed by unidentified men in Kibati village.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A military personnel killed a taxi driver on January 4th, in Kananga. According to reports, the conflict started when the driver asked the soldier for the pay concerning the travel. The altercation then developed and the soldier shot the taxi driver several times point blank.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mabala)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
actor2: Private Security Forces (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Hamakombo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Kasongo Faction

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On December 31st, the police dispersed protesters in the Himbi neighbourhood in Goma. Due to pelting stones, the police arrested 4 of them. On the same day and in a different neighbourhood - Majengo - civilians became violent when a police officer shot a civilian. They were prevented from exerting mob justice when other policemen intervened.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police broke off, on December 31st, a LUCHA protest in Lubiriha, Beni. The protesters demanded the implementation of the New Years deal when the police intervened and injured four of them.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Reports of violence against civilians in the form of assaults with machetes owing to intercommunal violence are causing people to flee Djugu and the region of Ituri. A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 fatalities coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Some rioters were arrested by the police.

Air force and long-range artillery were used (operation Tuugo). This came after the establishment of a mechanism to share information on ADF with the DRC forces. On Monday 25th, the Ugandan army claimed to have killed 100 rebels.

notes: On Friday 22nd, the Mayi Mayi struck the FARDC in the operational area of Baraka, killing 9 soldiers in two ambushes.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On December 22nd, in Bunia, the members of the Kimbangist church of Sayo clashed with autochtonous civilians, wounding 6 people with machetes and stone throwing.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: a former commander of the FDLR - Evariste Nizeyimana - surrendered to the FARDC on Thursday 21st, in Lubero.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: Agreement: an old commander of the FDLR-FOCA surrendered to the MONUSCO forces in Goma, on December 21st. The colonel Evariste Nizeyimana, known as 'Kiszito', is responsible for more than 80 people killed, some of them buried alive. He also orchestrated the burning of several villages, namely Buleusa, as well as the massacre in Miliki.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Djugu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The speaker of the FARDC in Ituri confirmed that 2 FARDC soldiers had been attacked by a group of inhabitants armed with machettes in the locality of Tse, Djugu, on Wednesday 20th December. Local sources inform that the soldiers had been invited by a customary chief to disperse a group of inhabitants who sought revenge. Upon arrival, they were attacked with knives and their weapons taken from them.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: The chief of the Mayi Mayi Nyatura militia - Kasongo Kalamo - was killed on December 20th during combats that opposed the Nyatura versus the FDLR/CNRD in Bukama. He was killed in an ambush that he himself had set for the FDLR.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: One hour after the attack in Kavumu, the Nyatura attacked the inhabitants of Numbi and were forced to flee by the police forces. During their escape, they left leaflets behind, asking the inhabitants to pay a sum of 2000$ by the end of the year, subject to a new attack by them should the amount not be paid.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 young people were arrested in Lubumbashi on December 19th during a protest against the electoral calendar. Both were caught after smashing the windows of a courthouse and trying to burn it.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress; OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Police beat up a protester in Kikwit, who responded to a call by OCR to protest on the streets. The protester was affiliated with the UPDS.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: On December 19th, the Mayi Mayi attacked the Ivingu location, in Lubero, in order to steal weapons. A civilian was killed alongside 4 of the assailants.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Military operations in Kaseke, Rutshure, led the FARDC to clash with the FDLR, resulting in the capture of 3 presumed FDLR kidnappers and the release of 3 student hostages. 2 AK 47 weapons were also recovered.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Calm returned 5 days after the death of a young man was announced by the Bahema chief.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The MONUSCO base which had been attacked on December 7th by the ADF has now been reoccupied.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Property destruction: on December 19th, the Nyatura attacked the locality of Kavumu, shooting against buildings, but causing no casualties.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: around 60 houses were burned in the village of Lunju, in Ituri, by inhabitants coming from Walendu Pitsi. This attack occurred in the context of tensions between Lendu and Hema communities.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Property destruction: the Mayi Mayi Nyatura invaded the locality of Kavumu at 19h in the night on December 18th. They shot several houses, but no human lives were lost - they fled at the arrival of the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A soldier was killed on Monday 18th in the region of Djugu.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Nyatura attacked the groupings of Buzu and Mubugu in Kalehe on the night of December 18th.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: FARDC soldiers are threatening and harassing civilians in the Mukamba-Kabeya-Kamwanga-Mbuji-Mayi route in Kasai-Oriental ahead of the planned 19th December protests. The declaration was given by Eugenie Tshika, national deputy.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: The Bahema chief accuses the Lendu youth of burning 28 houses belonging to the Bahema, in Blukwa, in retaliation to the burning of Thethe dwellings by members of the northern Bahema community. He also accuses them of burning a house in Resto, along with 8 motorbikes there.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Monday 18th, a young member of the Bahema community was killed by an unidentified armed group. This sparked tensions between the Lendu and Hema groups, and residents fled the area on Tuesday 19th, fearing that intercommunal conflict could happen.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 17 December. The former leader of the FDLR Evariste Nizeyimana surrendered to MONUSCO in the Lubero area

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: During an attack by ADF in Oicha on December 17th, a civilian was killed, alongside a soldier of the FARDC.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

assoc_actor_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura); Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)

The split came after Mapenzi and Janvier Karairi, the APCLS leader, disagreed over mining exploitations and political pressures - Janvier was opposed to Kabila and Mapenzi was seen as easier to influence.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Opposition deputies, in collaboration with other protesters, marched in Kinshasa on December 11th to protest against the electoral bill and question senators about the liberticidal nature of the bill under consideration.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police violently dispersed a protest held by LUCHA in Goma, forcing some protesters into the police cars with sticks. The protesters were demonstrating against the restriction of the political space and the numerous abuses of human rights attributed to the police in Nord-Kivu.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The locality of Opienge was retaken by the FARDC in a clash with the Mayi Mayi Luc Yabili on December 10th. The locality was captured by the Mayi Mayi on November 30th.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: Mayi Mayi Simba Manu attacked the village of Mabuo, chiefdom of Babila Babombi in Mambasa, abducting 46 people abducted. Four people also died in the river when their boat capsized while trying to flee.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified attackers killed 5 people - 4 belonging to the same family - on the night of 8 December in Mulekera commune in Beni. Residents protested the following day against the violence and the rising insecurity after the attack against MONUSCO. Some burnt tyres in the street.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LDP: Liberal Democratic Party; Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A protest was held by supporters of the Liberal Democratic Party in Goma on 8 December. The police stopped the protest, arresting 4 people, including the president of the opposition LDP, Jean-Paul Lumbu Lumbu. The protesters were demonstrating against the draft law, which according to them excluded youth and women from the deputation race, owing to the representativeness threshold and bail imposed. The police used tear gas to disperse protesters; students who were close were caught in the middle of the tear gas.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: Daily News (DRC); AFP; MONUSCO; Deutsche Welle; Radio Okapi; UN (unspecified); IRIN
notes: An attack by suspected ADF fighters on the MONUSCO base in Semliki in Nord Kivu in the evening of 7 December left 14 MONUSCO and 5 FARDC soldiers dead. Another 53 blue helmets were injured during the attack and reports of rebel deaths vary from dozens to 72. The attack was described by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres as a 'war crime' and the worst attack on UN peacekeepers in the organisation's recent history.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Clash between supporters of the president (Charles Pongo) and rapporteur (Martin Shongo) of the provincial assembly in Lusambo left three severely injured. Police fired shots in the air to disperse the groups and arrested several.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified attackers killed 5 people - 4 belonging to the same family - on the night of 8 December in Mulekera commune in Beni. Residents protested the following day against the violence and the rising insecurity after the attack against MONUSCO. Some burnt tyres in the street.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Looting: Senator Aubin Ngongo Luwowo accused the police of ransacking the residence that hosts Radio vision Kindu Maniema (TKM) on December 7th after an emission that was conducted by an officer sent by the Minister of the Interior. The minister had been accused during the emission of receiving a bribe of 250 000 USD from governor Tutu and senator Mulaila. The Minister informed the senator over the phone that he would send the police to the facilities, which confiscated TVs, radios, emissors, among others.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Students in Lubumbashi took to the streets on December 7th to protest the newly-released order that their university building had to be vacated. They occupied several avenues, but were later dispersed by police with tear gas.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Two people were killed during a clash between Mayi-Mayi Raia Mutomboki and FARDC, on the night between the 6th and 7th December, in Bukavu. The army only confirms one dead. The rebels were forced into retreat to Bubamba.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Students protested against the non-setting of fixes rates for the costs of university in front of the National Institute of Buildings and Public Works turned on December 7th. At least 6 students were harmed, including one shot, and several others were arrested when a joint police-military force intervened to disperse them.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The MONUSCO forces repelled on December 7th an attack by the ADF on one of their bases along the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni territory. 15 Dead.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 07 December. In Semuliki, North Kivu, which resulted in the killing of 15 peacekeepers from Tanzania. Forty-four peacekeepers were also injured during the attack, attributed to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). After a lull in their activities, ADF has resumed their attacks in the area, including against civilians.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The students broke doors and windows and stole items. Police intervened to disperse them and arrested seven.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: Two antagonist factions of the FDLR (FOCA and CNRD) clashed on Friday 1st in Mpati, Masisi territory. The clash caused the displacement of the local population. OCHA suspended its humanitarian actions due to the instability in the region.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
notes: 3 doctors were kidnapped in Lemera, on Friday 2nd, while doing a provincial health inspection. The kidnappers demanded a ransom, which was paid. The doctors were released Saturday 2nd.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: While protests were taking place, a member of the 'Rassemblement' movement, was kidnapped, beaten, stabbed and left in a ravine. He is currently receiving medical help and is in a very critical state. The perpretators are unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Movement of forces: The government deployed, on Thursday 30th, more police forces in Kinshasa, in preparation for the protests which had been called for and which the Government had not allowed. Police members were deployed to disperse all the gatherings of 5+ people in Kinshasa.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
notes: A peaceful protest supporting the departure of President Kabila was dispersed on Thursday 30th by the police in Uvira. Protesters were dispersed with live bullets and one protester was severely injured. The victim was Yorogo Sambaza, section president of the UNC.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: During a protest in Matadi on November 30th, 8 members of the UPDS were arrested by police.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: On 30th November, violent repressions of anti-Kabila demonstrations: in Uvira, Bukavu, Beni, Lubumbashi, Kindu and elsewhere. The police and security forces made numerous arrests and broke up roadways of burnt tires and barricades erected by opposition activists.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Protesters in the commune of Ndesha, in Kananga, were dispersed and attacked by the police when protesting against the electoral calendar published by CENI. Some protesters were in front of the MONUSCO offices and other near Notre Dame. A member of the UPDS, was reportedly shot and wounded by the police.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Rioters blocked streets and burned tires during dead city protests in Goma on 30th November. In certain areas, shots were fired. A young student was arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In Beni, police suppressed an anti-Kabila demonstration held by LUCHA members. 5 LUCHA militants were arrested and journalists were beaten and arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: During a protest against the presidency of Kabila in Furu, Butembo, on the 30th, one of the protesters was killed. The victim belonged to the citizen movement 'Parlement Debout', affiliated with the UDPS.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: While attempting to disperse a group of protesters in Ibanda, Bukavu, on Thursday 30th, the police were violent towards protesters and a journalist belonging to Radio Okapi causing injuries. Protesters demanded the departure of President Kabila on December 2017. The police also dispersed protests in the commune Kadutu.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: Injuries, arrests and kidnappings reported in several cities across the country. In Mbuji-Mayi, police violently suppressed protesters who were trying to take to the streets. Barricades were erected on the roads and tires burned on the road.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Protesters took to the streets of Kinshasa on Thursday 30th. Three leaders of the 'Rassemblement' movement were arrested when trying to join the protest. The police spoke of molotov cocktail being thrown, but these claims were not confirmed. Claims of torture during detention. Protesters gathered in front of Tshisekedi's house were also repelled with tear gas in the morning.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: On Thursday morning, 30th, 6 protesters were arrested in Kalemie during protests. The protest demanded the departure of President Kabila by December 31st.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police dispersed protesters who were holding a demonstration in favour of the departure of President Kabila in Kasindi, on the 30th. The police also arrested 15 LUCHA militants. 2 of them who were released on 4 December claimed to have been tortured.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: Protesters supporting the resignation of President Kabila took to the streets of Butembo on Tuesday 28th. actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police, supported by the military, intervened in a protest in Oicha, on Tuesday 21st, killing 1 rioter and injuring one other. The participants marched down the street, breaking and bruning during their passage, to protest the death of a 25 year old student killed on the night of the 20th presumably by the FARDC. The participants were dispersed with tear gas and real bullets. One woman died and another boy was shot in the abdomen.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A 25 year old student was killed in Tenanbo, located at the rural exit of Oicha, presumable by a member of the FARDC. His name was Kambale Kabuyaya Paulin.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The city of Kilembwe fell, on the night of Sunday 19th, into the hands of the coalition between the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba and Malaika. The FARDC retreated to 20km from the city in order to avoid a bloodbath. The coalition militia attacked the FARDC offices in Kilembwe, killing one soldier. The city of Kilembwe is strategic due to its proximity to the mining site of society Banro, in Namoya. With the taking of this village, the Yakutumba control 80% of the Lulimba-Kilembwe route.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A delegation from the political party Envol was preparing to hold a protest in Kenge, on the 19th, when police quickly intervened and dispersed them with tear gas. The report mentions that several persons were injured during the intervention. Another report mentions 6 severely injured by bullets, 2 by batons and more than 30 militants arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Looting: Civil society in Ikobo, Walikale, claims that the military has since two weeks harassed civilians in the localities of Rusamambu and Muronga. Claims mention that barriers are being erected and that 500 francs are demanded each time in order to assess the camps in both localities. The claims mentions that militaries do not hesitate to demand payment of parts of crops and to torture civilians. The reports have been denied by the military.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A clash between the FARDC and a coalition of Mayi Mayi Mazembe and Malaika took place on the 19th in the locality of Bashu, in Beni. 6 people died, of which 4 militiamen and 2 soldiers. 4 other militiamen were injured. The coalition is said to be defending the Nande community.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: Looting: The Mayi Mayi Charles Kakule stole 33 boat motors from the fishermen in Kyavinyonge, on Sunday 19th. They demanded 95.000 Congolese francs in return for each motor. The motors were robbed because the fishermen had demanded to pay the weekly extortion of 15.000 francs that had previously been demanded. The Edward lake is surrounded by militias who are impeding the fishing activities.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unknown people set a bus on fire in Lubumbashi on the 15th, in the same day that a strike by civilians was called in protest of the announcement of the electoral calendar.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Four people were injured during clashes with the police on Wednesday 15th. Although it started as a peaceful protest, police clashed with protesters, firing live bullets. Accounts differ on the motivations for the protest. On the one side, it is said that protesters were students demanding the resume of their classes; their teachers had been in strike for a week due to their unpaid salaries. On the other end, the protesters are said to be part of a civilian movement in Lusambo to denounce the mismanagement of Governor Berthold Ulungu.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A fisherman and several fish merchants were assaulted by 6 officers in Kalemie when they refused to have their goods seized. At this point, the officers threatened them with knives. After witnesses denounced this, military arrested the officers.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: Police in the Democratic Republic of Congo made several dozen arrests to stifle protests. LUCHA mentions at least 27 civilians were arrested in Nord-Kivu, including 15 in Goma. 13 other activists were detained while a communique was being read in the province of Sud-Kivu. The government confirms 19 arrests, comprising six in Goma, seven in Lubumbashi and six in Matadi. The Human Rights division of MONUSCO notes that there were arbitrary arrests taking place during the day, notably in Goma and Kinshasa. Human Rights Watch mentions that at least 52 people were arrested while protesting in Goma, Kasindi, Kindu, Kisangani, Kinshasa, and Idjwi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi attacked the prison of Kakwangura in Butembo on November 15th as an attempt to free their relatives. The FARDC quickly intervened and halted the assault. The death toll resulted in 3 militiamen killed and one civilian injured. The escape of prisoners was halted by FARDC's intervention.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 15, live bullets were used to disperse protesters who were demonstrating against the electoral calendar dates in the axes Kasindo-Ndosho and Mabanga-Mangengo. The police was supported by the military.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police dispersed with tear gas, on Wednesday 15th, young protesters who had gathered in Matadi to demonstrate against the electoral calendar. The protest took place in the quarters Nord and Belvedere of Matadi.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: LUCHA protesters manifested in Kasindi, Beni, on the 15th, against the electoral calendar of the presidential elections to replace Kabile. Police who had been deployed stopped the protest and arrested 14 militants.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: In Idjwi, on Wednesday 15th, protesters took to the streets responding to a call from other citizens movements and civil society groups to demonstrate their opposition towards the published electoral calendar and demand that President Joseph Kabila leave office by the end of 2017. The police responded aggressively, beating the protesters and arresting some of them. Among them, there is a report by a 15 year old girl who was likewise assaulted by police.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: In Butembo, on the 15th, protesters belonging to LUCHA and Fulimbi barricaded routes in the quarters of Furu and Kitulu. The police dispersed them with tear gas.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Wednesday 15th, rioters identified as LUCHA supporters by some, and students by others, burned tires at the Katoka market in Kananga. They were protesting against the electoral calendar published by CENI, but dispersed quickly when the police intervened.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki clashed with the FARDC on the night of the 14th to 15th in the villages of Kantungo and Changombe, in Mulamba. The militiamen had just raided some houses when the FARDC intervened. The rebels fled into the forest.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 14, a soldier was killed by the FRPI in Singo, a locality 50km from Bunia, in Ituri. The soldier was in route to his position when he was ambushed by the enemy. There was a clash and 4 minutes later he was killed and his weapon taken.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 13 November. An intoxicated soldier of the Congolose Armed Forces shot at a crowd in Kazumba area and killed a civilian. He was arrested later

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On November 13, a new civil group called 'Les Deboutistes' rioted at 5am in Ndosho. They blocked the main street Goma-Sake and burned tires, in protest for a militant belonging to their group whom had been arrested. This was the first demonstration by the group. The Police used tear gas to disperse the youth group.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On Friday 10th, a protest took place in the University of Bunia, in which students protested against the decision to cease by the Minister of Land Affairs of ceasing the land in which the university campus is located to a trader. 16 people were arrested by the police after they intervened to stop the protest.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 10 November. Three women were raped by two men in FARDC uniforms in Kakumba, Kamonia.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police fired tear gas cannisters at sudents who organised a protest in front of the University of Bunia. The students started burning tyres in front of the school to protest the decision of the Minister of Land Affairs, attributing the ownership of the concession from the UNIBU to a trader. Shortly after 10am, dozens of police dispatched to the scene. Reports mention arrested people and one student whose hand will have to be amputated after having lost a thumb.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police forces of DRC dispersed a protest that had started in Lubumbashi. Protersters were affiliated with the UDPS according to local authorities and had begun burning tires to protest against the electoral calendar published by CENI.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Another group protested against the electoral calendar of CENI in Rwashi during the morning of the 6th. The police dispersed the protest.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 Mayi Mayi rebels were killed and four other were captured in a clash with the FARDC when the latter were ambushed during a patrolling mission. The clash lasted for 20 minutes and 1 military is currently disappeared.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Clashes between Congolese troops and supporters of a renegade colonel (Abbas Kayonga) in Congo's eastern city of Bukavu killed seven people on Sunday before he surrendered and turned himself in to U.N. Peacekeepers. Seventeen members of Kanyonga's force surrendered to U.N. troops and nine others were captured by the army. A dozen weapons were captured. Two army soldiers and three of Kayonga's bodyguards were killed in the fighting and two civilians were killed by stray bullets, he said. Another later report mentions only one death for Kayonga's bodyguards but three civilian deaths.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: Unidentified armed men in military gear broke into the Norwegian consulate. There were no injuries and nothing was stolen, apart from some objects broken. The police says it was not informed. The report mentions that the Norwegian consul is the mother of the wealthy art collector Sindika Dokolo, who mobilises social networks towards President Kabila renouncing his position.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fatalities spread over events.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: The FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, regained control over the km 14, 15 and 16 of the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni, on the morning of the 3rd.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Acording to civil society and NGOs, the Twa militia has during this week been plundering houses and villages, killing at least 10. The three locations attacked (Mwabou, Shikayimba and Shikatemba villages) are all located within 30km of Pweto.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fatalities spread over events.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police in Beni said they had arrested nine demonstrators during a march Tuesday against President Joseph Kabila, a day after clashes in the region that left five dead. All nine were reportedly from LUCHA and protesting in the public highway without authorisation. A LUCHA campaigner stated that the police intervened shortly after the protest started, manhandling the protesters. 9 people from LUCHA were arrested by the police.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 October. Suspected Twa militia attacked Luba civilians in Kasanbala and Mwashi village, north-west of Moba. 2 Civilians killed. Fatalities split between both events

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fatalities spread over events.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A protest turned violent in Goma. Protesters, responding to a call from LUCHA, were demonstrating against the decision of the national election commission to hold off on elections to replace Kabila until April 2019. Activists had called for a general strike, but unrest broke out at 5am. Rioters barricaded streets and burned tires. One report mentions that rioters started attacking with knives, achetes, spears, arrows. Security forces killed at least 4 civilians and 1 police officer also died. Another report mentions that the police confirms 2 deaths, while witnesses confirm 6. The police station of Majengo was also completely ransacked before being set on fire. In Ndosho neighbourhood, the rioters held their barricades for 5 hours before the FARDC being called in to help.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Violent clashes broke out in Beni between the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, and the ADF in Beni, over attempts to gain the control of the route that connects Kamango to surrounding localities. At least one rebel was killed. 3 soldiers were wounded and 1 is missing.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Mayi Mayi militia conducted by leader Luc Yabili clashed with the FARDC in Loya.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 October. Suspected Twa militia attacked a Luba militia in Kasanbala village, north-west of Moba, which resulted in civilians fleeing towards Zambia. Causalities not known.

actor1: Bokalakiti Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Ngobi-Mayi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A long standing tension between the Kutu and Bokalakiti communal militias, due to forest products collection in the area, led to an armed confrontation between them. The leader of the Bokalakiti went to raid the Ngobi-Mayi with a revolver.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Different Mayi Mayi militia groups clashed in Loya on 28 October. One of the militias was headed by General Luc.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 October. FARDC and ADF fighting in Beni continues for a second day. Causalities not known.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 October. Suspected Twa militia killed five civilians in Kalembe, west of Pweto.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 October. In Tshikapa, Kamonia territory, Kasai province, four women were raped by four FARDC soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC have been fighting since the afternoon of the 26th an insurgence from presumably the ADF in the city of Beni. The situation has caused some panic among the residents.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of armed men attacked the Evangelical Hospital of Nyakunde. They beat a doctor, a nurse and some patients, taking also drugs and large sums of money. Around 9 to 10 people were assaulted.

actor1: Djupajalafuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Djupagiju Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A land dispute between the residents of Djupajalafuru and Djupagiju degenerated into a fight on the 25th. One person was killed and 2 others seriously injured. Almost all of the houses on either side were looted systematically before being burned. Both villages were emptied of their residents and activities are paralysed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: The houses of Joseph Olengankoy and Alphonse Ntumba Luaba were attacked by armed men, which is expected to be a result of calls for President Kabila to step down and his crackdown on opposition.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified gunmen attacked the police office of Hoho in the night of the 22nd. The fire exchange lasted some minutes. No injuries were registered.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Police officers use teargas to disperse supporters waiting for the arrival of Felix Tshisekedi at the airport of Lubumbashi. According to the police, these were protesters wanting to throw projectiles at him. Tshisekedi condemned the police action.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Property destruction: Several houses were burned down by Mayi Mayi Nyatura in the locality of Mirangi in Bwito, Rutshuru. The civilians fled the scene to Kanyabayonga-Lusowa.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: 6 fishermen were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Lake Edward. Mayi Mayi Charles have been reported to be involved in harassment towards fishermen in this region.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Arrests: The National Police of Congo arrested 28 members of the UDPS who were gathered for a meeting in Lubumbashi, for allegedly insulting President Kabila (the UDPS claims the number is 48). The police surrounded the building, where the members of the UDPS were barricaded, before calling the FARDC and forcing their entry into the building. The UN Special Representative to DRC called on authorities to release the people arrested. They were released 2 days later.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS try to overtake the locality of Kitobo, but are repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS ambushed the military vehicle of the 3411th regiment in Kiusha, in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis. Local police mentions 2 combatants were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS rebels capture the city of Ndondo in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The convoy of the operational sector of Sokola 1, of General Marcel Mbangu, was ambushed by the ADF in the Mbau-Kamanga route. 1 soldier was killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS rebels capture the city of Carton, in the Mwesso-Kitshanga axis.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Toussaint Alonga's brother was attacked and briefly kidnapped from his house in Kinshasa (Alonga is an MP who initiated a petition against the Speaker of the National Assembly; this is expectably why he thinks his relative was targetted).

actor1: M23: March 23 Movement
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: 51 members from the M23 rebel force surrendered voluntarily to the military on Tuesday.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 October. In Rutshuru, on 16 October, growing tensions between Hutu and Nande resulted in 32 houses being set on fire in Bambo village. MONUSCO deployed and relocated 28 Nande residents as a precautionary measure.

actor1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: 16 October. In Rutshuru, growing tensions between Hutu and Nande resulted in 32 houses being set on fire in Bambo village. MONUSCO deployed and relocated 28 Nande residents as a precautionary measure. It is not clear if the unrest was one sided, or against other fighters.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: 16 October. Local militia groups burned down offices of the Congolese National Police and the Agence national de renseignements in Fube, south of Moba.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police stiffled a peaceful march of the meeting of political and social forces for change before it began in Goma. 8 members were arrested and subsequently released.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of armed men in military uniforms killed 4 Hutu civilians and the 3 soldiers that were escorting them between Bambu and Kisheshe, in Bwito.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The militia Elements clashes with the FARDC in the other side of the river Luvua.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Protesters took to the streets in Goma, to protest against the raising of school fees, but the protest was interrupted. In breaking the protest, the police attacked protesters, severely injuring 2 of them, and hurting others. The police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An unidentified group of armed men attacked the manager of the money transfer agency 'La Colombe' and his motocyclist. The manager, who was carrying a bag with money, died.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 5 people were killed by the Mayi Mayi militia of NDC/Renove in the village of Kabirangiriro, in the Kihondo group, in Rutshuru. The attack targetted the Mayi Mayi Nyatura and the perpetrators died.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The FRPI clashed with MONUSCO in Tshanda, 10 km away from Geti, injuring according do one source 3 blue helmets, and according to the UN only 2. 2 civilians were also hurt during the clash, which lasted 15 hours.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The FARDC recover the city of Mukeba, in Fizi, from the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba, pushing the militiamen to the woods. One of the soldiers was captured by the militia.

notes: At least 9 people were killed in the villages of Butsiri and Mirangi, in Kanyabayonga. The killings were attributed to the Mayi Mayi Mazembe. Several Hutu villagers have left the Bwito chiefdom due to the insecure climate.

notes: A MONUSCO base in Mamundioma, Beni, was attacked by the ADF on October 9th. It was the second attack on a MONUSCO base in less than a week. There were 2 casualties on MONUSCO's side. MONUSCO immediately deployed forces with attack helicopters in order to secure the area. One report mentions that 10 people were killed and that at least 22 are missing. 12 other soldiers were hurt.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 07 October - 14 October. Between 7 October and 14 November, members of Mai-Mai Yakutumba and their allies (Mai-Mai Malaika, Mai-Mai Apa Na Pale and Twa militias) staged nine attacks against Kalemie, Nyunzu and Kongolo territories, in which 15 FARDC soldiers and 9 civilians were killed; 4 FARDC and 13 civilians were injured. Specific dates of attack not clear.

source: Radio Okapi; UNSC; CAJ News; Twitter; HRW
notes: On 15 September 2017, in Kamanyola, FARDC and PNC elements opened fire on Burundian asylum seekers, who were allegedly rioting (reported by Radio Okapi), killing 38 people. Those killed included 15 women, 22 men and a 12-year-old girl. 1 FARDC soldier was also reported killed, although details weren't provided.More than 100 asylum seekers were injured. Five soldiers and a police officer have been presented on trial on 30 July 2019 on charges of murder and attempted murder for the incident.

notes: The FARDC supported by MONUSCO have taken control of Mayi Mayi positions in southeastern Lubero and in the north of Rutshuru after three days of military operations in these areas. The Mayi Mayi retracted to Kamandi lac and Shanita.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: There were clashes between police and rioting students from the University of Mbandaka.

assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: The FARDC supported by MONUSCO have taken control of Mayi Mayi positions in southeastern Lubero and in the north of Rutshuru after three days of military operations in these areas. The Mayi Mayi retracted to Kamandi lac and Shanita.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people accused of banditry were killed by a crowd in Mbandaka.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of 15 unidentified men armed with machetes, stones and sticks attacked the Secretary General of the Congolese Communist Party in his home in Kinshasa. He was seriously injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Gumino)
notes: There were clashes between Banyamulenge Gumino and Fuliiru militia in Minembwe. A local chief reported that there had been some deaths and injuries.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Gumino)
notes: Three days of clashes between Banyamulenge Gumino and Bafuliiru militias in several areas of Fizi. Students at Sangani, Aleba, Ngoma and Binyenga were unable to write the primary school exam. Churches in Binyenga and Kahira were burned down in these clashes.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: Looting: 22 LRA militants attacked the community of Nambiogo, near Limai. They looted food. No injuries were reported.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: NDC-R forces have occupied several localities in Lubero. They have installed parallel administrations, which tax the population, prevent access to fields, and prevent NGOs from accessing the areas.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A girl from Bagira was kidnapped by an unidentified group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A student at the Catholic University of Bukavu was kidnapped and held for 5 days by an unidentified group.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: At least 17 people have been kidnapped by the Ugandan ADF-NALU and taken to an unknown destination. They were kidnapped from Mayangose, near Beni.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: LRA militants abducted a man and his wife.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A doctor was assassinated by unidentified assailants in Mweso.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A student at the Institute of Pedagogical Education in Bukavu was kidnapped by an unidentified group.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The FARDC arrived at a senior official's farm in Bihambwe to clear away squatters. There was a clash with an unidentified group, in which 2-5 people were killed and many wounded.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Batwa militia attacked Malumbi, near Kalemie. 7 people were killed and 34 people were wounded.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Gumino)
notes: 4 people were wounded in clashes between Gumino Banyamulenge and Fuljiru Mayi Mayi in Mikati village in Minembwe. The population of the village has fled.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI raided Bei II village in Irumu, where they stole 157 cattle, looted houses, and abducted 3 teenagers. All of the inhabitants have fled into the forest. The day before, FRPI raided the villages of Ruzinga Mukubwa and Kazana, where they extorted the inhabitants.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: Looting: 6 LRA militants ambushed 2 motorcyclists east of Gangala, looting their belongings. The assailants wore military clothing and were armed with AK47s. They stole food and money.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Supporters of the PPRD held a march to protest against a petition criticising the Governor of Kwilu. The march was dispersed when shots were fired.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A group of residents tried to destroy the house of a man suspected of being involved in a kidnapping. The police intervened and fired at the crowd. A 10 year old playing nearby was hit by a bullet and died.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: Following the escape of prisoners from a Kinshasa jail, the police have carried out a mass-crackdown to re-arrest the escapees. An unknown number of civilians have been targeted in the ongoing mass arrest.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: There were clashes in Lubuye between the FARDC and the Kalakala Mayi Mayi group and Imbonerakure who had crossed into the eastern DRC from Burundi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: There was fighting between FARDC forces and Kamwina Nsapu in Miabi. Inhabitants have been abandoning their villages to escape the fighting. 2 Kamwina Nsapu have been killed. Kamina Nsapu have burned down houses in Bena Nsamba, Mbombo, Dipongu and Kansenga.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Taxi drivers in Kikwit held a demonstration outside the Town Hall to protest the high taxes that they are forced to pay.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A 17 year old was kidnapped by an unidentified group.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Mayi Mayi Simba occupied the Kalay Boeing Mine in Walikale.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: CENI ennumerators protested outside the offices in Mbandaka to demand payment of their February wages. They tore down part of the fence and lit a fire to paralyse the activities in the office. The police dispersed the protest and arrested a protester.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An artisanal miner was shot dead by unidentified assailants.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The head of CENI wass kidnapped for 3 days. CENI was accused of failing to pay the debt that they owe to local businesses which lent them fuel and resources to use in the voter registration process.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A police officer was killed and his body was dumped in the Katoka 2 market. Militia fired gunshots into the air after the police officer's body was discovered.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Mazembe militia attacked the village of Ngoroba in Rutshuru. 3 people were killed and 40 houses were burned down.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 prisoners escaped from the Kalemie Prison on Friday. Only 1 has been recaptured.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Following an attack on a village the previous day, the FARDC launched a counter-offensive.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Strike:Civil Society groups organised a strike in Kavumu to denounce the killings in Sud-Kivu. Schools and markets did not open.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: About 40 Kamwina Nsapu militia attacked Nguej village at around 1900. They abducted the local chief and torched 25 houses.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Strike:Civil Society groups organised a strike in Miti to denounce the killings in Sud-Kivu. Schools and markets did not open.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers destroyed a Mayi Mayi position in Kilobuze, near Kitingi. They killed 2 militants and seized an AK47 rifle.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: LRA forces attacked a military position in Bamangana, killing a sergeant and a civilian (a Mbororo herdsman). 19 people were kidnapped during the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 3 people (an attacker, a soldier, and a police officer) were killed in an attack on a Canadian mine in Namoya. The mine owner, Banro, has announced that it has suspended operations in the mine.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 3 TV5 journalists were beaten and assaulted by the police for reporting on the prison escape in Kinshasa.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Dozens of prisoners escaped from a jail in Kasangulu.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 8 LRA kidnapped 3 villagers from Ndamana, in Ango. 1 was killed and the other 2 were released.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: CNRD fighters attacked a Nyatura of Kasongo post at 4am. They drove out the Nyatura and proceeded towards Kalengera. Inhabitants nearby have fled.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: May 2017. During the month of May, FRPI executed one person summarily and raped six others in Ituri. Dozens of other HR abuses reported though specific instances unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A FARDC patrol injured and captured the leader of the Mayi Mayi Nyatura militia, David Komayombi in a clash.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 23 LRA militants abducted 16 civilians near Parka. They were forced to carry looted goods. 8 were released later in the day. 8 were held for 2 days.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Some 100 residents of villages in Kaponda demonstrated in front of the Lubumbashi courthouse to protest against the authorities, who they accuse of having sold their villages and fields to 3rd parties.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 armed men attacked houses in Kashusha. They killed 2 members of a family.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: The CNRD forces attacked a position held by Nyatura militia, who were under the command of Kasongo. A Nyatura fighter was reportedly wounded.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 100 Bana Mura militia, led by a FARDC major and some police officers attacked Tshitundu There are 8 confirmed deaths from the attack, including the village's Luba representative, who was publicly executed at the beginning of the attack.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 20 LRA militants abducted 7 civilians as they travelled from Banda to Kpasi. They were forced to carry looted goods and then released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

assoc_actor_1: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 50 UPDS cadres attacked the Limete Police Station, setting alight a troop transport vehicle and a tent. 28 prisoners escaped and police officers were beaten. 100 police officers surrounded the UPDS headquarters and refused to allow UPDS supporters into or out of the building. A policeman later died of burn injuries.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Most of the abductees were rescued during a rescue operation but six staff members (including one international) were still being held by the militia. One of the drivers was seriously wounded in the attack and taken to the hospital.'

actor1: Bana Mura
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Lulua Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Cinq village in Kasai was attacked by Bana Mura militia organised by FARDC commanders. Luba and Lulua villagers were rounded up and shot or killed by machetes. Villagers who tried to escape were stopped at a military checkpoint on the road out of the village and killed or raped. Bana Mura invaded the hospital, killing some patients and medical personnel. The UN has corroborated 116 deaths in Cinq. Many of the villagers who escaped have been mutilated. The few Kamwina present in the village fled, without reported clashes with the Bana Mura.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
