actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 March: 2 UN employees, an American and a Swede-Chilean, and 4 DR-Congo nationals were abducted by unidentified assailants on Tshimbulu Rd near a bridge over the Moyo River in Kasai-Central. The UN officials were in region investigating violence and abuses. The two UN employees were found dead on March 28, 2017, and the 4 Congolese people who accompanied were found dead on May 7, 2018. Later investigations implicated military officers in the killings.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

No injuries were reported but at least 3 militiamen were arrested. Several people (coded as 3 across 2 events) were killed over the course of the weekend.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia

As they were arming themselves with machetes, slingshots and arrows, FARDC soldiers intervened and opened fire on them, leading to a clash that resulted in 3 fatalities. 2 of those killed were civilians who were reportedly hit by stray bullets, while one soldier also died. A different source said 2 soldiers and 3 civilians were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

When they refused to turn over the soldier, who was wounded, the South Sudanese forces accused them of collaborating with rebels and attacked. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: Agreement: Gedeon Kyungu, leader of the Bakata Katanga militia who had escaped from prison following a conviction for crimes against humanity, surrendered with about 100 fighters at a ceremony in Malambwe village. The circumstances of his surrender were not clear.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 people allegedly died after a drunken soldier in civilian clothes began firing into the air in Beni, causing a panic among the population who believed the firing was from an ADF attack. 15 people allegedly drowned while trying to escape the area, while 2 were killed due to heart attacks.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Clashes were reported between the Kamwina Nsapu militia and military forces around Kananga airport and in the city centre. The militia allegedly managed to take control of the airport at one point during the 2 days of clashes, but were later ousted from their position after being surrounded. At least 28 people were killed in the violence, allegedly primarily militiamen but also including 8 deaths among Congolese forces. At least 3 civilians were killed, including a hostess of Congo Airways, during the clashes. Between 52-185 militiamen were captured in the fighting. 30 civilians were also injured. Other sources had the casualty figures from 46 to 'hundreds'.

assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Continued clashes in Kinshasa between large numbers of protesters and police over election delays resulted in 15 killed, while 49 civilians were said to have been killed in total. As many as 3 more police were allegedly killed in the second day of violence. A police station and 12 other police positions were looted and set on fire by rioters according to police. About 126 injuries were also reported, across the protests in Kinshasa, Beni, Matadi and Goma. As many as 368 people were arrested by the PNC, FARDC and ANR (intelligence agency) across protests in Bandundu, Beni, Goma, Kindu, Kisangani, Kinshasa, Matadi and Tshikapa. These totals were according to the UN office for Human Rights.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: Le Potentiel; Deutsche Welle; Radio Okapi
notes: 14 civilians and 3 police officers were reported killed in clashes which broke out during protests organized by the OCR against elections delays by President Kabilas government. One of the police officers was allegedly burnt alive. The protests were reported to have drawn thousands of participants. The HQs of several of the ruling coalitions parties (including the RCD,PPRD, ATD, ARC and CNC) were also burnt down by opposition demonstrators, but no casualties were reported from these acts. 49 civilians were said to have been killed in the violence in Kinshasa in total.

Military reinforcements dispersed the arsonists. During the events at least one person was hit by a bullet and killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 humanitarian workers from the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) were kidnapped in the late afternoon in Mashinga, in Masisi (North Kivu) on their way to a humanitarian mission to Kalembe. Police sources said the kidnappers demanded the payment of a ransom of $1,000 each before their release. Nyatura would be the perpetrators. If the membership of the captors is proved, this kidnapping would be considered a violation of the act of commitment signed in August by Nyatura and APCLS militias to end insecurity.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Recruitment: the DRC government reportedly recruited, between September and December 2016, militia members from the M23 movement to join the FARDC and the DRC police, in order to choke the peaceful protests that took place in December 2016, and which caused several civilian deaths.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Clashes were reported in the Limete and Kasavubu areas of Lemba district in Kinshasa after demonstrators hostile to the political dialogue started throwing rocks, smashing vehicles windows and injuring their occupants. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested a dozen of the protesters. The demonstrators also targeted the HQ of the UNC and ATD parties who are participating in the dialogue with rocks and burned tires in front of them. At least one protester was injured and 90 arrested.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A march was organized in Uvira by local civil society groups to show solidarity with the victims of the recent attacks in Beni. Over 100 people dressed in black with 'I Beni' signs marched through the main streets of the city.

Vehicles were burned during the incidents and a number of injuries were reported among both the protesters and the police. At least 12 people were arrested during the clashes.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Hundreds of workers of the SOKIMO mining company organized a peaceful march in Watsa to demand 50 months of salary arrears.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km northeast of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. A FARDC colonel claimed that 70 casualties had been taken in one day to capture Kambi ya Miba. No other casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km northeast of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

notes: 2 people were killed and at least 5 wounded in an attack on the largely Hutu inhabited Kyuto village in Lubero by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen which was opposed by FARDC. The militiamen also burned at least 50 houses before being repulsed by Congolese soldiers.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: 3 people were killed and many abducted in an attack by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen near a mining site in the Muchacha area of Mambasa. The attackers engaged in systematic looting of the area, used the hostages to transport the goods, and raped 4 women who were also kidnapped.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: More than 800 state employees, mostly health professionals, protested in Mbandaka to demand payment of their salaries.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Nearly 500 physicians observed a sit-in before the Office of the General Secretariat for Public Health in Kinshasa to demand their risk premiums.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: Local sources reported that a unit of the Ugandan army has established its position in recent weeks in the locality of Tshogo in the full gorilla reserve of Sarambwe in Rutshuru (North Kivu). No incidents were reported while the agenda of the soldiers remains unknown.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A trader and his wife were wounded by gunfire in the Mirindi area when armed men wearing military uniforms broke into their house and robbed them.

actor1: Butembo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 24 August 2016, youth members of a self-defense militia in Butembo captured two women who had just arrived in the town by mini-bus and burned them alive after accusing them of being ADF rebels.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Youth demonstrators threw stones while police used aerial firing to disperse them in Butembo following the killing of two women by a self-defense militia after they were accused of being members of the ADF. At least 57 people were allegedly arrested in relation to the killings and subsequent rioting.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Mbuji Mayi was largely shut down and some tires were burned to blockade streets in response to a 'dead city' protest called by the Rally for the Opposition to reject the political dialogue called by President Kabila. A motorcycle was also burnt. At least 32 arrests were reported across Mbuji Mayi and Kinshasa during the 'dead city' protest.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The 'dead city' protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was not very well attended in Bukavu, but a protest was lodged to demand 'respect for constitutional deadlines'.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The 'dead city' protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was well-attended in Goma.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The 'dead city' protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was well-attended in Kinshasa with a noticeable slowdown. Some barricades were also set up but were quickly dismantled by the security forces. At least 32 arrests were reported across Mbuji Mayi and Kinshasa during the 'dead city' protest.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A man was burned alive by residents of Butembo after he was accused of being a member of the ADF.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
source: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Okapi
notes: Agreement: The APCLS and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia, two groups active in Masisi, have signed a peace agreement, committing to end kidnappings in the area and returning police stations occupied by the militias. The agreement was negotiated with the help of MPs from the Masisi area and the security forces. They also agreed to disarm and hand their weapons to the Congolese military.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Young people from various civic movements, civil society organizations and political parties, including the UDPS, protested in Beni to demand 'the immediate resignation' of President Kabila and the government.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 2 people were killed in a machete attack by suspected ADF rebels in the Kiteya and Makulu areas, 20km from Beni. 6 others were wounded, while 7 houses were burned down and 4 motorcycles torched.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police used aerial firing to disperse a group of youths who were blockading roads and burning tires around the UDPS HQ. The UDPS HQ was later surrounded by security forces. It was not clear what touched off the incident.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After police arrested 13 Hutu traveling from Masisi to Bunia in Butembo for possessing machetes and axes in their luggage, young people in Butembo gathered and demanded access to the defendants. The police dispersed them with aerial firing, injuring a demonstrator. The youths then barricaded major roads in Butembo with burning tires and marched on the residence of the mayor of Butembo before again being dispersed by police and FARDC personnel.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A pro-democracy movement 'Revival of Outrage' held a protest outside the INEC offices in Bukavu. About 20 of the protesters stormed the offices and disrupted work with whistles and makeshift drums to demand the holding of elections.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A FARDC colonel was killed by unidentified assailants in Bukavu following a trial in which he was accused of failing to protect victims in a conflict between Banyamulenge communities. He was murdered despite the presence of a bodyguard.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Clashes broke out between police and UDPS activists who were celebrating the appointment of a new Secretary-General of their party after police attempted to disperse their march. At least 6 people who had scuffled with a police officer were arrested, while 6 protesters were wounded.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A man was beaten to death by youths who took him for a thief. The police were able to save the man as the youths were attempting to burn him alive, but he later died in hospital.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In response to an attack on Bwalanda by Nande and Hunde, Hutu residents of Nyanzale burned most of the remaining Nande/Hunde houses in the town (rioting had led to arson attacks earlier in the week).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Hunde Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: After the bodies of 3 Hutu residents of Nyanzale were found dead, Hutu in the area rioted and burned the houses of Nande and Hunde in the area who they accuse of being behind the killings.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: People marched from Butembo to Beni to protest against insecurity in their territory. Once they arrived these protesters were blocked outside the city by security forces while clashes occurred in Beni between protesters and security forces there (it was not clear if these protesters became involved in the clashes between protesters and police in Beni).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Arrests: 80 ADF rebels were arrested in Beni territory by FARDC in connection with the capture of an Imam who was engaged in youth recruitment in the area.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Thousands of demonstrators protested in Beni against insecurity in their territory following the killing of more than 40 civilians by suspected ADF rebels in Rwangoma and a smaller attack in Mayi moya the day before. The protesters raised barricades and clashed with police who used tear gas to attempt to disperse them, and later soldiers who reinforced them. At least 2 people, including a protester who died of a gunshot wound and a police officer, were reported killed and 5 wounded in the violence. At least some of those injured were hit by gunshots.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 Hutu residents of Bwalanda were killed when Nande and Hunde groups from the Nyanzale area went to the village and burned houses belonging to Hutu. The body of one of those killed was found the next day.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A woman accused of being part of the ADF was beaten to death and had her body set on fire by residents of Beni during protests against ADF attacks in the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 members of the Catholic NGO Caritas were kidnapped as their convoy passed through the Mpati area of the Bashali-Mokoto grouping in the Masisi area. A second vehicle escaped although it was fired upon, resulting in wounds to a German journalist. The hostages were later released after a ransom was paid.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 3 people were killed in an attack by suspected ADF rebels in Mayimoya in the Oicha area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 Hutu residents of Nyanale were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi militiamen from their fields near Nyanzale. They were allegedly found dead in Katwe, near Nyanzale, a few days later.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 6 FDLR rebels and 14 local fighters aligned with the FDLR were killed during clashes with Congolese soldiers during August as part of the Sokola II operation (the 6 rebel deaths coded in another event). 10 fighters were also arrested and 7 others were sent to the UN mission.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Pro-Bruno Mavungu activists (the former secretary general of the UDPS) and youth members of the UDPS clashed outside their parties former HQ in the Limete commune of Kinshasa. At least 2 people were injured in the fight. The youth members of the UDPS were allegedly armed with machetes and iron bars and were accused of being sent by Felix Tshisekedi to disrupt the Mavungu supporters meeting.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 people were killed and several injured in an attack by unidentified assailants at Runingu market in South Kivu. The mastermind of the attack was later arrested at Kavimvira on the border between Burundi and DR-Congo.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of Beni territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 August 2016, residents of Nyabibwe in Kalehe captured 6 gunmen and relieved them of their weapons following an attack on a group of Nyabibwe residents who had been returning from a mining site. The gunmen were handed over to FARDC.

actor1: Okito Dimba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Lotelama Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 15 people were killed and 60 houses burnt in a clash between two rival camps of the ruling family in the villages of Okitodimba and Lotelama in the Okolongo sector of Sankuru.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 policemen and 9 members of Kamwina Nsapus (Jean-Pierre Pangi) militia, including the leader himself, were killed in a clash with police in the Tshimbulu area which was allegedly started by Nsapus militia. 4 other police are missing, while 40 militiamen were captured during the fighting.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of Kashusha barricaded the main road leading to the Kavumu airport to protest the killing of 3 people during a robbery the day before, and a growing sense of insecurity in the area due to banditry.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A group of 6 assailants armed with guns and machetes attacked a group of Nyabibwe residents returning from the Kiburi mining site, killing 1. They are believed to be part of a network of shepherds from the Kalehe highlands who often attacked residents of the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: Arrests: The commander of the FDLR-FOCA was captured by FARDC at Katiru in Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: FARDC soldiers backed by MONUSCO have engaged in clashes with ADF rebels in the south Eringeti area since the beginning of an operation against them on Aug.8, which has resulted in an unconfirmed number of ADF rebels killed (coded as 10). 3 soldiers were also killed, and another 3 wounded.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Over 200 students from the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi in Kisangani demanded the rehabilitation of a dormitory they had been housed. The dormitory was burned down in July by University of Kisangani students.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Looting: Several properties in the Mvula area of Mitwaba were raided by Mayi Mayi militiamen, who fired shots into the air to scare the villagers away.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: PNC officers arrested 9 young people who were demanding that they be allowed to participate in the 'political dialogue' called by the president. The officers allegedly beat some local people during the arrest.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Youths from the Masisi area have set up roadblocks on the road between Masisi and Goma in order to prevent humanitarian work in the area, which contains 30 IDP sites. They accused the NGOs of not living up to the expectations of the population, lacking transparency in their use of funds, and having failed to recruit enough local staff.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: The youth wing of the MLC held a demonstration and burned tires in front of the office of the federation of the new province of Ecuador in Mbandaka. The youths disapprove of the current federal committee.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 9 people were killed in Tshimbulu in an attack by a new militia created by Kamwina Nsapu, the chief of the territory of Dibaya. The attack started with an assault on the residence of the chief of police, where his bodyguard was killed. They then set fire to the police headquarters, the CENI office, the mayors house and other buildings, before killing 4 police offices and wounding 2 others. 4 militiamen were also killed during the incident. The militia was allegedly created to rid Kasai-Central of law enforcement personnel who harass the population.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 11 FARDC soldiers and a MONUSCO peacekeeper were wounded during operations against ADF rebels in the Beni area. A helicopter dispatched to recover the wounded came under fire and had to turn back. They were successfully evacuated the next day.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Lawyers in Mbuji-Maya organized a march to request the lifting of immunity for an MP accused of beating up one of their colleagues.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: About 100 youths demonstrated outside the offices of the representative of the AU in the Gombe commune of Kinshasa to support the inclusion of the representative in the 'political dialogue' called by the president.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: 03 - 08 August. Five Hutu, two Hunde and 11 Nande civilians are killed by Mayi-Mayi groups (mainly Mayi-Mayi Mazembe and Mayi-Mayi Nyatura) in Kibirizi. Seven of the civilians were killed on 07/08, though the exact date(s) of the remaining fatalities are not known. 18 fatalities spread over 6 events between 3 and 8 August.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The national president of the UDR was abducted by armed men wearing military uniforms in the municipality of NDjili.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A soldier was killed and 3 others wounded by a Mayi Mayi militia attack in the village of Tomombo in Mitwaba.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 7 civilians were killed in an attack on Kibirizi by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen. Congolese forces arrived during the attack and fought them off.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: A suspected member of the Mazembe Mayi Mayi militia was killed by Nyatura fighters.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: At least 7 people were killed and hundreds of homes burned in a raid allegedly by FDLR-Nyatura coalition militiamen on Kibanda.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Property destruction: Mayi Mayi militiamen set fire to the Ngoroba IDP camp in the Mazembe area of Rutshuru. The inhabitants fled the area and no casualties were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were found dead in the Nyanzale area of Kibirizi, at least one of the bodies was that of a Nyatura fighter who had been burned alive in his home.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 4 civilians were killed by unidentified gunmen in the Kashalira area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A soldier and a civilian were killed by unidentified assailants in Kahunga.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: 03 - 08 August. Five Hutu, two Hunde and 11 Nande civilians are killed by Mayi-Mayi groups (mainly Mayi-Mayi Mazembe and Mayi-Mayi Nyatura) in Kibirizi. Seven of the civilians were killed on 07/08, though the exact date(s) of the remaining fatalities are not known. 18 fatalities spread over 6 events between 3 and 8 August.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Hundreds of miners took to the streets in Mungwalu, in the Bunia area, to protest the killing of a miner, allegedly by the police who were pursuing her over a small debt. The miners attacked a police station causing the police to flee, but they later returned and fired shots into the air to disperse the protesters.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: The PPRD organized a march in Lubumbashi to support the 'inclusive national dialogue' launched by President Kabila.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents of Kabamba (Kabare) attacked a police station over accusations that police failed to intervene in a robbery that led to a woman's death. The residents blockaded the main road to Bukavu/Kalehe/Goma. Police were unable to disperse the protesters despite reinforcements from Kavumu.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 04 August. MONUSCO was directly targeted on August 4 when suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements fired a rocket-propelled grenade round towards the MONUSCO base in Semliki. As a result of the sustained pressure from the operations, Allied Democratic Forces elements continued to move north, including into Ituri province.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: Kamwina Nspau militiamen occupied the town of Tshenge in Kasai-Central.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: A Mayi Mayi militia killed an IDP in the Kibirizi area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

Seven of the civilians were killed on 07/08, though the exact date(s) of the remaining fatalities are not known. 18 fatalities spread over 6 events between 3 and 8 August.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A miner was allegedly killed by police after being pursued by them for a minor debt in Kpangba, in the Bunia area.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Kamwina Nsapu militiamen ambushed a train traveling from Kananga to Ilebo in Mfwamba village in Dibataye sector. They severely beat two police officers and stole one of their weapons.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: After a new head of the locality from a local family was allegedly appointed in Ngwa, in the Kongolo area of Tanganyika, the situation was disputed by another family and a brawl broke out, which included the use of machetes. Many people were wounded and houses were destroyed. The two families have been in competition for power in the area for months.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: At least 1 person was killed in clashes between UDPS supporters and police forces in Kinshasa. The fight allegedly started when a police officer was passing the UDPS HQ and was attacked by activists, which led to the officer firing into the crowd while trying to escape. During the incident a bus was torched; police also used tear gas to try to disperse the crowds. There was also an unverified report that a police officer was killed.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga)
notes: Recruitment: 31 July. Mayi Mayi-Bakata Katanga militia staged a recruitment in Kyalwa village.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: Activists of the various political parties making up the Rally of the Opposition coalition rallied in front of the UDPS HQ in Mbuji Mayi.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Congolese soldiers re-occupied the Mwalika area, an ADF stronghold whose population had been forced to grow food for them, without a fight.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The OCR staged a rally to protest against a potential third term for President Kabila near Kinshasas Martyrs Stadium which reportedly attracted thousands and included a speech by leading opposition figure Etienne Tshisekedi in which he demanded elections be held by the end of 2016. Police were present during the rally, which later turned into a march, but only minor incidents occurred and no injuries were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A military magistrate was beaten by the personal guard of the commander of the Sokola 1 operation after the magistrate ordered the arrest of two Sokola 1 soldiers for allegedly trying to steal a large amount of military rations which were found in their homes. He was also held by the military intelligence service for 4 hours before being released.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 7 people were killed in an attack by the ADF on Oicha, which was repulsed by Congolese soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers. Among those killed were 2 civilians, 3 attackers and 2 soldiers. A MONUSCO peacekeeper was also wounded and 3 ADF rebels captured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Congolese soldiers attacked a camp of international poachers in the Niangara area who have allegedly carried out attacks on the local population. Both South Sudanese soldiers and LRA rebels have been known to poach in the area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: The presidential majority held a rally in the capital to support the political dialogue announced by President Kabila. Many MPs and activists of the PPRD were present. As many as 40,000 people attended.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A position of the army was attacked by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Charles Kakule. The militiamen forced the military out of their camp and wounded a woman. A soldier is also MIA after the action. The military re-occupied their position after the events.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: The governor of Kasai-Oriental held a march in support of political dialogue in DR-Congo, which included members of the presidential majority.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: A march in support of dialogue was called by President Kabila in Gbadolite. The march included members of the provincial government, MLAs, officials and activists of the party of the presidential majority.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police and UDPS supporters clashed in Lubumbashis Matshipisha neighbourhood as UDPS activists gathered to discuss and celebrate the return of their leader Tshisekedi. 4 people were arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A Soficom agent traveling with a large amount of money was killed in an ambush that allegedly involved several FARDC soldiers and other unidentified individuals.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Mayimbi, near Aveba, killing a woman.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police and UDPS supporters clashed in Lubumbashis Matshipisha neighbourhood. No other details were given.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Fangasa, near Aveba, killing a woman accused of collaborating with FARDC and looted property.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The leader of a Raia Mutomboki faction, Simuzizi Labani, was shot in the head and a child wounded in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Luberizi area.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Motorcycle taxi drivers staged a protest-strike in Kisangani against alleged arbitrary arrests and harassment against them by agents of the cities traffic police. They built a barricade on roads leading to the city centre and allegedly trashed a police station and some businesses. Some protesters engaging in a march were also dispersed by police using tear gas. At some point during the events, 3 protesters were allegedly killed during clashes with police along with several injured, including policemen. The police allegedly opened fire on the protesters.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
notes: A trader was killed and 3 others injured in a suspected attack by suspected Burundian militiamen in the Uvira area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Movement of forces: The Congolese army and MONUSCO launched a military operation, named 'Kiboko 3' against the FRPI in south Irumu, including the use of air support.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked a passenger vehicle in the Matafa area of the Walendu Bindi chieftaincy, injuring at least 3 traders and stealing goods.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: During an arrest, the son of a police commander slapped a villager who was angry about the police action, leading to a clash between residents of the area and the police, with anger specifically directed at the police commanders son.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 people were killed by unidentified assailants using machetes in the Bwalanda area of North Kivu. At least 3 were burned to death in their homes.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: Kamwina Nsapu militiamen ambushed a vehicle being driven by a pastor and his family. No injuries reported.

actor1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A farmer was shot in the foot by armed forces identified as UDA as he was traveling west of Kaka II, DRC. After being shot, he managed to hide in the bush for a few hours before being stransported to the hospital in Dungu, DRC by a motorcyclist.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 3 people were killed, including a civilian, in a clash between the APCLS and Raia Tujigemeye Nyatura groups in Butale. The APCLS managed to dislodge the Raia Tujigemeye group from the village.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After a man died of his injuries following a beating by police, an angry mob ransacked and burned a police station in Miabi

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Kamwina Nsapu militiamen attacked the offices of the deputy commissioner of the Fuamaba National Police and forced the police to retreat before burning it down.

actor1: PERCI: Civilian Personnel of the Military
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Between Jul.18-23 three cases of 'torture and extortion of property' were recorded by the 'PERCI', a civilian paramilitary unit organized by the military. On Jul.20 a farmer was beaten and had a bag of rice stolen in Mbulula, while 2 other incidents occurred in Kahenye and Sayi, all in the Kongolo (Tanganyika) area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 1 person was killed and 5 others injured after militiamen attacked a truck in the Kyanyunda locality in South Kivu. One of those injured later died in hospital. The attackers had been robbing some motorcyclists before the truck showed up and they started shooting.

notes: Recruitment: FOREBU rebels have allegedly been recruiting in the Bijombo area, specifically in the villages of Chanzovu, Kagogo and Kateja.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 3 Mayi Mayi militiamen were killed in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Busafa village, Mitwaba.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Raia Tujigemeye)
notes: A newly created 'Nyatura' militia, Raia Tujigemeye, has occupied Butale in the Bashali Mokoto grouping.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A civilian accused of colluding with those responsible for a recent attack on Kibirizi was stoned and killed by Kibirizi youths.

actor1: FOREBU: Republican Forces of Burundi
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FOREBU rebels attacked a FARDC position in Madjaga village in the Uvira area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Kasongo Faction
notes: Two Nyatura militias, one led by Colonel Kasongo and the other by General Benjamin, clashed in the Kivuye area of Bashali Mokoto following the pullout of FARDC from the area. One of the militias managed to caputre the area from the other.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 people were killed, including at least 6 members of the Nande ethnic group, and 5 others wounded when suspected Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters (also described as armed Hutu) attacked the Nande population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru. Huts were also reportedly burned down. Some sources described the event as a clash between Hutu and Nande, although civilians appear to have made up all the fatalities. The attack was allegedly in response to an attack by Nande on Hutus on Jul.17. FARDC soldiers intervened to end the fighting.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 4 Hutu were killed during an alleged attack by armed Nande on the Hutu population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

notes: A Mayi Mayi militia invaded the town of Kalera in order to release some of their colleagues. However, they had already been transferred, so the militiamen burned down the police station and then shot and beheaded a soldier.

notes: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.

assoc_actor_2: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
notes: A group of JUNAFEC members armed with knives attacked fellow members of their party associated with a different faction, resulting in serious injuries. Some of those involved were later arrested.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: 2 youths were killed in the Rutshuru area during fighting between Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen and another unidentified Mayi Mayi militia.

actor1: Bakabeya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Members of the Bakabeya clan allegedly attacked members of a rival clan in the Kisiki locality, stealing their property, burning their houses, and assaulting them during the incident. About 150 people were displaced as a result of the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR forces attacked a FARDC position in the Tongo-Rusheshe area of Rutshuru territory, resulting in 1 soldier and 1 FDLR rebel dead and 2 others injured. The FARDC soldiers were forced into a temporary withdrawal which allowed the FDLR rebels to burn their camp before the soldiers were able to return with reinforcements the next morning.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 14 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

notes: Fighting was reported between NDC-R and Nyatura forces in the Buluma area of Rutshuru.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: A coalition of three Mayi Mayi militias (Simba, Mangalibi and Simon) have occupied the mining area of Muchacha in the Okapi Wildlife Reserve in Ituri territory.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 17 people were abducted by 10 FRPI militiamen during raids on the localities of Mandibe 1 and 2 near Komanda in Ituri territory. A man was shot and two women raped during the assault.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After FRPI kidnapped 17 people in a raid in the Mandibe localities, FARDC soldiers intervened and freed some of the hostages during a clash with the FRPI.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Several members of Citizen Front, the G7, and other groups were arrested during a sit-in outside the office of the provincial assembly of Tshopo in Kisangani. They were demanding the release of a member of Citizen Front who had been arrested on Friday.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The residence of about 100 Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi students was burned down after the resumption of clashes between students of that institution and the University of Kisangani. It was not clear if a clash accompanied the arson, and no casualties were reported.

notes: 2 suspected ADF gunmen wearing old Ugandan military uniforms were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers near the border village of Kotongo.

Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Cases of 'ambushes, cattle theft, illegal collection of taxes, rape, looting and killings' have been reported to authorities in the Lubondja area between May-July 2016. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. The area is known to be a haven for FNL/Mayi Mayi groups.

actor1: M23: March 23 Movement
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: At least 11 people were killed and others wounded as clashes broke out between demobilized combatants and FARDC soldiers in Kamina. The FARDC soldiers allegedly opened fire on thousands of demobilized M23 combatants who were protesting against the delays surrounding their reintegration by the military authorities, killing at least 10 and wounding 4. A FARDC officer was also killed with a machete by the former combatants, and 4 other soldiers wounded. The former combatants allegedly tried to invade and loot the Kamina city centre.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
notes: Prisoners of the Dungu Central Prison rioted after the death of an inmate, leading to clashes with the prison guards. The administrator of Dungu territory says that the clashes were related to prisoners demands for improvement of conditions within the prison.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The violence was allegedly also related to reports that FDLR combatants were active in the IDP camp in the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 6 ADF rebels and 1 FARDC soldier were killed in a clash between the Kokola and Parking areas. At least 2 soldiers was also wounded and 2 ADF rebels captured. Artillery fire was heard during the clashes. The deputy commander of the ADF, Hood Lukwago, was among those killed.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: The headless body of a young man was found in the Nyakunde area of Ituri. ADF rebels are reportedly suspected due to the method of execution.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: LRA rebels were also reported to have attacked and looted another village in Bas Uele at the same time as their attack on Gamba in the Bili chieftaincy. No details were given on the second village attacked.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The protest was dispersed by riot police 'within minutes of beginning' and the federal secretary of the UNC was allegedly violently attacked by the police.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Goma against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. Police used tear gas to disperse the protest, which was banned, while the protesters threw stones, blocked roads and burned tires. At least one protester was also allegedly killed while trying to wrestle a rifle from a police officer, while 2 police and 5 protesters were wounded, and 20 people arrested.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Demonstrations were held in Moba against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was dispersed by the police who fired warning shots. Some arrests were reported.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kinshasa against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests had earlier been banned. Police fired tear gas to disperse the protesters which numbered around 5,000, and the protesters responded by throwing stones, wounding as many as 35 police officers. An MP of the MLC, Eve Bazaiba, also claims to have been shot by the police during the march.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kananga against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were banned in Kananga, resulting in at least one event prevented before it could begin, and others violently dispersed by the police.

actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

After a 2km march the police dispersed the protesters using warning shots, causing some wounds. MLC members participated in the protest.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police fired tear gas to disperse as many as several thousands supporters of Moses Katumbi outside the Lubumbashi courthouse. Police also allegedly 'chased with batons dozens of lawyers' who had arrived to defend Katumbi and all others being investigated in connection to disturbances in Lubumbashi for free. Several people were arrested and transferred to Kinshasa. Moise Katumbi was admitted to hospital following the incident for 'exhaustion and tear gas poisoning' and has since claimed that police 'injected him with an unknown substance' in order to kill him.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Around 500 motorcycle drivers protested on the main road of Niania, in the Isrio-Mambasa territory, over alleged demands of bribes by the Road Traffic Police (PCR). Police opened fire on the demonstrators, killing at least 4, including a student. The angry crowd then burned down houses surrounding the police station before the army arrived to disperse them. The PCR and Congolese Natonal Police commander was arrested by the military.

notes: FARDC forces dislodged 2 armed groups, including the Gumino, from several localities in the Bijombo highlands over 2 days of fighting between Apr.26-27. The locations recovered include Mikengne, Mikarati, Muramvya, Kinyonyi, Nyawaranga, Kajembwe and Bijombo Centre. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mahoro)
notes: Property destruction: Mayi Mayi Mahoro militiamen burned down the small market town of Mitamba in the Bijombo highlands during a FARDC offensive. No clashes or casualties were reported.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Two groups of MR activists, supporters of the parties president and those in opposition, clashed over control of the MRs HQ in Bukavu. Police arrived an arrested 2 members of the opposition MR activists, including 'the president of the Youth League of the opposition camp'.
