actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Property destruction: The HQ of UNADEF, a member of the G7 opposition coalition, in Lubumbashi was set on fire by a small group unidentified assailants. UNADEF activists blamed the police, but this could not be verified.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Employees of the General Directorate of Revenue of Mongala (DGREM) protested against the non-payment of their salaries, alongside members of the areas civil society.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: 2 sons of Pierre Lumbi, chairman of the MR party, a member of the G7 opposition coalition, were arrested in Lubumbashi on what Pierre Lumbi says are unfounded charges.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Opposition parties held a rally in front of the Martyrs Stadium in Kinshasa. During the rally, they called for more independence for the Constitutional Court and for political change. The rally also disrupted traffic in the area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: 19 Raia Mutomboki militiamen voluntarily surrendered to FARDC soldiers at a base in the Bakano sector of Walikale.

actor1: Nombe Ovungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Nombe Ovungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Two families in the Nombe Ovungu group in the Sankuru area clashed, with one person being stabbed to death, over exploitation of a forest in their area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Care workers of the MIBA hospitals in Dipumba and Bonzola engaged in a strike to demand their wages for the past three months. They also staged a sit-in.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers clashed with Mayi Mayi Gumino militiamen in Kajembwe in the Bijombo highlands area. 2 Gumino militiamen were killed and 5 wounded. They were also dislodged from the area.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: LRA rebels ambushed 6 people between Dungu and Sambia, stealing their property and forcing them to transport it before releasing them.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police forces used tear gas to disperse as many as 5,000 UNAFEC demonstrators angry at the involvement of police in interfering with their party HQ in the city and calling for the ouster of President Kabila. The protesters allegedly clashed with police, injuring 5 of them, and vandalized shops. 13 protesters were arrested. At least 1 American and 3 others foreigners were also allegedly arrested.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers turned an ambush by FDLR rebels on Ishasha road in the Kitwiguru area. 5 rebels were killed during the fighting.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: LRA rebels abmushed 6 artisanal miners near Sambia, while traveling to Dungu. They had their property stolen and were kidnapped, but 4 managed to escape.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
notes: UNAFEC offices in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi were allegedly invaded by police (or 'bandits' supervised by security forces, depending on the article) who damaged property and took down party banners and other effects. In Lubumbashi UNAFEC supporters threw stones at men in uniform who took a portrait of the former government of Katanga, Moise Katumbi. Many youth were allegedly arrested and others wounded during the incident.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
notes: Property destruction: UNAFEC offices in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi were allegedly invaded by police (or 'bandits' supervised by security forces, depending on the article) who damaged property and took down party banners and other effects.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 3 FARDC soldiers died of their injuries after an ambush by the FDLR in the Buvunga area of Rutshuru. The deaths were alternatively reported to have occurred during an attack on a camp in the Katale area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 people were killed in clashes between FARDC soldiers and Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Biakato area. 11 of those killed were militiamen. 3 others were also injured.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Property destruction: Police torched around 140 houses in the village of Asanga Kianga, allegedly in retaliation for the death of a police officer as he carried out his duties by a resident of the village.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
assoc_actor_1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_2: Mercy Corps; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 5 aid workers of the NGO Mercy Corps were abducted by alleged Nyatura fighters and FDLR in the Mushikiri area between Nyanzale and Kikuku. The workers were later released.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Kawangu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked the Kawangu locality, near Geti. One woman wounded an FRPI fighter with a machete while attempting to resist their pillaging, and was in turn injured by gunfire. Overall, 41 separate attacks were carried out by FRPI in April, primarily in the areas surrounding Geti and Aveba. Dates not provided.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: At least 2 people were killed and 8 injured, including a policeman and a soldier, following rioting by the resident of Kolwezi after police allegedly killed 2 people while attempting to steal a motorcycle the night before. The police are reported to have fired on the crowd when its members demanded to see the bodies of those killed. 2 bodies were later found in a nearby lake, and are believed to have died in relation to the rioting in Kolwezi.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 men in police uniforms allegedly attempted to steal a motorcycle from a private residence and killed 2 people who attempted to resist them. 1 woman was also injured.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 2 women were wounded by gunfire and 2 others kidnapped and property stolen during raids by FRPI militiamen against at least 7 villages in the Walendu Bindi chieftaincy, near Irumu.

actor1: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
notes: Movement of forces: Hundreds of Rwandan soldiers allegedly crossed into DR-Congo territory in the Buhimba area while searching for FDLR forces.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 people were killed in an explosion either caused by a car bomb or grenade targeting a vehicle on the main street of Bukavu, in the Ibanda municipality.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 men were allegedly killed by their sons after the sons accused their fathers of being 'witches' following the deaths of a sister and brother due to childbirth and malaria respectively.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (PARECO)
notes: Mayi Mayi Pareco and Nyatura militiamen have allegedly committed 'several atrocities' against residents of the town of Kalembe in North Kivu. They are also accused of holding residents of the village hostage and levying taxes against them.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by FRPI militiamen during an ambush in the town of Kolu near Aveba. Overall, 41 separate attacks were carried out by FRPI in April, primarily in the areas surrounding Geti and Aveba. Dates not provided.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 villages in the Kitababeya group in the Salamabila area of Maniema were attacked by 4 heavily armed men in military uniforms. In the first village they looted property, kidnapped people, and raped at least one woman. 4 people were also seriously injured in the attack. The second village saw looting and 'torture' of the resdients, but no cases of rape or serious injuries, although one woman was reported to have two broken ribs.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by ADF rebels during an ambush in the Opira area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
notes: 55 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militias (led by Kokodikoko and Dembi Kaboyi) between the villages of Kifuko and Kamituga. At least 18 people were also raped and property stolen.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of Nizi and workers of the SOKIMO gold minig company staged a demonstration to oppose the signing of a gold mining agreement between the their company and another.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: More than 10 people were injured during a clash between students of the Higher Institute of Agronomic Studies Bengamisa and police in Bayaswa, near Kisangani (Tshopo). The dispute started over the arrest of a student by traffic police.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Heavy weapons firing was heard in the Kiliba area where FARDC soldiers have been staging an offensive against FNL rebels in conjunction with the Burundian army (which is operating on its side of the border).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents of the Binza area demonstrating after the death of a 'Hutu president' in the area were engaged by the military, which arrested many of them. Few details were available on the event.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
assoc_actor_1: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: A local Lendu leader looted= allegedly seized about 390 cows from Hema community members while accompanied by suspected FRPI militiamen. 80 cows were later reclaimed by Hema community members peacefully.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A young girl was injured during a funeral march for a the recently killed 'Hutu president' of the area when an unidentified assault opened fire on the crowd. The march seems to have also seems to have been a demonstration, as protesters were later arrested by the military.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Nyamilima Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of the Binza area beat a soldier who came upon the murder of the 'Hutu president' of the Binza group. It was not clear if they thought he had killed him, or if there was another reason for the violence. 2 people were seriously injured during the incident when the soldier fired on the crowd while attempting to escape. He was then 'arrested and stoned by the angry crowd', which led to his death.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Suspected Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Binza area killed the 'Hutu president' of Binza group.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mabala)
notes: A traditional leader from Kimbili village was kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki Mabala militiamen.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
notes: Clashes have occurred recently in the Lulingu between the Raia Mutomboki Kazimoto and Kyakwama militias on one side and the Kabazimiya faction on the other have resulted in the deaths of at least 4 civilians, all of whom are reportedly members of the family of the Kyakwama militias leader. These clashes were sparked by the killing of the Kabazimiya leaders son on Apr.27, which is when they started (first reported on May.12).

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Some Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters killed the traditional leader of Zanganano village in the Boshimo area of Bashali Mokoto grouping.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Health providers at 25 health centers, including a general hospital in the Oicha area, observed a work stoppage to protest insecurity in the area.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Kahuzi-Biega National Park
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified armed men fired on Kahuzi-Biega park guards. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified armed men referred to as poachers looted property and raped women in the Wamba area, including in the villages of Bapoa, Opiko, Baza and Agoyo. Sudanese soldiers and LRA rebels are known to poach in the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki Mabala militiamen were reported in the Bushamba area of Kabare territory. 9 were killed, including 4 soldiers and 5 rebels, with 2 soldiers injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A FARDC soldier allegedly shot a woman in the chest in the Walikale area, injuring her. No other information was provided in the report.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Movement of forces: Heavy weapons have allegedly been moved into Lubumbashi by FARDC, including tanks. Residents have expressed concern that the stockpiling of heavy weapons systems is connected with the coming elections.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen were reported to have committed 'many atrocities against civilians' during an occupation of the mining town of Muchacha in Ituri. Specifically, at least 2 women were raped by militiamen and property was looted, before they withdrew from the area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Kahuzi Biega National Park
notes: A park ranger in Kahuzi Biega National Park was killed by suspected rebels, although their affiliation was not reported.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mirage)
notes: Raia Mutomboki-Mirage militiamen have occupied the villages of the Bakonjo grouping of Walikale after the withdrawal of FARDC soldiers.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Garamba National Park
notes: An LRA rebel involved in poaching was killed by Garamba park guards.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala forces in the Nindja area of Kabare have caused displacement of residents to Kalonge. 4 soldiers and 3 militiamen were reported killed.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: FARDC soldiers have withdrawn from the Ihana area of Walikale, followed by an occupation by NDC-R forces.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A man was killed by an unidentified group in Kamuronza group in Masisi territory, causing residents of the area to take refuge in neighbouring groups.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of Mugunga protested and blocked roads to demand a verdict against those believed to be behind the killing of the 'leader' of Mugunga.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Hundreds of Brasimba officers staged a work stoppage in Lubumbashi after it was announced that some benefits would be halved and others eliminated.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers allegedly arbitrarily detained a boatman and demanded a ransom before releasing him in the Kabeya-Kamuanga area.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: During a clash between FDLR-Nyatura and FARDC forces in the Mpati area of Bashali Mokoto in Masisi territory, at least 2 FDLR rebels and 2 soldiers were killed. 1 FDLR rebel was also captured. APCLS forces allegedly also supported the FDLR-Nyatura fighters. This event was part of 3 days of clashes during which 12 rebels were reported to have been killed.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by an FDLR-Nyatura ambush near a bridge in the Mpati area of Bashali Mokoto in Masisi territory. This event was part of 3 days of clashes during which 12 rebels were reported to have been killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 1 civilian was killed and 2 others wounded during ADF attacks on FARDC positions in Kwele and Budaki, 22km east of Eringeti. MONUSCO forces arrived to support the FARDC soldiers.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels attacked a vehicle, killing its driver and kidnapping 7 people in the Armoirie area of Rwindi.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: Looting: LRA rebels ambushed and robbed civilians in the areas of Gongolo and Mabadaba respectively, 12km north of Ngilima.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: Mayi Mayi Nyatura militiamen raided Kizimba, firing indiscriminately and causing the population to flee.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FDLR, APCLS and possibly other Mayi Mayi militias fought against FARDC soldiers in the Mpati area of Mashali Mokoto between Mar.26-28 (other events coded elsewhere). 12 rebels were reportedly killed over the three days, along with other casualties (these 12 fatalities were split across the events).

actor1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Armed Mbororo allegedly laid an ambush for FARDC soldiers in the area of Ngilima. 3 of the assailants were killed, while some FARDC soldiers were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: LRA rebels fought with security forces in the Bondo area, resulting in 1 rebel killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FARDC soldiers dislodged FRPI militiamen from six of their camps in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom, situated in the Irumu area. Fatalities allegedly occurred, but specific numbers were not reported (coded as 10).

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: ADF rebels killed 1, caused injuries, kidnapped 2, and burned 28 houses during attacks on the Vudaki, Misongo and Kamvuyo villages in Npkele, in Beni territory.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: MONUSCO helicopters engaged in 'several offensives' against ADF rebels in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. Casualty numbers weren't reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: An unidentified armed group from South Sudan who were engaged in poaching attacked a FARDC position in the Ngilima area. 2 of the assailants were killed. Instances of South Sudanese military personnel poaching in the DR-Congo have been observed over the past few months. Other sources claimed 3 soldiers were also killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The 'leader' of the Goma suburb of Mugunga was killed by a group of assailants which included soldiers and the district chief of Lac Vert.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 1 civilian was killed and 3 others injured in an ADF ambush on the Mbau-Kamango axis.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: ADF forces attacked FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. The attack occurred near a bridge that led towards Uganda. Many ADF were reportedly wounded.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: Dungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: MONUSCO and Dungu local safety committee members established 'peacekeeping missions' in Kaka II and Dungu to end intercommunal tensions in the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 2 Mayi Mayi 'Karakara' militiamen laid an ambush for FARDC soldiers on a bridge in the Luberizi area. They were captured by the soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Catholic Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 March. Military forces killed a Catholic priest, who was also an activist, in Beni, Nord-Kivu.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: MONUSCO reported that 8 individuals, including the former head of the village of Kaitango, were kidnapped by FRPI militiamen in the region between Kaitango/Kaimagaro in the Bukiringi area.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Abuses against civilians were reportedly perpetrated by the FRPI between Mar.21-23.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Agents and managers of the SCPT (formerly OCPT) took to the streets at Beatrice Hotel in Kinshasa to prevent the Deputy Prime Minister in charge of telecommunications from holding a meeting intended to finalize a law on the liberalization of the telecom sector.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 100 people armed with knives and gasoline stormed the University of Goma campus, inuring several students and academic staff and burning offices. It was not clear whether the students/staff they injured were specifically Hutu. University staff say they were Nande, and they were angry that the university Head wasn't Nande, saying Hutu were taking control at other communities expense. 15 were later arrested by police.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: 23 people were abducted by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Chuma Maliene Jado. They were released after a payment of a ransom.

actor1: Bulana Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Waza Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were killed, as many as 100 injured, and nearly 530 residences destroyed during clashes between residents of Bulana and Waza armed with knives due to a land dispute between the two neighbouring villages in Djugu between Mar.21-22.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Looting: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Anyada, during which they robbed 4 houses. No casualties were reported.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 people were assaulted by FRPI militiamen in Kolu, near Gety. 1 FRPI militiamen was also killed in a reported exchange of gunfire, but the details were not clear.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI elements attacked the village of Kagaba, assaulting two women and kidnapping 4 others.

actor1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Armed Mbororo killed a man as a result of intercommunal tensions in the Kaka II region.

actor1: Bulana Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Waza Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were killed, as many as 100 injured, and nearly 530 residences destroyed during clashes between residents of Bulana and Waza armed with knives due to a land dispute between the two neighbouring villages in Djugu between Mar.21-22.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Angry residents of Djugu territory attacked police stations and an army post during ongoing clashes between two communal groups in the area over a land dispute. The residents allegedly don't support the presence of security forces in their area. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Special units of FARDC launched an operations against Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi. In the areas of Busumba and Kibarizo, militiamen reatreated in the face of FARDCs advance.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Special units of FARDC launched an operations against Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi. In the areas of Busumba and Kibarizo, militiamen reatreated in the face of FARDCs advance.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 2 FARDC soldiers were injured in an ambush by FRPI in the Batumbi locality, near Geti.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A priest from Bunyuka in Beni territory was killed by a group of 10 unidentified armed men who broke into the convent of his parish. The administrator of the Beni territory believes this was a targeted assassination. He was from the Nande ethnic group.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: A priest of the Congregation of Caracholine Nyamilima was seriously wounded (some source indicate killed) by gunmen while he was on his way to mass. The attack is believed to have been carried out by FDLR rebels.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Residents of Ngungu protested against killings in their area.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers have dislodged FDLR rebels from several localities of Walikale and Lubero, including Buleusa, Rusamambo, Mizinga, Rusoha and others as of Jan.31. At least 2 FLDR officers were killed, while weapons and combatants were captured during the operations.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI attacked Bikima in the Irumu area. They kidnapped 5 people to help them transport the goods.Approximately 70 cows and other property looted

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kabazimiya)
notes: At least 6 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutmomboki militiamen as they were on their way to a seminar on sexual violence in Lulingu. They were later ransomed.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 6 FRPI militiamen attacked Ozoba in the Irumu area, injuring 1 and looting property.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Students from various universities from the former Kasai Oriental province protested against the closing of their institutes in Mbuji Mayi.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Agreement: MONUSCO and FARDC agreed to resume military cooperation against the FDLR.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: Movement of forces: MONUSCO has deployed additional troops to the Alimba area, specifically focusing on the DRCs border with Burundi.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Employees of the Provincial Divison of Mines observed a work stoppage to demand the departure of their Head of Divison whom they accuse of mismanagement.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: FDLR rebels allegedly kidnapped 50 families and burned their homes in the Bushalingwa locality of the Ikobo group, which straddles the Lubero and Walikale territories.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Police killed a human rights activist and seriously injured 3 others during a demonstration against the Banro mining companies failure to fulfill its commitments to the local community.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Parents and teachers demonstrated in several cities in South Kivu to protest against the treatment of teachers by parents in schools.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: Looting: Mayi Mayi militiamen looted livestock from areas along the Yalingo-Yomayi axis in the Opala area.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Arrests: 8 local leaders of the Nande community in Nyamilima were arrested on suspicion of setting fire to the home of a local MP. The arrests have led to tensions between the Nande and Hutu communities in the area.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: A young man who escaped ADF kidnappers reported that a group of people were taken in Beni territory and transported to a location near Oicha. At least 5 were killed after chosing not to join the rebel group.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 3 people were killed and 4 injured in an attack by the FDLR on Virira village in Lubero territory, about 40km away from Miriki.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Government forces have forced 'local and foreign armed groups' to retreat from the Miriki area. These militias have moved towards the towns of Kamandi and Bunyatenge.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Government forces have forced 'local and foreign armed groups' to retreat from the Miriki area. These militias have moved towards the towns of Kamandi and Bunyatenge.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A coalition of opposition political parties held demonstrations in Goma to commemorate those who died in marches against the revision of the electoral laws in January 2015.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 5,000 people protested in Bukavu to demand the holding of presidential elections in 2016.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: G7 Opposition Coalition; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: After G7 leaders and supporters entered the Moise Tshombe Square, police and soldiers appeared and prevented the groups from engaging in their demonstration. A member of UNAFEC and journalists fromt he AFP and BBC were arrested and released an hour later. About 100 people were arrested (this number also includes the Kinshasa demonstration which was prevented)

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Arrests: A G7 demonstration to demand presidential elections in 2016 was prevented by police in Kinshasa. About 100 people were arrested (this number also includes the Lubumbashi demonstration which was disrupted).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: Suspected LRA gunmen attacked park rangers in the Karuruma area of the Virunga National Park. The rangers managed to repulse the attackers, killing one. The LRA has been known to engage in poaching in the area and to conduct attacks against park rangers.

actor1: Biakatu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Angry residents of the Biakato area killed a person and burned some houses of Yira (a subset of the Nande ethnic group) members of the community after a traditional leader was killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Biakatu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A traditional leader was reportedly assassinated in the Biakato area, leading to violence by local residents.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 4 FRPI militiamen were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers in the Burasi locality. The military returned 68 cows the militia had stolen to citizens of the area.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: 35 people were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Mambaka locality, close to Biakatu.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: An armed group (believed to be the ADF) fired on a MONUSCO helicopter flying southeast of Eringiti, causing some minor damage.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda; Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: Agreement: 28 members of armed groups surrendered to MONUSCO forces between Jan.13-20. The 28 included 10 Raia Mutomboki militiamen, 7 FDLR, and a number of individuals from other groups, including Bakata Katanga and Kifuafua Mayi Mayi groups.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

notes: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
notes: Residents of Uvira have reported grenades being thrown at night, allegedly by Burundian refugees and/or rebels that have recently crossed the border.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: Armed men looted a dozen houses in the Kinawa neighbourhood in Kirumba, where they took livestock and other property.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: In response to the attacks on Opira, FARDC and MONUSCO forces conducted artillery shelling and helicopter bombardment of ADF locations east of Opira.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels ambushed some motorcyclists, killing 1 and injuring another.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

notes: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen in the Butsha area after they fired upon their vehicle.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The leader of the FRPI militia which operates primarily in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in the Bunia area has agreed to bring his militia in and join the disarmament, demobilization and reintrgration process.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: After artisanal miners tried to peacefully block FARDC soldiers who were trying to confiscate a shipment of ore, the soldiers opened fire on them, injuring nine, six seriously.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FRPI militiamen attacked Boga market and looted cattle. FARDC soldiers deployed quickly and pushed the attackers to Modohiro, where they captured one FRPI member.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers conducted military operations against the Bede Mayi Mayi militia in the Sange and Kinanira (near Uvira) areas, captured 5 members of the group.

actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: At least 2 ADF rebels were killed during a simultaneous attack by the ADF on FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Opira area of beni territory. At least 5 soldiers were seriously injured, with 4 dying of their wounds the next day.

actor1: Bongwele Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In Makanza, a group of youths from Bongwele district clashed with a youth self-defense group in another district after a string of robberies allegedly caused by someone who lives in their area. Both sides used sticks and knives and no casualties were reported.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: A MONUSCO helicopter was hit by ADF gunfire near Eringiti. There were no casualties and little damage.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FARDC soldiers recpatured Mbwaviniwa from the FDLR on Monday following violent clashes over the weekend. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: FARDC soldiers clashed with ADF rebels around Topoke village in the Beni area. 2 ADF rebels were killed in the fighting.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: GRSP: The Coalition of Revival Churches Congo; Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Thousands of woman took to the streets to call for peace and the preservation of democracy in Kinshasa and Ituri.

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FARDC soldiers have recaptured 5 locations, including Mbwaviniwa, Mukeberwa, Kanune and Rusamambu, from FDLR rebels since launching an operation on Jan.9 in the Lubero area following a mass killing in Miriki.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers clashed with Raia Mutomboki militiamen in the Kambali locality of Kalehe territory. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
notes: Movement of forces: Civil society sources reported that 80 unidentified armed men crossed the border from Burundi into DR-Congo in the Kalehe area.

actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
assoc_actor_1: Refugees/IDPs (Burundi); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Refugees in the Lusenda camp attacked humanitarian offices after a food delivery was delayed. 2 people were injured during a panic caused by the riot.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Members of the UPDI Mayi Mayi militia (which is largely Nande) captured 3 suspected Hutu FDLR rebel group and burned them alive in a reprisal for their targeting of Nande in a recent series of attacks in the Miriki area.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 civilians were killed and 9 injured by alleged FDLR rebels who targeted specific victims during the night of Jan.6-7. The FDLR denied that they were involved in the incident. At least 3 of the injured later died, including a pregnant woman. The attack appears to have largely targeted members of the Nande ethnic group, and the majority of those killed were allegedly women and children.

notes: 05 January. ADF elements attacked Nyaleke, killing 5 civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers killed 6 Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen and captured another in the Kalehe area.

actor2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 05 January. ADF elements ambushed FARDC soldiers along the Mbau-Kamango road, killing two soldiers and wounding three others.

actor2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were injured during clashes between members of the Nande and Hutu communities in the Miriki and Luhofu areas of Lubero.

notes: 5 Raia Mutomboki militia leaders affiliated with the Shukuru group have recently taken control of a group of villages in Kalehe territory, including Mubuku Lailai, Musenyi and Ramba, after being forced out of their previous locations by FARDC and have set up their headquarters in Mushenge and Ekingi.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: Looting: FNL rebels have allegedly been infiltrating Uvira and the surrounding area, resulting in a significant rise in looting of food and livestock, to the point where a malnutrition has become a serious concern according to NGOs working in the area.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Prisoners climbed onto the roof to demonstrate against the bad conditions and slow processing of their judicial records.
